original: 'dir rnam par 'byed pa'i gzhung 'ga' zhig las mar dang 'brel ba ni mar la'o //🔽'bru mar dang 'brel pa ni 'bru mar la'o //
analyzed: 'dir rnam par 'byed pa'i gzhung 'ga' zhig las mar dang 'brel ba ni mar la'o // 'bru mar dang 'brel pa ni 'bru mar la'o //
translated: Here, some texts on the Vinaya explain it as follows: “That which is related to butter is in the butter.🔽That which is related to oil is in the oil.

original: sbrang rtsi dang 'brel pa ni sbrang rtsi la'o //🔽hvags dang 'brel pa ni hvags la'o //
analyzed: sbrang rtsi dang 'brel pa ni sbrang rtsi la'o // hvags dang 'brel pa ni hvags la'o //
translated: That which is related to honey is in the honey.🔽That which is related to molasses is in the molasses.”

original: 'brel pa dang bcas pa ni 'brel pa dang bcas pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa dang bcas pa ni 'brel pa dang bcas pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “That which is related” is related.

original: don tha dad pas 'di lta bu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: don tha dad pas 'di lta bu nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: It is established in this way by means of different meanings.

original: ltung ba de yod na yo byad tsam bdag gir byas pa la spang ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i ltung byed de yod na'o //
analyzed: ltung ba de yod na yo byad tsam bdag gir byas pa la spang ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni spang ba'i ltung byed de yod na'o //
translated: “If there is that offense, there is the abandonment of mere possessions” means that if there is that offense that is a downfall that requires relinquishment.

original: rang bzhin gyis ma grub pa la spang ba'i ltung byed dag tu byed pa la gang du yo byad 'ga' zhig la spang ba'i ltung byed las skyes pa nyid do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ma grub pa la spang ba'i ltung byed dag tu byed pa la gang du yo byad 'ga' zhig la spang ba'i ltung byed las skyes pa nyid do //
translated: In regard to that which is not established by nature, the downfalls that require relinquishment are created. In regard to some possessions, the downfall that requires relinquishment is created.

original: 'di ni spang ba'i ltung byed las ma skyes pa nyid byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni spang ba'i ltung byed las ma skyes pa nyid byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as not being created from a downfall that requires relinquishment.

original: spang ba nyid tsam la cho ga 'di lta ste spang ba'i ltung byed rang bzhin gyis ma byas pa nyid la ji srid du thams cad 'grub pa dngos po thams cad de dngos po gang las ltung ba de bskyed pa de'i dngos po bzhin du de la yang
analyzed: spang ba nyid tsam la cho ga 'di lta ste spang ba'i ltung byed rang bzhin gyis ma byas pa nyid la ji srid du thams cad 'grub pa dngos po thams cad de dngos po gang las ltung ba de bskyed pa de'i dngos po bzhin du de la yang
translated: This is the rite for merely abandoning, that is, for the natural non-performance of a downfall.

original: bral ba ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: bral ba ma byas pa'o //
translated: As long as one does not accomplish all, that is, all the things that generate the downfall, one does not abandon the thing that is the basis of the downfall.

original: de'i phyir ltung ba ni bshags par bya mi dgos te //
analyzed: de'i phyir ltung ba ni bshags par bya mi dgos te //
translated: Therefore, one need not confess the downfall,

original: de'i gzhi las ltung ba ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gzhi las ltung ba ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the downfall does not occur on the basis of that thing.🔽Here, the treatise states:

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis chos gos spang ba ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba de yang ma bshags par gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang spang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis chos gos spang ba ma spangs shing bral bar ma byas la ltung ba de yang ma bshags par gzhan zhig rnyed na de yang spang ba yin te /
translated: If a monk does not abandon, that is, part with, the abandoned robe, and does not confess that downfall, and then obtains another, that one is also abandoned.

original: snga ma'i @137b shugs kyis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma'i @137b shugs kyis so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The former carries over to the latter.🔽That portion of the small robe does not change.

original: chung ba nyid kyi dum bu de ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la de ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni spang ba nyid do //
analyzed: chung ba nyid kyi dum bu de ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la de ni mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni spang ba nyid do //
translated: That does not change means that it is abandoned.

original: 'khor yug gi mtha' mnyam pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed rnams la de bas na ma tshang ba rnams la zhes bya bar gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor yug gi mtha' mnyam pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed rnams la de bas na ma tshang ba rnams la zhes bya bar gtogs pa'o //
translated: The “equal perimeter” is the same as the “equal circumference” in the downfalls that are to be abandoned.🔽“Not equal” means not complete.🔽“Not equal” means not complete.🔽“Equal” means complete.

original: 'khor yug mnyam pa las ma tshang ba nyid la dum bu ni spang ba nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor yug mnyam pa las ma tshang ba nyid la dum bu ni spang ba nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Not equal” means not complete.🔽“Equal” means complete.🔽“Not equal” means not complete.🔽“Equal” means complete.

analyzed: mi bya ste /
translated: “Not equal” means not complete.

analyzed: ltung byed 'ga' zhig bshags par bya'o //
translated: “Equal” means complete.🔽“Not equal” means not complete.🔽“Equal” means complete

original: lhag par gnas par bya ba ma yin zhes gsungs pa de nyid de rnams la lhag par gnas pa de 'dir bsdus pa yin no //🔽dge 'dun gyi yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun mnga' ba gang zag gis bdag nyid du ris su bcad pa dang / dge 'dun mnga' ris su ma bcad pa'o //🔽spang ba'i ltung byed dag gis yang 'chang ba dang 'bral ba dang 'jog pa de'i rgyus spang ba'i ltung byed rnams la yang der gang zag gcig pa dang 'dra bar gang zag re res bdag tu byas pas yang dag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par gnas par bya ba ma yin zhes gsungs pa de nyid de rnams la lhag par gnas pa de 'dir bsdus pa yin no // dge 'dun gyi yang ngo zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun mnga' ba gang zag gis bdag nyid du ris su bcad pa dang / dge 'dun mnga' ris su ma bcad pa'o // spang ba'i ltung byed dag gis yang 'chang ba dang 'bral ba dang 'jog pa de'i rgyus spang ba'i ltung byed rnams la yang der gang zag gcig pa dang 'dra bar gang zag re res bdag tu byas pas yang dag par gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase “they should not be kept” refers to the fact that they are included in the category of “kept.”🔽“The Saṅgha’s” refers to the Saṅgha’s possessions that have been assigned to an individual and those that have not been assigned to an individual.🔽“The offenses of wrong conduct” refers to the fact that, in the case of the offenses of wrong conduct, the individual who has incurred the offense of wrong conduct is the same as the one who is separated from the possession and who is the one who is keeping the possession.

original: dge 'dun mnga' ris su bcad pa'i dge 'dun dang 'brel pa la bdag tu byas pas su zhig med pas 'chang ba dang 'jog pa'i rgyus spang ba'i ltung byed dag gi yang skabs med pas gnas pa'i rgyus lhag par gnas pa la mnga' ris su ma bcad pa
analyzed: dge 'dun mnga' ris su bcad pa'i dge 'dun dang 'brel pa la bdag tu byas pas su zhig med pas 'chang ba dang 'jog pa'i rgyus spang ba'i ltung byed dag gi yang skabs med pas gnas pa'i rgyus lhag par gnas pa la mnga' ris su ma bcad pa
translated: “The Saṅgha’s” refers to the fact that, in the case of the Saṅgha’s possessions that have been assigned to an individual, the individual who is separated from the possession and who is keeping the possession is the same as the one who is keeping the possession that has not been assigned to an individual.

original: mi srid pa'i phyir gang zag gcig gis dge 'dun rigs su bcad pa dang lhag par 'brel ba gnas pa spang ba'i ltung byed la glag yod de de bas na mdo 'di yin no //
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir gang zag gcig gis dge 'dun rigs su bcad pa dang lhag par 'brel ba gnas pa spang ba'i ltung byed la glag yod de de bas na mdo 'di yin no //
translated: Because it is impossible, there is a single offense for a single person who has determined the Saṅgha, and who has a connection with the offense of abandoning the extra robe. Therefore, this is the sūtra.

original: 'dir gzhung ni nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las /
translated: Here is the text from the Upāliparipṛcchā:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi chos gos byin gyis brlabs nas mtshams kyi slad rol tu 'bral bar bgyid na chos gos dang bral zhes bgyi 'am ma bral zhes bgyi bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi chos gos byin gyis brlabs nas mtshams kyi slad rol tu 'bral bar bgyid na chos gos dang bral zhes bgyi 'am ma bral zhes bgyi bka' stsal pa /
translated: “Lord, if a monk, having consecrated a Dharma robe of the Saṅgha, separates from it outside the boundaries, should it be said that he is separated from the robe or not? He said:

original: chos gos dang bral zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos dang bral zhes bya'o //
translated: It should be said that he is separated from the robe.

original: chos gos de spang bar bgyi 'am /
analyzed: chos gos de spang bar bgyi 'am /
translated: Should that robe be abandoned?

original: nye ba 'khor mi bya ste /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi bya ste /
translated: Upāli, it should not be done.

original: ltung byed 'ba' zhig bshags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ltung byed 'ba' zhig bshags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Only the offense should be confessed.”

original: de bas na gang du rang nyid la gtad pa nyid ma yin pa ni @138a * //
analyzed: de bas na gang du rang nyid la gtad pa nyid ma yin pa ni @138a * //
translated: Therefore, where it is not entrusted to oneself,

original: 'di lta ste dge 'dun gyi chos gos de la bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dge 'dun gyi chos gos de la bya ba nyid do //
translated: it is just this: the Dharma robe of the Saṅgha.

original: 'di la med pa de nyid gtso bo'o zhes bya ba ni 'di la dngos po de yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'di la dngos po de med pas na med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la med pa de nyid gtso bo'o zhes bya ba ni 'di la dngos po de yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'di la dngos po de med pas na med pa'o //
translated: The absence of that thing here is the absence.

original: med pa'i dngos po ni med pa nyid do //
analyzed: med pa'i dngos po ni med pa nyid do //
translated: The absence of a thing is nonexistence.

original: de nyid spang ba nyid la gtso bo yin gyi spang bar bya ba'i rdzas ni gtso bo ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid spang ba nyid la gtso bo yin gyi spang bar bya ba'i rdzas ni gtso bo ma yin no //
translated: That itself is the primary thing to be abandoned, but the substance to be abandoned is not the primary thing.

original: thams cad med pas 'di la bya ba nyid du shes nas 'di la bya ba nyid du shes nas 'dir ci zhig bya ba zhes bya ba the tshom mi bya zhes bya ba 'di la 'di byed pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad med pas 'di la bya ba nyid du shes nas 'di la bya ba nyid du shes nas 'dir ci zhig bya ba zhes bya ba the tshom mi bya zhes bya ba 'di la 'di byed pa'o //
translated: Since everything is absent, knowing that this is the activity, one should not doubt, thinking, “What should be done here?”

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: Here is the text:

original: btsun pa dge slong gis chos gos spang ba nyams par gyur na ltung byed bshags par bgyi 'am /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis chos gos spang ba nyams par gyur na ltung byed bshags par bgyi 'am /
translated: “Venerable, if a monk abandons and loses his Dharma robe, should he confess a downfall?

original: nye ba 'khor ma dag pa ni bshags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor ma dag pa ni bshags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upāli, the impure should be confessed.”

original: 'di gsum ni sra brkyang bting ba la mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'chang ba 'am 'brel ba dang 'jog pa lhag par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gsum ni sra brkyang bting ba la mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni 'chang ba 'am 'brel ba dang 'jog pa lhag par gnas pa'o //
translated: These three do not occur when the kaṭhina has been spread.

original: thun mong ba ni song zin to /
analyzed: thun mong ba ni song zin to /
translated: The common is finished.

original: // / de nas so so'i skabs brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: // / de nas so so'i skabs brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, the individual sections should be stated.

original: gang du 'chad ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed bskyed ce na ;
analyzed: gang du 'chad ba'i spang ba'i ltung byed bskyed ce na ;
translated: Where is the downfalls that are discards of the kaṭhina generated?

original: de'i phyir yod na'o zhes bya ba smos te su yod ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir yod na'o zhes bya ba smos te su yod ce na /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “if it exists.”🔽If it is asked, “Who exists?”

original: de'i phyir rang gi nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “one’s own.”

original: thams cad la yang ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad la yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not all.

original: 'o na gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “What is it?”

original: de'i phyir zhag bcur rjes su zhugs pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhag bcur rjes su zhugs pa nyid do zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “It is the state of having entered for ten days.”

original: dus gang gi tshe spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: At what time is it discarded?

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi nyi ma'i dang po la'o zhes bya ba smos te rjes su zhugs pa'i dus 'di zhag bcur brjod pa gang yin pa de las gzhan pa'i zhag la dang por skya rengs 'char ba'i skad cig ma dang po la'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi nyi ma'i dang po la'o zhes bya ba smos te rjes su zhugs pa'i dus 'di zhag bcur brjod pa gang yin pa de las gzhan pa'i zhag la dang por skya rengs 'char ba'i skad cig ma dang po la'o //
translated: Therefore, he says, “on the first day of the other,” i.e., on the first day of the other than the ten days of the period of post-dissipation.

original: rang nyid gang du ste dus tsam gang zhig la yod pa na zhe na /
analyzed: rang nyid gang du ste dus tsam gang zhig la yod pa na zhe na /
translated: In what place, i.e., at what time, does one exist?

original: de'i phyir gos la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gos la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “on the cloth.”

original: thams cad du ma yin te 'on kyang 'khor gsum khebs ba'i mtha'i tshad la'o zhes bya ba la 'khor gsum zhes bya ba ni lte ba'i dkyil 'khor dang pus mo'i lha nga'i tshigs gnyis so //
analyzed: thams cad du ma yin te 'on kyang 'khor gsum khebs ba'i mtha'i tshad la'o zhes bya ba la 'khor gsum zhes bya ba ni lte ba'i dkyil 'khor dang pus mo'i lha nga'i tshigs gnyis so //
translated: Not everywhere, but rather on the measure of the extent of the covering of the three circles. The three circles are the navel-circle and the two knee-joints.

original: 'khor gsum po de dag chub par khebs pa'i mthar gyur pa'i khyon gyi tshad gang la yod pa de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'khor gsum po de dag chub par khebs pa'i mthar gyur pa'i khyon gyi tshad gang la yod pa de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: on the measure of the extent of the covering of the three circles.

original: 'di yang thams cad du ni ma yin te gzhan yang byin gyis brlabs pa dang ma 'brel pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di yang thams cad du ni ma yin te gzhan yang byin gyis brlabs pa dang ma 'brel pa la'o //
translated: This also is not everywhere, but rather on the other, i.e., on that which is not connected with the consecration.

original: gzhan yang 'brel kyang rjes su zhugs pa dang bcas pa la'o zhes bya ba ni 'brel kyang rjes su zhugs pa dang bcas pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'brel kyang rjes su zhugs pa dang bcas pa la'o zhes bya ba ni 'brel kyang rjes su zhugs pa dang bcas pa la'o //
translated: Moreover, “even if connected, it is with that which is accompanied by subsequent practice” means that even if connected, it is with that which is accompanied by subsequent practice.

original: yod pa nyid dang rjes su 'jug pa lhan cig tu rjes su 'jug pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang rjes su 'jug pa lhan cig tu rjes su 'jug pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is accompanied by subsequent practice and existence.

original: rang nyid las byung ba @138b dang gzhan las byung ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid las byung ba @138b dang gzhan las byung ba'o //
translated: It is arisen from oneself and arisen from another.

original: rang nyid kyis rjes su zhugs pa dang bcas pa la 'brel pa ni yul khyad par du gyur pa yongs su bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis rjes su zhugs pa dang bcas pa la 'brel pa ni yul khyad par du gyur pa yongs su bzung ba yin no //
translated: The connection with that which is accompanied by subsequent practice by oneself is the possession of a distinguished object.

original: 'di la gzhan yod na byin gyis ma brlabs pa de'i shan tshun chad nas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan yod na byin gyis ma brlabs pa de'i shan tshun chad nas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: “If another exists, it is up to the edge of that which is not consecrated” means

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rjes su zhugs pa dang bcas pa'i gos la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rjes su zhugs pa dang bcas pa'i gos la'o //
translated: “this” refers to the robe that is accompanied by subsequent practice.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa rjes su zhugs pa dang bcas pa de las gzhan byin gyis ma brlabs pa de'i shan tshun chad nas yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa rjes su zhugs pa dang bcas pa de las gzhan byin gyis ma brlabs pa de'i shan tshun chad nas yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “That which is not consecrated” means that which is not consecrated, other than that which is consecrated and accompanied by subsequent practice. The meaning is that it exists up to the edge of that.

original: shan tshun chad nas so zhes bya ba ni ma tshang ba la gtso bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shan tshun chad nas so zhes bya ba ni ma tshang ba la gtso bor 'gyur ro //
translated: The term “at least” in the phrase “at least one part” indicates that the robe is incomplete.

original: de ltar na yongs su dag pa nyid byin gyis brlabs pa la zhes bya ba 'di shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yongs su dag pa nyid byin gyis brlabs pa la zhes bya ba 'di shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the phrase “the consecration of complete purity” should be understood in this way.

original: 'dir gzhung ni nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las /
translated: Here is the scriptural source for this.🔽The Upalipariprﬁccha-sūtra says,

original: btsun pa dge slong gis chos gos de nyid zhag bcu las 'das pa yang lags la de nyid zhag gcig bral ba yang lags pa mchis sam nye ba 'khor yod de 'di lta ste /
analyzed: btsun pa dge slong gis chos gos de nyid zhag bcu las 'das pa yang lags la de nyid zhag gcig bral ba yang lags pa mchis sam nye ba 'khor yod de 'di lta ste /
translated: “Venerable One, is there a case where a monk’s robe has passed ten days and he is separated from it for one day?”🔽“Upali, there is.

original: dge slong gis chos gos rgyun ma chad par rgyun 'byung ba yang yin la /
analyzed: dge slong gis chos gos rgyun ma chad par rgyun 'byung ba yang yin la /
translated: Suppose a monk has a robe that has not been lost,

original: des chos gos 'byung ba de zhag bcu pa la byin gyis brlabs nas mtshams kyi phyi rol du chos gos de med par skya rengs 'char bar byed na /
analyzed: des chos gos 'byung ba de zhag bcu pa la byin gyis brlabs nas mtshams kyi phyi rol du chos gos de med par skya rengs 'char bar byed na /
translated: and he consecrates the robe for ten days and then rises in the morning and goes outside the boundary without the robe.

original: de la ji srid du yal ga dang lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu rnams la phan tshun 'brel par gyur pa der dge slong gi rgyang grags kho ra khor yug gar dga' bar chos gos bzhag ste der gar dga' bar skya rengs 'char bar bya'o zhes
analyzed: de la ji srid du yal ga dang lo ma dang me tog dang 'bras bu rnams la phan tshun 'brel par gyur pa der dge slong gi rgyang grags kho ra khor yug gar dga' bar chos gos bzhag ste der gar dga' bar skya rengs 'char bar bya'o zhes
translated: As long as the branches, leaves, flowers and fruits are mutually related, the monk should place his robes wherever he likes within a league in all directions and he should rise at dawn wherever he likes.🔽This is stated in the Vinaya.

original: ma mo las gsungs pa yin te gnas rnams thams cad la cho ga 'dis rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: ma mo las gsungs pa yin te gnas rnams thams cad la cho ga 'dis rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: This is the procedure for all abodes up to the statement: “This is the procedure.”

original: 'bral ba'i spang ba rnam par 'byed pa'o /
analyzed: 'bral ba'i spang ba rnam par 'byed pa'o /
translated: The analysis of the separation offense.

original: // / dam dum du gyur pa la byin gyis brlab pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // / dam dum du gyur pa la byin gyis brlab pa med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not that consecration is absent in a place that has become damaged.

original: spang ba la ni mi 'chags pa ma yin no zhes @142a * //
analyzed: spang ba la ni mi 'chags pa ma yin no zhes @142a * //
translated: It is not that confession is absent in a separation offense.

original: bya ba ni spang bar bya ba'i dngos po la byin gyis brlab pa mi 'chags par mi 'gyur ba ste rang nyid dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba ni spang bar bya ba'i dngos po la byin gyis brlab pa mi 'chags par mi 'gyur ba ste rang nyid dang ma bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This means that consecration is not absent in the object to be abandoned because it is not separated from itself.

original: gzhung kha cig las dge slong gis chos gos de nyid dgung bcu 'das pa yang lags la dgung gcig bral ba yang lags pa mchis sam /
analyzed: gzhung kha cig las dge slong gis chos gos de nyid dgung bcu 'das pa yang lags la dgung gcig bral ba yang lags pa mchis sam /
translated: Some texts say, “Is there a case where a fully ordained monk has that robe for more than ten days and also is separated from it for one day?”

original: bka' stsal pa yod de /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa yod de /
translated: He replied, “There is.

original: chos gos zhag bcu 'das pa yang yin la dge slong gis kyang de byin gyis brlabs te mtshams kyi phyi rol du skya rengs 'char par byed pa'o zhes gsungs te bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: chos gos zhag bcu 'das pa yang yin la dge slong gis kyang de byin gyis brlabs te mtshams kyi phyi rol du skya rengs 'char par byed pa'o zhes gsungs te bsdus pa yin no //
translated: It is when the robe is more than ten days old and the fully ordained monk consecrates it and rises with the dawn outside the boundary.”

original: dge slong gis kyang de byin gyis brlabs nas zhes bya ba la de byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba'i tshig ni 'dir 'chad pa zhes mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis kyang de byin gyis brlabs nas zhes bya ba la de byin gyis brlabs te zhes bya ba'i tshig ni 'dir 'chad pa zhes mthong ba yin no //
translated: The phrase “the fully ordained monk consecrates it” is explained here as “he consecrates it and rises with the dawn outside the boundary.”

original: dge 'dun gyi la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa mi 'chags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa mi 'chags pa ma yin no //
translated: “Also for the Saṅgha” means that consecration is not lost.

original: rang nyid kho nas dge slong la dge 'dun gyi nye bar longs spyod pa'i dus na rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du mang po yongs su thob ba re re nas nye bar longs spyod pa la mang po dang 'brel pa'i don nyid kyi phyir de las 'bral🔽bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kho nas dge slong la dge 'dun gyi nye bar longs spyod pa'i dus na rnam par gzhag pa de bzhin du mang po yongs su thob ba re re nas nye bar longs spyod pa la mang po dang 'brel pa'i don nyid kyi phyir de las 'bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of “many” is the very fact that it is to be enjoyed by many.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi byin gyis brlabs pa de las 'dir byin gyis brlabs pa bzung ba ni rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi byin gyis brlabs pa de las 'dir byin gyis brlabs pa bzung ba ni rgyu yin te /
translated: “From that” means from the Saṅgha’s consecration. Here, consecration is taken as the cause,

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du bzung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du bzung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but not as the cause of all.

original: de bas na dge 'dun gyis byin gyis brlabs pa las 'bral par yang 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de bas na dge 'dun gyis byin gyis brlabs pa las 'bral par yang 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is only from the Saṅgha’s consecration that one is separated from it.

original: gzhan gnas pas gzhan gyi gnas mi nyams so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan gnas pas gzhan gyi gnas mi nyams so zhes bya ba la /
translated: The other does not destroy the other’s status.

original: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni mtshan tha dad pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa 'am bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma yin pa byin gyis brlabs par gyur pa'i gnas las gnas gzhan nyid gang yin pa der byin gyis brlabs pas sam /
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni mtshan tha dad pa bsnyen par rdzogs pa 'am bsnyen par rdzogs pa ma yin pa byin gyis brlabs par gyur pa'i gnas las gnas gzhan nyid gang yin pa der byin gyis brlabs pas sam /
translated: Another means a different name, one who is either fully ordained or not fully ordained.

original: gzhan du na bsnyen par rdzogs pa nyid de ni nyams pa ma yin te bral ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na bsnyen par rdzogs pa nyid de ni nyams pa ma yin te bral ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: The full ordination itself is not lost through the consecration of another place, but it is lost through the consecration of another place, or through the consecration of another person.

original: gnas gzhan du byin gyis brlabs pa gzhan la bral ba ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba 'di yang 'di'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas gzhan du byin gyis brlabs pa gzhan la bral ba ma yin pa ste zhes bya ba 'di yang 'di'i rjes su 'brangs te rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This is also understood in the same way as the consecration of another place.🔽Here, the text says:

original: 'dir gzhung ni yi ge kha cig las dge slong la la zhig mu stegs can gyi gnas su chos gos bzhag ste ;
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni yi ge kha cig las dge slong la la zhig mu stegs can gyi gnas su chos gos bzhag ste ;
translated: “If a monk places his Dharma robes in a non-Buddhist’s house and

original: dge 'dun gyi gnas nyen gor gcig par gnas par bgyis na ltung bar mi 'gyur ba ma chis sam /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gnas nyen gor gcig par gnas par bgyis na ltung bar mi 'gyur ba ma chis sam /
translated: stays in a single place of the Saṅgha, is there no offense?”

original: bka' stsal pa yod de /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa yod de /
translated: The Buddha said, “There is.

original: gang zhig mu stegs can dang lhan cig bskos par ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig mu stegs can dang lhan cig bskos par ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one is appointed together with non-Buddhists.”

original: de bzhin du shing ljon pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shing ljon pa yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: In the same way, a tree is also like that.

original: dngos po gcig la @142b 'jug par rnam par rtog pa tsam du 'dir bskos par rig par bya'o //🔽chos 'di pa dang gzhan pa dag ni lta ba las shes pas ma 'phangs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa po rnams rnam par 'byed pa la lta ba las dbye ba zhes bya ba 'dis chos gzhan pa dang 'di pa dag ma
analyzed: dngos po gcig la @142b 'jug par rnam par rtog pa tsam du 'dir bskos par rig par bya'o // chos 'di pa dang gzhan pa dag ni lta ba las shes pas ma 'phangs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yongs su 'dzin pa po rnams rnam par 'byed pa la lta ba las dbye ba zhes bya ba 'dis chos gzhan pa dang 'di pa dag ma
translated: Here, it should be understood that the mere conceptualization of engagement in one thing is designated.🔽Those who hold this view are not free from the view, nor are those who hold other views. This is because those who hold views are not free from views.

original: 'phangs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phangs pa ma yin no //
translated: Those who hold this view are not free from the view, nor are those who hold other views.

original: thun mong ba dag gi sgo gang yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gnas du ma nyid kyi phyir sgo la sogs pa ni thun mong bar brjod do //
analyzed: thun mong ba dag gi sgo gang yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gnas du ma nyid kyi phyir sgo la sogs pa ni thun mong bar brjod do //
translated: The common ones are not any of the doors, because there are many bases. Therefore, the doors and so on are called common.

original: des ni sgo gang yang ma bsdus pa ma yin te bsdus pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: des ni sgo gang yang ma bsdus pa ma yin te bsdus pa kho na yin no //
translated: By that, nothing is not included in any door, but everything is included.

original: mdo 'di gnyis kyi gzhung ni 'di yin te dge 'dun gyi gnas dang mu stegs can gyi gnas nyen kor gcig par gnas par byed na sgo khang du gnas pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa grags par gyur pa de bas na 'di dang tha mi🔽dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: mdo 'di gnyis kyi gzhung ni 'di yin te dge 'dun gyi gnas dang mu stegs can gyi gnas nyen kor gcig par gnas par byed na sgo khang du gnas pa la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa grags par gyur pa de bas na 'di dang tha mi dad pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore they are not different.🔽The phrase “from wealth” also shows that father and son are not different.

original: nor las zhes bya bas pha dang bu dag kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nye bar 'dzin pa po rnams tha dad pa ni nor las gnas kyi dbye ba zhes bya ba 'dis pha dang bu dag kyang 'phangs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: nor las zhes bya bas pha dang bu dag kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni nye bar 'dzin pa po rnams tha dad pa ni nor las gnas kyi dbye ba zhes bya ba 'dis pha dang bu dag kyang 'phangs pa kho na'o //
translated: Those who possess it are different, but this is called “the division of abodes from wealth.” This also implies father and son.

original: spangs pa nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'byed pa nyid la tha dad pa nyid dang / nor gyis rnam par 'byed pa nyid ma yin pa la nor gyis tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di gang zhig 'dir lhung bzed kha sbub pas sam khrims su byas pas spangs pa nyid kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: spangs pa nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'byed pa nyid la tha dad pa nyid dang / nor gyis rnam par 'byed pa nyid ma yin pa la nor gyis tha dad pa nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di gang zhig 'dir lhung bzed kha sbub pas sam khrims su byas pas spangs pa nyid kyang de dang 'dra bar rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i
translated: This is to be understood as abandonment by the inverted bowl or by rule.🔽It is also the same in the case of being accompanied by food.

original: don to // zas dang bcas pa nyid la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'byed pa nyid la tha dad pa nyid dang nor gyis kyang rnam par 'byed pa nyid ma yin pa nyid la tha mi dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: don to // zas dang bcas pa nyid la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni rnam par 'byed pa nyid la tha dad pa nyid dang nor gyis kyang rnam par 'byed pa nyid ma yin pa nyid la tha mi dad pa nyid do //
translated: This means that in the case of separation, there is separation by distinction and separation by wealth, and in the case of non-separation, there is non-separation by distinction and non-separation by wealth.

original: tha mi dad pa nyid ces bya ba 'di kha zas dang bcas pa nyid la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa nyid ces bya ba 'di kha zas dang bcas pa nyid la yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is to be understood as being accompanied by food.

original: khang pa gcig pa nyid dang shing che ba gcig pa nyid dang gcig par gyur pa nyid la gzhan su dag rnams la cho ga 'di sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: khang pa gcig pa nyid dang shing che ba gcig pa nyid dang gcig par gyur pa nyid la gzhan su dag rnams la cho ga 'di sbyar ba'o //
translated: The same house, the same large tree, the same thing, are applied to others.

original: nyal po byed par shom pa nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba 'dir 'dug nas gnas pa brtag par byed cing 'khrig pa'i tshad dang ldan ba ltung byed rnams la zhes bya ba 'di la 'di bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nyal po byed par shom pa nyid kyang ngo zhes bya ba 'dir 'dug nas gnas pa brtag par byed cing 'khrig pa'i tshad dang ldan ba ltung byed rnams la zhes bya ba 'di la 'di bstan pa'o //
translated: And also when preparing to have sexual intercourse.

original: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs kyi zhu ba lhung bzed kha sbub pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs kyi zhu ba lhung bzed kha sbub pa las /
translated: Here, the text of the Kṣudraka Collection is as follows:

original: khyim bdag la khyim zhig yod la de la du rab tu mang po dag bdog cing de yang nor tha dad pa'i khyim ma yin pa la khyim bdag rnams kyang lhan cig gnas pa yin na khyim gcig yin par brjod par bya ste /🔽'dir phyis gnon ma byas shing @143a * //
analyzed: khyim bdag la khyim zhig yod la de la du rab tu mang po dag bdog cing de yang nor tha dad pa'i khyim ma yin pa la khyim bdag rnams kyang lhan cig gnas pa yin na khyim gcig yin par brjod par bya ste / 'dir phyis gnon ma byas shing @143a * //
translated: A householder had a house, and in it there were many holes. And it was not a house with separate wealth, and the householders were co-residents. It should be said that it is one house.🔽Here, if later no repairs are made,

original: yongs su gcod par mi 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: yongs su gcod par mi 'gyur na'o //
translated: and it is not completely cut off.

original: gal te des slar nor bgos par gyur na khyim tha dad pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te des slar nor bgos par gyur na khyim tha dad pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: If he then redistributes the property, he commits a downfall for each household.

original: bu de rnams ji snyed pa dag dang 'brel pa ji snyed pa yod pa rnams dang mna' ma ji snyed pa de rnams 'khod pa thams cad la phyis gnon byas shing 'dug pa'am /
analyzed: bu de rnams ji snyed pa dag dang 'brel pa ji snyed pa yod pa rnams dang mna' ma ji snyed pa de rnams 'khod pa thams cad la phyis gnon byas shing 'dug pa'am /
translated: He commits a downfall for each of the sons, for each of the relatives, and for each of the daughters-in-law who are present.

original: skyabs yod pa na 'greng ba'i ltung byed re rer 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: skyabs yod pa na 'greng ba'i ltung byed re rer 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He commits a downfall if he stands in a hidden place and does not make a redistribution.

original: de ltar khyim bdag rnams kyang lhan cig gnas pa yin la zhes bya ba ni khyim gcig tu gyur pa nyid bstan to //🔽phyis gnon ma byas shing 'dug par gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di la phyis gnon ma byas shing 'dug par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar khyim bdag rnams kyang lhan cig gnas pa yin la zhes bya ba ni khyim gcig tu gyur pa nyid bstan to // phyis gnon ma byas shing 'dug par gyur pa zhes bya ba 'di la phyis gnon ma byas shing 'dug par yang 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, householders are also co-residents. This shows that they are in the same household.🔽He does not make a redistribution and he stands. In this case, he does not make a redistribution and he stands.

original: 'di'i mtshan ma can kha na ma tho ba gnyis la 'di'i mtshan ma tsam nyid kyis so sor nye bar gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di'i mtshan ma can kha na ma tho ba gnyis la 'di'i mtshan ma tsam nyid kyis so sor nye bar gnas pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: He does not stand in a hidden place, but he does not make a redistribution.

original: thams cad la phyis gnon ma byas shing 'dug la zhes bya ba 'di la thams cad phyis gnon ma byas par 'dug par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: thams cad la phyis gnon ma byas shing 'dug la zhes bya ba 'di la thams cad phyis gnon ma byas par 'dug par yang 'gyur te /
translated: The phrase all of them are not pressed down and remain means that all of them are not pressed down and remain.

original: so sor nye bar 'dug pa'i mtshan ma 'di gnyis ni gnas kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: so sor nye bar 'dug pa'i mtshan ma 'di gnyis ni gnas kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: These two characteristics of remaining separately are called by location.

original: grong la de yod pa ni gtsug lag khang gi nyen kor nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni grong la de zhes bya ba ni nye bar spyod pa'o //
analyzed: grong la de yod pa ni gtsug lag khang gi nyen kor nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni grong la de zhes bya ba ni nye bar spyod pa'o //
translated: The phrase in a village, that exists means that it is not the vicinity of a monastery.

original: yod pa zhes bya ba ni bdog pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa zhes bya ba ni bdog pa ste /
translated: The phrase that exists means is possessed.

original: gtsug lag khang gi nyen kor nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi nyen kor nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not the vicinity of a monastery.

original: grong gi nyen kor gyi don gang yin pa de ni gtsug lag khang gi nyen kor nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: grong gi nyen kor gyi don gang yin pa de ni gtsug lag khang gi nyen kor nyid ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of vicinity of a village is not the meaning of vicinity of a monastery.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig grong dang gtsug lag khang gi nyen kor 'brel bar gyur na chos gos dang mi 'bral bar ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa re zhig grong dang gtsug lag khang gi nyen kor 'brel bar gyur na chos gos dang mi 'bral bar ji ltar 'tshal bar bgyi /
translated: Here, the text of the question is: Venerable! If the vicinity of a village and the vicinity of a monastery are connected, how should one understand not being separated from one's robes?

original: nye ba 'khor grong gi nyen kor ma gtogs pa lhag ma las chos dang mi 'bral bar shes par bya zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor grong gi nyen kor ma gtogs pa lhag ma las chos dang mi 'bral bar shes par bya zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upali, except for the danger zone of the village, one should know that one is not separated from the Dharma in the rest.🔽Here, one should know that one does not rise from the boundary, and that one who seeks consecration is consecrated by the mere fact of remaining there, because of the individual nature of the boundary.

original: 'dir mtshams la ji ltar mi ldang ba dang byin gyis brlabs pa don du gnyer ba la shes par bya ba gnas pa nyid kyis so sor gyur pa nyid kyi phyir de bzhin du 'di la gang zhig gtsug lag khang la cung zad lhag par gnas pa'i dge
analyzed: 'dir mtshams la ji ltar mi ldang ba dang byin gyis brlabs pa don du gnyer ba la shes par bya ba gnas pa nyid kyis so sor gyur pa nyid kyi phyir de bzhin du 'di la gang zhig gtsug lag khang la cung zad lhag par gnas pa'i dge
translated: In the same way, here, a monk who dwells a little in the monastery,

original: slong khyim na gnas pas gnas khang du lhag par gnas na so sor gnas pa nyid de la zhes bya ba 'di yang 'dis byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: slong khyim na gnas pas gnas khang du lhag par gnas na so sor gnas pa nyid de la zhes bya ba 'di yang 'dis byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: if a householder dwells in the dwelling, he should know that he is consecrated by the mere fact of remaining there, because of the individual nature of the dwelling.

original: de bas na gnas khang dang 'brel pa'i rnam par gzhag pas 'di thob par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gnas khang dang 'brel pa'i rnam par gzhag pas 'di thob par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this should be understood as obtained by the arrangement connected with the dwelling.

original: gang zhig 'gro ba pos mtshan mo gcig la yang mtshams kyi sa phyogs 'ba' zhig na lhag par gnas pa de la de'i so sor @143b gnas pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'gro ba pos mtshan mo gcig la yang mtshams kyi sa phyogs 'ba' zhig na lhag par gnas pa de la de'i so sor @143b gnas pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: That which is the abode of a traveler for one night only in a certain place is called its temporary abode.

original: 'bral ba'i spang ba zhu ba'i skabs so /
analyzed: 'bral ba'i spang ba zhu ba'i skabs so /
translated: The section on the confession of the offense of separation.

original: // / kha bskang ba la re ba med na chung ba khru gang yan chad kyang chog pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni 'khor gsum khebs pa'i mtha'i tshad bzhin du 'dzin pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi las 'di zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: // / kha bskang ba la re ba med na chung ba khru gang yan chad kyang chog pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni 'khor gsum khebs pa'i mtha'i tshad bzhin du 'dzin pa dang / bslab pa'i gzhi las 'di zhugs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one has no hope of making up the robe, even a small one, one cubit or more, is sufficient. This means that one should hold to the measure of the extreme limit that covers the three areas, and that one should enter into what is called the basis of training.

original: med na zhes bya ba ni gnas ma zin pa la 'dir ji ltar rnam pa gang gis kyang bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: med na zhes bya ba ni gnas ma zin pa la 'dir ji ltar rnam pa gang gis kyang bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: If one does not have it, then how can one accomplish it here in any way, without taking up residence?

original: phyir 'ong ba la sdod pa ni re ba dang bcas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phyir 'ong ba la sdod pa ni re ba dang bcas par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the returner's stay is with hope.

original: 'dir chad ni re ba kun nas chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir chad ni re ba kun nas chad pa'o //
translated: Here, the end of hope is the end of all hope.

original: 'dir gzhung ni de chos gos la re ba gang yin pa de thams cad kyi thams cad du rgyun chad par gyur na dge slong des gos de nyi ma bcu pa de nyid kyi nang rol du gtang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas cho ga pa
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni de chos gos la re ba gang yin pa de thams cad kyi thams cad du rgyun chad par gyur na dge slong des gos de nyi ma bcu pa de nyid kyi nang rol du gtang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas cho ga pa
translated: The procedure is as stated in the sūtra.

original: zhes bya ba gang zhig der kha bskang bar gsungs pa 'khor gsum khebs pa'i mtha'i tshad du 'di chog par snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni khru gang yan chad kha bskang ba po la re ba med par gyur na khru gang yan chad du chog pa
analyzed: zhes bya ba gang zhig der kha bskang bar gsungs pa 'khor gsum khebs pa'i mtha'i tshad du 'di chog par snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni khru gang yan chad kha bskang ba po la re ba med par gyur na khru gang yan chad du chog pa
translated: “If it is sufficient” means that if the hope for the addition of more than one cubit is completely cut off, then it is sufficient if it is one cubit or more.

original: de zhag bcu'i mthar thug par btsang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de zhag bcu'i mthar thug par btsang bar bya'o //
translated: “It should be purified by the end of the ten days” means that if it is less than one cubit, it should be purified by the end of the ten days.

original: yod na ni khru gang yan chad nye bar bskul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par gzhag pa 'di'o //
analyzed: yod na ni khru gang yan chad nye bar bskul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnam par gzhag pa 'di'o //
translated: “If it is more than one cubit, it should be requested” means that this is the rule.

original: byin gyis brlab par bya ba yod pa nyid yin na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni kha bskang ba bzhin du rdzogs par gyur pa la khru gang las chog pa dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab par bya ba yod pa nyid yin na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni kha bskang ba bzhin du rdzogs par gyur pa la khru gang las chog pa dang 'dra bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: If there is something to be consecrated, it is just like that. This should be seen as similar to the completion of a cubit or more in a supplement.

original: 'dir gzhung ni mdo'i tshig las chung na kha bskang bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni mdo'i tshig las chung na kha bskang bar bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Here, the text is from the words of the sutra: If it is smaller, it should be supplemented.

original: byin gyis brlab par bya ba la 'di 'dir kha bskang ba nyid du mngon par 'dod pa de gang gi phyir 'dir de'i rnam par 'byed pa ni 'di yin te ma chog pa kha bskang ba'i don du 'am zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar gyi 'am mthang gos
analyzed: byin gyis brlab par bya ba la 'di 'dir kha bskang ba nyid du mngon par 'dod pa de gang gi phyir 'dir de'i rnam par 'byed pa ni 'di yin te ma chog pa kha bskang ba'i don du 'am zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar gyi 'am mthang gos
translated: This consecration is clearly intended here as a supplement. The reason for this is that this is its analysis: For the sake of supplementing what is insufficient means for the patched robe or the lower robe.

original: kyi'o zhes bya bas 'dir 'am gyi sgra ni nyams pa mthong ba yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: kyi'o zhes bya bas 'dir 'am gyi sgra ni nyams pa mthong ba yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Or here means seeing a deficiency.

original: phran tshegs kyi zhu ba pa'i nang nas kyang gzhung 'di yin te zla ba gcig gi mthar thug pa'i chos gos ni 'di yin te gang la chos gos gsum tshang bar yod pa des de gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: phran tshegs kyi zhu ba pa'i nang nas kyang gzhung 'di yin te zla ba gcig gi mthar thug pa'i chos gos ni 'di yin te gang la chos gos gsum tshang bar yod pa des de gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: The one who has all three robes should not put it aside.

original: ci ste 'jog na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste 'jog na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If he does put it aside, it is a pāyattika offense.

original: gang la 'jog pa'i spang ba 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: gang la 'jog pa'i spang ba 'byung zhe na /
translated: What is the offense for putting it aside?

original: de'i phyir gzhan du na de ni zhag sum cu 'das na'o zhes bya ba ni kha bskong ba po la re ba la yod pa dang byin gyis brlab par bya ba med pa nyid na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan du na de ni zhag sum cu 'das na'o zhes bya ba ni kha bskong ba po la re ba la yod pa dang byin gyis brlab par bya ba med pa nyid na'o //
translated: Therefore, “if it is otherwise, then after thirty days have passed” means that if the one who is expecting has no hope and there is no consecration.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni chung ba khru gang yan chad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni chung ba khru gang yan chad pa'o //
translated: “That” means the small one, one cubit and more.

original: zhag @144a * //
analyzed: zhag @144a * //
translated: “Thirty days”

original: sum cu 'das na'o zhes bya ba ni zhag sum cu rtsa gcig gi skya rengs dang po shar na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sum cu 'das na'o zhes bya ba ni zhag sum cu rtsa gcig gi skya rengs dang po shar na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means that after the first dawn of the thirty-first day, it is the end of the time.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis chos gos sngon po rnyed la byed du mi 'jug ces bya ba la sogs pa dang / zhu ba las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong des zla ba gcig gi mthar thug par chos gos gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis chos gos sngon po rnyed la byed du mi 'jug ces bya ba la sogs pa dang / zhu ba las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong des zla ba gcig gi mthar thug par chos gos gzhag par bya'o //
translated: ‘The Blessed One said that monk should keep the cloth for one month at most.

original: chos gos ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: chos gos ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of cloth?

original: 'khor gsum mi khebs pa gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum mi khebs pa gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which does not cover the three areas.’🔽It is not proper to have cloth of a different color and so on.

original: kha dog la sogs pa las rigs mi mthun pa ni chog pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di la 'grub pa nyid du rtsom pa nyid 'dir gang zhig re ba gang yin pas ni re ba dang bcas pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to
analyzed: kha dog la sogs pa las rigs mi mthun pa ni chog pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'di la 'grub pa nyid du rtsom pa nyid 'dir gang zhig re ba gang yin pas ni re ba dang bcas pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to
translated: The meaning of the statement ‘he should not have it made into robes with the hope of obtaining another’ is that he should not hope for another.🔽Here the treatise states:

original: // 'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar gang gi tshe de dang 'dra ba rnyed par gyur na'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: // 'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar gang gi tshe de dang 'dra ba rnyed par gyur na'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‘When he finds cloth like that.’

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rigs mi mthun pa tha dad pa bal gos dang ras gos la sogs pa lta bu thams cad bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rigs mi mthun pa tha dad pa bal gos dang ras gos la sogs pa lta bu thams cad bsdu'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes all the different kinds of cloth that are not of the same kind, such as woolen cloth and linen cloth.

original: kha dog ces bya ba'i sgras ni 'dir sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang de dag gi bye brag las byas pa dag kyang bsdu'o //🔽dkar po nyid ni kha dog thams cad pa nyid do zhes bya ba la kha dog thams cad pa ni kha dog thams cad pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog ces bya ba'i sgras ni 'dir sngon po dang ser po dang dmar po dang de dag gi bye brag las byas pa dag kyang bsdu'o // dkar po nyid ni kha dog thams cad pa nyid do zhes bya ba la kha dog thams cad pa ni kha dog thams cad pa'o //
translated: The word “color” includes here blue, yellow, red, and those that are made from their combinations.🔽“Whiteness” is the universal of all colors.

original: de'i dngos po ni dkar po nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni dkar po nyid do //
translated: The universal of all colors is whiteness.

original: sngon po la sogs pa la dkar po'i rdzogs pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa la dkar po'i rdzogs pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Blue, etc., are not the universal of whiteness.

original: sngon po la sogs pa bzhag pa la dkar po rnyed pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan rnyed pa nyid ma yin zhes bya ba 'di la 'di byed pa'o //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa bzhag pa la dkar po rnyed pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan rnyed pa nyid ma yin zhes bya ba 'di la 'di byed pa'o //
translated: The whiteness that is found in blue, etc., is not the same as that found in other things.

original: 'dir lung ni sngon po la sogs pa'i nang du dkar po ma smos pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir lung ni sngon po la sogs pa'i nang du dkar po ma smos pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the scriptural authority is that whiteness is not mentioned among blue, etc.

original: de rnyed na zhag bcu pa de'i dang po la bag la glon pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang zhig nye bar gzhag pa de zhes bya ba ni de'i rigs kyi kha dog la sogs pa de dang rigs mthun pa bsgrub pa la gang zhig de'i tshe
analyzed: de rnyed na zhag bcu pa de'i dang po la bag la glon pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang zhig nye bar gzhag pa de zhes bya ba ni de'i rigs kyi kha dog la sogs pa de dang rigs mthun pa bsgrub pa la gang zhig de'i tshe
translated: If one finds it, one should keep it for ten days.🔽The first of those ten days is the time for keeping it.

original: na gzhag pa'i dus na zhag bcu pa dang po 'am gnyis pa la sogs pa de'i dang po la bag la glon pa nyid do //
analyzed: na gzhag pa'i dus na zhag bcu pa dang po 'am gnyis pa la sogs pa de'i dang po la bag la glon pa nyid do //
translated: If one is establishing something of the same type as that color and so on that was set aside, then at that time, when it is the time for keeping it, the first of those ten days is the first of the second ten days and so on.🔽The full measure is if one is satisfied with that measure and it is the ten days for that.

original: tshad rdzogs pa nyid gal te de'i tshad kyis chog la zhag bcu las 'byung ba nyid de dag gcig pa nyid kyi rnam par ltos par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: tshad rdzogs pa nyid gal te de'i tshad kyis chog la zhag bcu las 'byung ba nyid de dag gcig pa nyid kyi rnam par ltos par bya ba nyid do //
translated: They are the same in that they are to be relied upon.

original: de'i zhag bcu la sogs pa nyid ni 'chang ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i zhag bcu la sogs pa nyid ni 'chang ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The ten days and so on for that is for keeping it and so on.

original: de yang gal te de'i tshe bag la glon pa nyid de tshad du chog pa nyid yin na de'i tshe ltung ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang gal te de'i tshe bag la glon pa nyid de tshad du chog pa nyid yin na de'i tshe ltung ba med pa nyid do //
translated: If that is also the time for keeping it, and if one is satisfied with the full measure, then at that time there is no downfall.

original: snga ma la zla ba gcig pa nyid kyi @144b phyir de nyid du phyi ma la zhugs pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la 'di byed pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma la zla ba gcig pa nyid kyi @144b phyir de nyid du phyi ma la zhugs pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di la 'di byed pa'o //
translated: Since the former is only one month, it is said that the latter is entered right then.

original: bzhag pa dang bag la glon pa'i dbang gis 'dir rnam par bzhag pa 'di rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bzhag pa dang bag la glon pa'i dbang gis 'dir rnam par bzhag pa 'di rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the procedure here. This presentation should be understood through the power of positing and suspending.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong des zhag bcu pa de nyid kyi nang rol du zhes 'di tsam lta bur gyur pa la byin gyis brlabs pa nyid bskyed pa spang ba'i ltung byed byas pa nyid gzhan la zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong des zhag bcu pa de nyid kyi nang rol du zhes 'di tsam lta bur gyur pa la byin gyis brlabs pa nyid bskyed pa spang ba'i ltung byed byas pa nyid gzhan la zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text is just like this: “That monk generates the very consecration within that very tenth day,” and the other, “the downfall through pārājika transgression.”

original: de bsgrub pa'i tshul brjod par bya ste sar pa las snam sbyar gyi mtha' ni nyis rim mo zhes bya ba sar pa las zhes bya ba ni dus gsum du gang yang rung ba gcig dus las longs ma spyad pa la'o //
analyzed: de bsgrub pa'i tshul brjod par bya ste sar pa las snam sbyar gyi mtha' ni nyis rim mo zhes bya ba sar pa las zhes bya ba ni dus gsum du gang yang rung ba gcig dus las longs ma spyad pa la'o //
translated: The method of accomplishing that should be stated. The edge of the patched robe is double-layered. “From new” means from any one of the three times that has not been used.

original: gding ba'i yang ngo zhes bya ba ni sar pa las byed na de'i rim pa'i tshad kyi mtha' nyis rim mo //
analyzed: gding ba'i yang ngo zhes bya ba ni sar pa las byed na de'i rim pa'i tshad kyi mtha' nyis rim mo //
translated: The term “double” means that if one makes a new one, the edge of the size of the standard is double.

original: bla gos dang mthang gos gnyis ni tshig rkyang ngo zhes bya ba ni bla gos dang mthang gos gal te sar pa las byed na de gnyis kyi rim pa'i tshad kyi mtha' ni tshig rkyang ngo //
analyzed: bla gos dang mthang gos gnyis ni tshig rkyang ngo zhes bya ba ni bla gos dang mthang gos gal te sar pa las byed na de gnyis kyi rim pa'i tshad kyi mtha' ni tshig rkyang ngo //
translated: The term “single” means that if one makes a new upper robe and a new lower robe, the edge of the size of the standard is single.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gal te dge slong des bcag pa dang kha bsgyur ba dang rtsom par nus na dge slong des gos de las snam sbyar dang gding ba ni nyis rim du bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gal te dge slong des bcag pa dang kha bsgyur ba dang rtsom par nus na dge slong des gos de las snam sbyar dang gding ba ni nyis rim du bya'o //
translated: The text says, “If the monk is able to tear, dye, and sew, then the monk should make the patched robe and the sitting mat double.

original: bla gos dang mthang gos ni tshig rkyang du bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bla gos dang mthang gos ni tshig rkyang du bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: He should make the upper robe and the lower robe single.”🔽“Double” means that if one uses it during the proper time, it is double.🔽The term “single” means that if one uses it during the proper time, it is single.

original: dus tshigs su spyad pa las ni nyis 'gyur du'o zhes bya ba ni mdo snga ma dag las nyis rim dang tshig rkyang zhes smos pa de dag la ltos te /
analyzed: dus tshigs su spyad pa las ni nyis 'gyur du'o zhes bya ba ni mdo snga ma dag las nyis rim dang tshig rkyang zhes smos pa de dag la ltos te /
translated: The term “double” means that if one uses it during the proper time, it is double.

original: gal te gos tshigs gcig tu spyad pa las de dag byed na nyis 'gyur du bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gos tshigs gcig tu spyad pa las de dag byed na nyis 'gyur du bya'o //
translated: If he makes them from cloth used for one season, he should make them double.

original: snam sbyar dang gding ba gnyis ni bzhi rim du bya'o //
analyzed: snam sbyar dang gding ba gnyis ni bzhi rim du bya'o //
translated: The outer cloak and the mat are to be made in four layers.

original: bla gos dang mthang gos gnyis ni nyis rim du bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bla gos dang mthang gos gnyis ni nyis rim du bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The upper robe and the lower robe are to be made in two layers.

original: dus tshigs su spyad pa'i gos ni bgo zas chung ba nyid de zhes bya ba 'di grub pa'o //
analyzed: dus tshigs su spyad pa'i gos ni bgo zas chung ba nyid de zhes bya ba 'di grub pa'o //
translated: The cloth used for one season is for covering the body and for small needs.

original: gang zhig dus tshigs gsum po dag las dus tshigs gang yang rung ba'i dus tshigs su spyad pa gang yin pa'o zhes dus zad pa'i ngo bo brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig dus tshigs gsum po dag las dus tshigs gang yang rung ba'i dus tshigs su spyad pa gang yin pa'o zhes dus zad pa'i ngo bo brjod pa'o //
translated: The cloth used for one season is that which is used during any of the three seasons.

original: 'dir zla ba bzhi po ni dus su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir zla ba bzhi po ni dus su rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the four months are to be known as the proper time.🔽There is no restriction on those made from rags.

original: phyag dar khrod las byas pa dag la ni nges pa med do zhes bya ba ni rim pa rnams shin tu mang ba nyid la yang nges pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod las byas pa dag la ni nges pa med do zhes bya ba ni rim pa rnams shin tu mang ba nyid la yang nges pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no restriction on the number of layers.

original: 'dir gzhung ni phyag dar khrod la ni ji tsam 'dod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni phyag dar khrod la ni ji tsam 'dod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text is: “One should take as much as one wishes from the dust heap.”

original: rnying pa nyid dang dengs pa nyid ni ci dgos pa lhag par sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni phyag dar khrod ma yin pa dag lhag par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnying pa nyid dang dengs pa nyid ni ci dgos pa lhag par sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni phyag dar khrod ma yin pa dag lhag par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: “Oldness” and “worn out” are to be supplied as appropriate.

original: rnying pa nyid ces bya ba ni rang zad pa nyid do //🔽dengs pa nyid ces bya ba ni sgo @145a * //
analyzed: rnying pa nyid ces bya ba ni rang zad pa nyid do // dengs pa nyid ces bya ba ni sgo @145a * //
translated: “Oldness” means worn out by itself.

original: skyes kyi bshung ba la sogs pas bsrabs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skyes kyi bshung ba la sogs pas bsrabs par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Worn out” means worn out by the elements, such as wind and sun.

original: ci dgos pa zhes bya ba ni ci tsam dgos pa ste ji tsam spyad par bya dgos pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci dgos pa zhes bya ba ni ci tsam dgos pa ste ji tsam spyad par bya dgos pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “As much as one wishes” means as much as one needs, as much as one has to use.

original: lhag par zhes bya ba ni rim pa'i mtha' sngar bstan pa las so //
analyzed: lhag par zhes bya ba ni rim pa'i mtha' sngar bstan pa las so //
translated: “Supplied” means supplied in the order taught above.

original: sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni lhan pa dag go //
analyzed: sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni lhan pa dag go //
translated: “Appropriate” means the patches.

original: mdo 'di ni ma mo las gsungs pa bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo 'di ni ma mo las gsungs pa bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This sūtra is a summary of what is said in the Mātṛkā.

original: lhag par sbyar ba nyid du mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sbyar ba ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di la 'di bstan pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par sbyar ba nyid du mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sbyar ba ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di la 'di bstan pa'o //
translated: The application is a minor offense. This is what is taught here.

original: spang bar 'gyur ba nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag par sbyar ba'i rim pa de zhag bcu 'das na spang ba'i ltung byed du rig par bya'o //🔽rig pa can byi dor byas nas 'di nyid du sbyar bar bya'o snyam pa'i sems ma bskyed par dbog par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la mi rung bar gyur pa ni 'dir dbog par bya'o //
analyzed: spang bar 'gyur ba nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni lhag par sbyar ba'i rim pa de zhag bcu 'das na spang ba'i ltung byed du rig par bya'o // rig pa can byi dor byas nas 'di nyid du sbyar bar bya'o snyam pa'i sems ma bskyed par dbog par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la mi rung bar gyur pa ni 'dir dbog par bya'o //
translated: It is also to be abandoned. The stage of applying in excess, if ten days have passed, should be known as a downfall that requires confession and relinquishment.🔽Having cleaned the cloth, one should not give it away with the thought, “I will apply it right here.”

original: chos gos 'di nyid du sbyar bar bya'o snyam pa'i sems ma bskyed par dbog par mi bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos 'di nyid du sbyar bar bya'o snyam pa'i sems ma bskyed par dbog par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not give it away without the thought, “I will apply this robe right here.”

original: 'di lta bu'i sems la mi gnas pa ni sems ma bskyed par zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i sems la mi gnas pa ni sems ma bskyed par zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Not abiding in such a thought is the meaning of “without the thought.”

original: gang yang rung bas phog pa ma sbyar ba'i snga rol du spang bar 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang yang rung bas phog pa ma sbyar ba'i snga rol du spang bar 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one gives away a cloth that has been assigned to one, it is to be abandoned before the application.

original: gang yang rung bas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yang rung ba zhes bya ba de lta bu 'am gzhan pa'i sems kyis phog pa de'i gzugs nyid du gyur pa la de nyid do //
analyzed: gang yang rung bas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar yang rung ba zhes bya ba de lta bu 'am gzhan pa'i sems kyis phog pa de'i gzugs nyid du gyur pa la de nyid do //
translated: “By any means” means “in any way,” or “by another mind.”

original: yang dag par sbyar ba nyid la bsgrub pa nyid du 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'di shes pa rim pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rjes su 'brel pas brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par sbyar ba nyid la bsgrub pa nyid du 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'di shes pa rim pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rjes su 'brel pas brjod pa yin no //
translated: “The establishment of the correct application” is stated in accordance with the sequence of the knowledge.

original: snam sbyar gyi snam phran dag ni dgu yan chad nas nyi shu rtsa lnga man chad de zung ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snam sbyar gyi snam phran dag ni dgu yan chad nas nyi shu rtsa lnga man chad de zung ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The patches of the patched robe are from nine to twenty-five, excluding the pair.

original: 'dir mnyam pa ni zung nyid kyi nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir mnyam pa ni zung nyid kyi nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: Here, the pair is an illustration of the equal.

original: bcu dang bcu gnyis dang bcu bzhi dang / bcu drug dang bco brgyad dang / nyi shu dang nyi shu gnyis dang nyi shu bzhi rnams ma gtogs par zhes bya ba 'di'i don to //
analyzed: bcu dang bcu gnyis dang bcu bzhi dang / bcu drug dang bco brgyad dang / nyi shu dang nyi shu gnyis dang nyi shu bzhi rnams ma gtogs par zhes bya ba 'di'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the ten, the twelve, the fourteen, the sixteen, the eighteen, the twenty, the twenty-two, and the twenty-four are excluded.

original: ci'i phyir de lhag pa'i dum bu rnams kyis snam sbyar zhes bya ba 'dir rgyu brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de lhag pa'i dum bu rnams kyis snam sbyar zhes bya ba 'dir rgyu brjod pa yin no //
translated: Why is it called a patched robe? Here the reason is stated.

original: de yan chad ni tshem bu'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshem bu nyid der gyur pa de bas na ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yan chad ni tshem bu'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshem bu nyid der gyur pa de bas na ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From that point on, it is a patchwork robe. Since it becomes a patchwork robe, it is not that. This is the meaning.

analyzed: dang po gsum pa la ni de dag gi glegs bu phyed dang gsum pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar gsum pa dang po la ste /
translated: In the first third, they are one and a half panels. In the first third of the patched robe,

analyzed: snam phran dgu pa dang bcu gcig par dang bcu gsum pa'i dum bu 'di rnams la glegs bu phyed dang gsum pa nyid do // glegs bu phyed dang gsum @145b pa rnams ni dum bu 'di la ngo bo ste /
translated: in these nine, eleven, and thirteen panels, they are one and a half panels.🔽The one and a half panels are the essence of this third.

original: de bas glegs bu phyed dang gsum pa ni de'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de bas glegs bu phyed dang gsum pa ni de'i dngos po'o //
translated: Therefore, the one and a half panels are its nature.

original: 'dir snam phran rnams ni dum bu nyid du rig par bya'i glegs bu dang phyed pa rnams la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir snam phran rnams ni dum bu nyid du rig par bya'i glegs bu dang phyed pa rnams la ni mi bya'o //
translated: Here, the panels should be known as the essence, not the panels and halves.

original: gnyis pa la ni glegs bu phyed dang bzhi po nyid do zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar gsum pa gnyis pa la ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni glegs bu phyed dang bzhi po nyid do zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar gsum pa gnyis pa la ste /
translated: In the second, there are four and a half panels.

original: snam phran bco lnga pa dang bcu bdun pa dang bcu dgu pa'i snam sbyar rnams la'o //
analyzed: snam phran bco lnga pa dang bcu bdun pa dang bcu dgu pa'i snam sbyar rnams la'o //
translated: In the second of the three robes, there are fifteen, seventeen, and nineteen panels.

original: snam phran de rnams kyi glegs bu phyed dang bzhi pa nyid do //
analyzed: snam phran de rnams kyi glegs bu phyed dang bzhi pa nyid do //
translated: In those panels, there are four and a half panels.🔽In the third, there are five and a half panels.

original: gsum pa la ni glegs bu phyed dang lnga pa nyid do zhes bya ba snam phran nyi shu rtsa gcig pa dang nyi shu rtsa gsum pa dang nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'i snam sbyar rnams la'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni glegs bu phyed dang lnga pa nyid do zhes bya ba snam phran nyi shu rtsa gcig pa dang nyi shu rtsa gsum pa dang nyi shu rtsa lnga pa'i snam sbyar rnams la'o //
translated: In the twenty-one, twenty-three, and twenty-five panel robes,

analyzed: bla gos ni snam phran bdun dang glegs bu phyed dang gsum pa'o //

original: mthang gos ni snam phran lnga pa dang glegs bu phyed dang gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: mthang gos ni snam phran lnga pa dang glegs bu phyed dang gnyis pa'o //
translated: The lower robe has five panels and two and a half panels.

original: de gnyis ni chos gos byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ni chos gos byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags las shes par bya'o //
translated: Those two are to be understood from the mantra of consecrating the Dharma robes.

original: byin gyis brlab tu rung ba chen po dag ni rang gi khru gsum dang lnga dag go zhes bya ba ni zheng du khru gsum chur khru lnga ni gang rnams kyi tshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab tu rung ba chen po dag ni rang gi khru gsum dang lnga dag go zhes bya ba ni zheng du khru gsum chur khru lnga ni gang rnams kyi tshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: those that are three cubits in width and five cubits in length are the measure of those.

analyzed: phyogs gcig la yang tshad las lhag par byed na spang bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: If one makes it exceeding the measure on one side, it becomes just abandoned.

analyzed: de bas na ltung ba las lhag pa'i don nyid kyis 'di ltar brjod pa la skyes pa nyid kyis de bzhin du rim pa du ma bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pas mtshams sbyar ba la ji srid du rim pa rigs pa nyid byed pa mngon par 'dod pa de
translated: Therefore, by the very meaning of exceeding the downfall, it is stated thus. By the very arising, one should make the sequence in that way. With the thought of connecting, as long as one desires to make the sequence just as it is reasonable,

original: rim pa du ma bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pa med de rim pa gcig pa'o snyam pa las gang zhig tshad 'di pas lhag par byed dam /
analyzed: rim pa du ma bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pa med de rim pa gcig pa'o snyam pa las gang zhig tshad 'di pas lhag par byed dam /

analyzed: dras te bya'o snyam pa'i bsam pa yod pas gzhag par bya ba la 'di ni tshad do //
translated: There is the thought of cutting it, so it is set aside. This is the measure.

original: de las lhag pa med pa ma bcad pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis tshad 'di gang yin pa de las lhag par byed na spang bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las lhag pa med pa ma bcad pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis tshad 'di gang yin pa de las lhag par byed na spang bar 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //

original: ngos ji tsam pa de tsam gyi bsam pas 'jug pa de tsam la de'i don nyid kyis nyes par gyur pa nyid med do //
analyzed: ngos ji tsam pa de tsam gyi bsam pas 'jug pa de tsam la de'i don nyid kyis nyes par gyur pa nyid med do //
translated: If one enters with the thought of just the size of the side, just that much, there is no fault in that.

original: gang gi phyir mngon par brten pa dang rig pa las ma 'das pa'i don la lhag par gyur pa nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mngon par brten pa dang rig pa las ma 'das pa'i don la lhag par gyur pa nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: Because it is not the case that the meaning of not exceeding the size of the robe and the size of the patch is not fulfilled.

original: de bas @146a * //

original: mthang gos ni do dang lnga yang yin /
analyzed: mthang gos ni do dang lnga yang yin /
translated: The lower robe is five cubits, or four cubits.🔽The upper robe is three cubits, or more.

original: do dang bzhi yang yin no 'khor gsum khebs pa yan chad kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni do dang bzhi man chad nas brtsams te ji srid 'khor gsum khebs pa nyid yan chad kyi bar ro //

analyzed: khru'i don ni lus kyi cha bdun las gnyis so zhes bya ba ni lus kyi khru'i sgra'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of cubit of the body should be understood as the measure of the body.

analyzed: lus dang gru mo nas gung mo'i rtse mo'i bar yod pa de'i tshad ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not the measure from the elbow to the tip of the middle finger.🔽The measure of the body is the measure of the cubit.

analyzed: gang du lus la khru'i tshad thung ba 'am ring ba nyid de dang 'brel pa nyid ni cho ga 'di'o //

analyzed: mi yog na ral ga dpung chad bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar yang gang gis lus mi khe bas na ral ga dpung chad bya ste khebs par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: If the body is not covered, the upper robe should be made long to cover it.

original: 'di ni gtso bo'i thabs te de bas na 'di'i 'di brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gtso bo'i thabs te de bas na 'di'i 'di brjod par bya'o //
translated: This is the principal method, therefore, this is what is to be stated.

original: zla bas spang ba rnam par 'byed pa'o /
analyzed: zla bas spang ba rnam par 'byed pa'o /
translated: The moon is the division of the abandonment.

original: // / de bas dman pa ni chung ba dang 'dra ste nyes byas su 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa kun las 'og tu gos gang zhig dum bur gyur pa 'am dum bur ma gyur pa chung ba 'jog pa zla ba dang 'dra bar de
analyzed: // / de bas dman pa ni chung ba dang 'dra ste nyes byas su 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni mnyam pa kun las 'og tu gos gang zhig dum bur gyur pa 'am dum bur ma gyur pa chung ba 'jog pa zla ba dang 'dra bar de
translated: Therefore, the inferior is like the small, and it is just a minor offense. This is the lowest of all the equal, where any piece of cloth, whether torn or not torn, is placed. The moon is like that.

original: la nyes byas su gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: la nyes byas su gyur pa nyid do //
translated: In that case, it is just a minor offense.

original: re ba yod pa la byin gyis rlob par byed pa med pa nyid la zla ba gcig 'das na shin tu dman pa 'chang ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: re ba yod pa la byin gyis rlob par byed pa med pa nyid la zla ba gcig 'das na shin tu dman pa 'chang ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If one who has hope makes a consecration, and there is no consecration, and one month passes, then it is a minor offense to wear the extremely inferior.

original: re ba med pa la byin gyis brlab par bya ba yod la zhag bcu 'da' bar byed na zhes bya ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: re ba med pa la byin gyis brlab par bya ba yod la zhag bcu 'da' bar byed na zhes bya ba'i don du'o //
translated: If one who has no hope makes a consecration, and there is a consecration, and ten days pass, this is the meaning of the statement.

original: 'khor gyi phyed g-yogs pa gang zhig dman pa der cho ga 'di zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor gyi phyed g-yogs pa gang zhig dman pa der cho ga 'di zhugs pa'o //
translated: Any half-covered retinue is inferior. This is the procedure there.

original: 'di las 'og ma gang yin pa de la cho ga brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di las 'og ma gang yin pa de la cho ga brjod par bya ste /
translated: Whatever is below this, there the procedure should be stated.

original: 'khor gyi phyed mi khebs pa ni re ba med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dir lte ba'i @146b ri mo la sogs pa nas pus mo'i lha nga'i mthar thug pa gang yin pa de ni kan tha 'khor ro //
analyzed: 'khor gyi phyed mi khebs pa ni re ba med pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'dir lte ba'i @146b ri mo la sogs pa nas pus mo'i lha nga'i mthar thug pa gang yin pa de ni kan tha 'khor ro //
translated: Here, the retinue is from the navel line up to the knees.

original: 'di'i zheng las gang gis phyed mi khebs pa de la re ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i zheng las gang gis phyed mi khebs pa de la re ba med pa nyid do //
translated: That which is not covered by half of its width is without hope.

original: cha gcig pas zhag bcu'i phyogs nyid do //
analyzed: cha gcig pas zhag bcu'i phyogs nyid do //
translated: One part is ten days.

original: zhag bcu las 'das par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhag bcu las 'das par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if one goes beyond ten days, there is an offense.

original: 'dir re ba shin tu che ba yang dag par gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir re ba shin tu che ba yang dag par gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, excessive hope is not well-founded.

original: dal gyis 'gro bas yul gzhan du phyin pa dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'dis shes pa'o //
analyzed: dal gyis 'gro bas yul gzhan du phyin pa dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba 'dis shes pa'o //
translated: This is understood by the statement, It is like going to another country slowly.

original: rung ba ma yin pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni re ba med pa nyid ces bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni re ba med pa nyid ces bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Also, what is unsuitable should be connected with without hope.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gos ji lta bu cig gzhag par bgyi /🔽rung ba gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gos ji lta bu cig gzhag par bgyi / rung ba gang yin pa'o ;
translated: Here, the text asks, What kind of robe should be laid out?🔽Whatever is suitable.

original: / rung ba ji lta bu lags /
analyzed: / rung ba ji lta bu lags /
translated: What is suitable?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bkag pa gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ma bkag pa gang yin pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One did not prohibit them.🔽The Blessed One did not consecrate as robes the face-cloth, the water-strainer, the soft seat, the donkey-load, etc.

original: gdong phyis dang chu tshags dang / stan 'jam po dang dre'u rdog la sogs pa'i yo byad kyi gos byin gyis ma brlabs pa dag go zhes bya ba ni gdong phyis la sogs pa nyid du byin gyis ma brlabs pa de dag kyang kha bskang ba la re ba med pa nyid yin te /🔽gzhan rtse gcig pa rnams la re ba yod pa nyid la yang dag par gnas pa'i phyir glags mi rnyed pa zhag bcu nyid la 'di brjod pa ste yang dag par 'gyur ba nyid kyang 'dir med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir grags par rig par bya'o //
