translated: The face-cloth, etc., which are not consecrated as robes, are also not to be expected as a supplement,🔽because the Blessed One, who is one-pointed, does not expect them, and because the Blessed One, who is perfectly pure, does not need them.

original: 'dir gzhung ni yi ge kha cig las yo byad kyi gos byin gyis ma brlabs pa zhag bcu las 'das pa spang bar 'gyur ba nyid ni gdong phyis dang chu tshags dang stan 'jam dang dre'u rdog la sogs pa'i yo byad byin gyis rlob par byed na ltung
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni yi ge kha cig las yo byad kyi gos byin gyis ma brlabs pa zhag bcu las 'das pa spang bar 'gyur ba nyid ni gdong phyis dang chu tshags dang stan 'jam dang dre'u rdog la sogs pa'i yo byad byin gyis rlob par byed na ltung
translated: If one consecrates articles such as a face-cloth, water filter, soft cushion, or mule-load, there is no downfall.”

original: ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽zla bas spang ba zhu ba'o /
analyzed: ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to // zla bas spang ba zhu ba'o /
translated: This is the meaning.🔽Candrakīrti explains that it is discarded.

original: // / sbrum ma dben par gzhag go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / sbrum ma dben par gzhag go zhes bya ba la /
translated: “A pregnant woman should be placed in seclusion.”

original: sbrum ma zhes bya ba ni mngal na bu yod pa ste rab tu byung ba /
analyzed: sbrum ma zhes bya ba ni mngal na bu yod pa ste rab tu byung ba /
translated: A pregnant woman is one who has a child in her womb.

original: sbrum ma mngal na bu yod pa ste dben pa'i phyogs su gzhag par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbrum ma mngal na bu yod pa ste dben pa'i phyogs su gzhag par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: A pregnant woman who has a child in her womb should be placed in a secluded place. This is the meaning.

original: de dge slong ma rnams kyis yal bar mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni gang zhig 'di dben pa'i sa phyogs na sbrum ma'i gnas bcas pa der 'di bsgrub na dge slong ma gzhan rnams kyis yal bar mi dor ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dge slong ma rnams kyis yal bar mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni gang zhig 'di dben pa'i sa phyogs na sbrum ma'i gnas bcas pa der 'di bsgrub na dge slong ma gzhan rnams kyis yal bar mi dor ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the nuns should not abandon her is that if she is practicing in a secluded place where she has set up a dwelling for a pregnant woman, the other nuns should not abandon her.

original: de la zan sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbrum ma la dge slong ma rnams kyis so //🔽pha ma dag nas bdun pa tshun chad las gang yang rung ba snga ma gcig las skyes pa yang nye du yin no @147a * //
analyzed: de la zan sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbrum ma la dge slong ma rnams kyis so // pha ma dag nas bdun pa tshun chad las gang yang rung ba snga ma gcig las skyes pa yang nye du yin no @147a * //
translated: The meaning of they should give her food is that the nuns should give food to the pregnant woman.

original: zhes bya ba la pha ma dag ces bya ba ni pha dang ma ni pha ma dag go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la pha ma dag ces bya ba ni pha dang ma ni pha ma dag go //
translated: The meaning of up to the seventh generation on the father's and mother's sides is that even if someone is born from any one of the previous relatives, they are still a relative.

original: 'dir ma'i rgyud pha'i yan lag dang bcas pa la ma'i sgra'o //
analyzed: 'dir ma'i rgyud pha'i yan lag dang bcas pa la ma'i sgra'o //
translated: Here, the word mother refers to the mother's continuum along with the father's limbs.

original: pha'i sgra yang ma'i yan lag dang bcas pa pha'i rgyud la phrugs bdun du gyur pa'i pha ma dag gis ji srid du gang yang rung ba gcig gis kyang pha ma de dag la gnyis ka dag nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: pha'i sgra yang ma'i yan lag dang bcas pa pha'i rgyud la phrugs bdun du gyur pa'i pha ma dag gis ji srid du gang yang rung ba gcig gis kyang pha ma de dag la gnyis ka dag nyid kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: The sound of father also includes the limbs of the mother. The father’s continuum becomes seven times the father’s continuum. The father and mother are not both parents to any one person.

original: gcig snga ma las skyes pa nyid dang ma gcig las skyes pa nyid dang pha gcig las skyes pa nyid gang la yod pa de ni gnyen zhes bya ba 'di dag gi don to //
analyzed: gcig snga ma las skyes pa nyid dang ma gcig las skyes pa nyid dang pha gcig las skyes pa nyid gang la yod pa de ni gnyen zhes bya ba 'di dag gi don to //
translated: The meaning of “relative” is that one is born from the same mother and father.

original: 'khrur 'jug pa'i spang ba'i byed pa po nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrur 'jug pa'i spang ba'i byed pa po nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the agent of the action of bathing?

original: de'i phyir 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the dominant factor is the perception.

original: don med na yang 'du shes ni gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin te 'du shes ni gtso cher rig par bya'o //
analyzed: don med na yang 'du shes ni gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin te 'du shes ni gtso cher rig par bya'o //
translated: Even when there is no object, perception is the dominant factor. Perception should be understood as the dominant factor.

original: gang du 'di'i 'og tu nye bar gnas pa nyid rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: gang du 'di'i 'og tu nye bar gnas pa nyid rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Where should this be understood as being located?

original: de ni 'du shes gtso bor bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni 'du shes gtso bor bya ba la /
translated: This is in the section on perception being the dominant factor.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni ming can te 'du shes gtso bor byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni ming can te 'du shes gtso bor byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: That is the name, the one who makes perception primary.

original: shes gtso bor bya ba ni ming ste 'du shes gtso bor byed pa po nyid yin pa de'i ming ngo //
analyzed: shes gtso bor bya ba ni ming ste 'du shes gtso bor byed pa po nyid yin pa de'i ming ngo //
translated: The name is the one who makes consciousness primary. The name is the one who makes perception primary.

original: de ltar na tshig gi don 'du 'byung ste 'di man chad kyi mdo gang dang gang la shes gtso bo zhes bya ba'i ming smos pa de dang der ming de'i rang gi ming can 'du shes gtso bor byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya ba ston par
analyzed: de ltar na tshig gi don 'du 'byung ste 'di man chad kyi mdo gang dang gang la shes gtso bo zhes bya ba'i ming smos pa de dang der ming de'i rang gi ming can 'du shes gtso bor byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya ba ston par
translated: Thus, the meaning of the term is the arising of the collection. From here on, in whatever sutra it is said that the name is the one who makes consciousness primary, in all those places, the name is the one who makes perception primary.

original: shes par bya'o //
analyzed: shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood.

original: don gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: don gang la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: With regard to which object does the one who makes perception primary act?

original: de'i phyir dge slong ma nyid dang de nye du ma yin pa nyid dag la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong ma nyid dang de nye du ma yin pa nyid dag la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, with regard to a fully ordained nun and one who is not a relative.

original: dge slong ma nyid dang dge slong ma de nye du ma yin pa dag la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge slong ma nyid dang dge slong ma de nye du ma yin pa dag la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: With regard to a fully ordained nun and one who is not a relative of that nun, the one who makes perception primary acts. This is the meaning.

original: 'og ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gang zhig 'di'i rjes la bslab pa'i gzhi'i phyir gzung ba dang 'brel pa de la yang dge slong ma nyid dang de nye du ma yin pa dag la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya
analyzed: 'og ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gang zhig 'di'i rjes la bslab pa'i gzhi'i phyir gzung ba dang 'brel pa de la yang dge slong ma nyid dang de nye du ma yin pa dag la 'du shes gtso cher byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya
translated: Also below means that for those who are related to the basis of training that follows this, it is the state of being a fully ordained nun and the state of being a nonrelative that are the primary factors.

original: ba 'dra bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ba 'dra bar bstan pa'o //
translated: This is similar to the above.

original: ci zhig byas na 'khrur 'jug pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /🔽de'i phyir byin gyis brlabs pa rang gi rnying pa 'khrur 'jug par 'os pa chos gos dang gding ba dag las 'ga' zhig bsgo bas 'khrur 'jug gam 'tshed du 'jug gam 'chag tu 'jug pa dag na'o zhes bya ba smos te byin gyis brlabs pa rang gi rnying
analyzed: ci zhig byas na 'khrur 'jug pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir byin gyis brlabs pa rang gi rnying pa 'khrur 'jug par 'os pa chos gos dang gding ba dag las 'ga' zhig bsgo bas 'khrur 'jug gam 'tshed du 'jug gam 'chag tu 'jug pa dag na'o zhes bya ba smos te byin gyis brlabs pa rang gi rnying
translated: What is done to make it a basis of relinquishment?🔽Therefore it is said: If one instructs a fully ordained nun to wash, boil, or beat any of her own old robes or bedding that are suitable to be washed, she commits an offense.

original: la 'khrur 'jug par 'os pa chos gos dang gding ba dag las 'ga' @147b zhig bsgo bas 'khrur 'jug pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: la 'khrur 'jug par 'os pa chos gos dang gding ba dag las 'ga' @147b zhig bsgo bas 'khrur 'jug pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one instructs a fully ordained nun to wash, boil, or beat any of her own old robes or bedding that are suitable to be washed, she commits an offense.

original: 'dir rnying pa nyid ni longs spyad pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir rnying pa nyid ni longs spyad pa nyid do //
translated: Here, the old is the very thing that is used.

original: ji srid du yang dus tsam la sogs pa'i tshad de srid du 'di ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i gzugs kyi 'du byed ma yin te /
analyzed: ji srid du yang dus tsam la sogs pa'i tshad de srid du 'di ni yongs su rdzogs pa'i gzugs kyi 'du byed ma yin te /
translated: For as long as the measure of time, etc., lasts, this is not the complete form of the formative forces.

original: gang zhig ma 'ongs pa na 'du byed ces bya ba 'khrur 'jug par 'os pa nyid la 'dir yan lag nyid de /
analyzed: gang zhig ma 'ongs pa na 'du byed ces bya ba 'khrur 'jug par 'os pa nyid la 'dir yan lag nyid de /
translated: That which is suitable to be washed in the future is the very limb here.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i 'khrur 'jug pa la sogs pa'i phyogs nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i 'khrur 'jug pa la sogs pa'i phyogs nyid do //
translated: This is the very side of washing, etc., that has come about in this way.

original: 'khrur 'jug par 'os pa ma yin pa rnying pa 'di 'khru ba la sogs pa nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khrur 'jug par 'os pa ma yin pa rnying pa 'di 'khru ba la sogs pa nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
translated: The old that is not suitable to be washed, etc., should be understood as a fault in washing, etc.

original: gding ba'i tshig ni lus thams cad la yang dag par reg pas longs spyod pa nyid gang yin pa de ni 'dir shes par bya zhes pa 'di stan tsam du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gding ba'i tshig ni lus thams cad la yang dag par reg pas longs spyod pa nyid gang yin pa de ni 'dir shes par bya zhes pa 'di stan tsam du rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: The word “spread” should be understood here as the very enjoyment through the complete contact with the whole body. It is just the seat that is established.

original: lus kyi bsnyen bkur byed pa'i rnam pa nyid ni 'dir nyes pa mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: lus kyi bsnyen bkur byed pa'i rnam pa nyid ni 'dir nyes pa mthong ba yin te /
translated: The very aspect of service to the body is seen as a fault here.

original: de bas na gzhan gyis yongs su longs spyod pa nyid la na smad pa zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan gyis yongs su longs spyod pa nyid la na smad pa zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that “disparaging” means just “being used by others.”

original: ngag kyang zhes bya ba'i cho ga 'di la 'jug pa'i don du bsgo ba zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: ngag kyang zhes bya ba'i cho ga 'di la 'jug pa'i don du bsgo ba zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: “ Speech” is the term for the command to engage in this procedure.

original: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong chos gos rung bas grong du zhugs shing de'i chos gos de yang lus las ma phud par dengs par bgyi pa'i slad du 'byung bar 'gyur ba mchis sam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni btsun pa dge slong chos gos rung bas grong du zhugs shing de'i chos gos de yang lus las ma phud par dengs par bgyi pa'i slad du 'byung bar 'gyur ba mchis sam /
translated: Here, the text says, “Venerable, is there a case where a monk, with a suitable robe, enters a village, and that robe of his, without being removed from his body, becomes lost?”

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: “ Upāli, there is.

original: 'di lta ste khyim gyi nang du zhugs pa'i chos gos mi gtsang ba la sogs pas gos par gyur pa de dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la 'khrur 'jug na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis
analyzed: 'di lta ste khyim gyi nang du zhugs pa'i chos gos mi gtsang ba la sogs pas gos par gyur pa de dge slong ma nye du ma yin pa la 'khrur 'jug na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis
translated: It is this: if a monk, having entered a house, has his robe soiled by filth, and so on, and has a non-relative nun wash it, he commits a minor offense.”

original: 'du byas pa tsam gyis 'di la 'di dgos pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byas pa tsam gyis 'di la 'di dgos pa'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the passage.

original: longs spyod pa 'du byed du bcug pa zhes bya ba 'di tsam gyis zhes bya ste de bas na 'khrur 'os pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: longs spyod pa 'du byed du bcug pa zhes bya ba 'di tsam gyis zhes bya ste de bas na 'khrur 'os pa'i tshig go //
translated: This is called causing enjoyment to be prepared, and this much is the proper procedure. Therefore, it is a phrase worthy of being washed away.

original: phyogs la byas pa yang las byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba la phyogs la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni rdzas phyogs gcig tu song ba nyid dam rgyun dum bur gyur pa nyid kyis phyogs shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs la byas pa yang las byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba la phyogs la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni rdzas phyogs gcig tu song ba nyid dam rgyun dum bur gyur pa nyid kyis phyogs shes par bya'o //
translated: Also, in the case of a direction, it is the very act of making. In the case of a direction means that a direction should be understood by the substance going to one part or by the continuum becoming fragmented.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'dir btsun pa 'di ltar yod par gyur pa zhig na dge slong chos gos rung bar grong du zhugs shing de'i chos gos de yang lus las ma phud par de spang bar bgyi ba'i slad du dbyung bar 'gyur bar mchis sam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'dir btsun pa 'di ltar yod par gyur pa zhig na dge slong chos gos rung bar grong du zhugs shing de'i chos gos de yang lus las ma phud par de spang bar bgyi ba'i slad du dbyung bar 'gyur bar mchis sam /
translated: Here, the text is as follows: Venerable, if it were like this, a monk would enter the village with a suitable robe, and that robe of his would not be removed from the body, would it be expelled for the sake of being expelled?🔽Upāli, it would.🔽Just as a monk, having entered a house, would not remove his robe from his body, would it be expelled for the sake of being expelled?

original: nye ba 'khor yod de /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor yod de /
translated: Upāli, it would.

original: ji ltar yang dge slong khyim gyi nang du zhugs pa las chos gos bshang ba 'am gci ba 'am 'dam gyis sam lud pas sam mi gtsang ba gzhan dang gzhan @148a * //
analyzed: ji ltar yang dge slong khyim gyi nang du zhugs pa las chos gos bshang ba 'am gci ba 'am 'dam gyis sam lud pas sam mi gtsang ba gzhan dang gzhan @148a * //
translated: Just as a monk, having entered a house, would not remove his robe from his body, would it be expelled for the sake of being expelled?

original: gyis gos par gyur te /
analyzed: gyis gos par gyur te /
translated: and the rest of the world is covered with it.

original: de ma gnang ba'i dge slong ma la 'khrur 'jug na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ma gnang ba'i dge slong ma la 'khrur 'jug na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If a nun who is not permitted to do so has a nun wash her, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: 'di ni rdzas phyogs gcig tu song ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rdzas phyogs gcig tu song ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: This is called “the substance has gone to one part.”

original: phyogs gcig las lhag pa 'di ni lus las ma phud pa'i tshig gis rgyun dum bur gyur pa nyid ces bya ba nyid kyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig las lhag pa 'di ni lus las ma phud pa'i tshig gis rgyun dum bur gyur pa nyid ces bya ba nyid kyis shes par bya'o //
translated: If it is more than one part, it should be understood by the phrase “the continuity is broken into pieces without being removed from the body.”

original: 'dir 'khrur 'jug par bya zhes bya ba ni tha na chur snyug par byed dam /
analyzed: 'dir 'khrur 'jug par bya zhes bya ba ni tha na chur snyug par byed dam /
translated: Here, “to have it washed” means if she has it soaked in water,

original: tshon du snyug par byed dam 'tshed du 'jug par byed dam tha na thal mos rdeb par byed na yang ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: tshon du snyug par byed dam 'tshed du 'jug par byed dam tha na thal mos rdeb par byed na yang ngo zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: or has it soaked in dye, or has it boiled, or even if she has it beaten with a fan, it is as stated.

original: byas pa nyid na byed du bcug pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe de las de nges par sbyor ba byas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe byed du bcug pa nyid 'grub par 'gyur te nyes byas kyi sbyor ba tsam la ma yin no //🔽'bras bu'i mtha' man chad gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i mthar thug pa ni ji srid du las kyis gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: byas pa nyid na byed du bcug pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe de las de nges par sbyor ba byas par 'gyur ba de'i tshe byed du bcug pa nyid 'grub par 'gyur te nyes byas kyi sbyor ba tsam la ma yin no // 'bras bu'i mtha' man chad gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu'i mthar thug pa ni ji srid du las kyis gcig pa nyid do //
translated: When it is produced, it is also engaged. When the action is definitely applied to that, then engagement is established, not merely by the application of the fault.🔽The result is the same up to the end of the result. The end of the result is the same as long as the action is the same.

original: tshigs su gyur pa nyid la 'bras bu rnams gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni tshigs su gyur pa snga ma dang phyi ma'i cha nyid kyis yid la 'brel par gyur pa du ma'i 'bras bu rnams gang yin pa ni 'du lta ste /
analyzed: tshigs su gyur pa nyid la 'bras bu rnams gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni tshigs su gyur pa snga ma dang phyi ma'i cha nyid kyis yid la 'brel par gyur pa du ma'i 'bras bu rnams gang yin pa ni 'du lta ste /
translated: The result is the same in the case of a verse. The result of many verses is the same, since the earlier and later parts are connected in the mind.

original: rung ba nyid kyis thob pa'i mthar thug pa 'du byed pa'i dgongs pas rtsom pa la 'khrur 'jug pa dang 'tshed du 'jug pa dang 'chag tu 'jug par byed pa nyid dag gis gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: rung ba nyid kyis thob pa'i mthar thug pa 'du byed pa'i dgongs pas rtsom pa la 'khrur 'jug pa dang 'tshed du 'jug pa dang 'chag tu 'jug par byed pa nyid dag gis gcig pa nyid do //
translated: They are the same in that they cause one to bathe, to cook, and to walk.

original: de rnams la de'i dbye ba dang bsgo ba dang las kyi dbye bas gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de rnams la de'i dbye ba dang bsgo ba dang las kyi dbye bas gcig pa nyid do //
translated: They are the same in that they are distinguished by their subdivisions, by their injunctions, and by their actions.🔽In this regard, the three actions of bathing, etc., up to the last verse are accomplished by the last.

original: de la tha ma'i tshigs kyi tha ma'i bar du 'khrur 'jug pa la sogs pa'i las gsum po rjes su bsgrub pa la gang zhig ltung ba re rer gsungs pa de bas mdo 'di dang snga ma'o //
analyzed: de la tha ma'i tshigs kyi tha ma'i bar du 'khrur 'jug pa la sogs pa'i las gsum po rjes su bsgrub pa la gang zhig ltung ba re rer gsungs pa de bas mdo 'di dang snga ma'o //
translated: The one who is said to have fallen in each case, he is the same as the one in the sūtra and the one in the former.

original: 'du shes gtso bo nyid la de ni ji lta ba nyid la ni dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: 'du shes gtso bo nyid la de ni ji lta ba nyid la ni dngos gzhi'o //
translated: When perception is primary, it is the actual basis.

original: don ji lta ba ma yin pa nyid la ni dngos gzhi dang nye ba'o zhes bya ba ni gang du 'du shes gtso che ba nyid de la cho ga ni 'di rig par bya'o //
analyzed: don ji lta ba ma yin pa nyid la ni dngos gzhi dang nye ba'o zhes bya ba ni gang du 'du shes gtso che ba nyid de la cho ga ni 'di rig par bya'o //
translated: When it is not as it really is, it is both the actual basis and the proximate cause. This is the rule to be known where perception is primary.

original: 'du shes pa ni don ji lta ba nyid la ni dngos gzhi'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: 'du shes pa ni don ji lta ba nyid la ni dngos gzhi'i ltung ba'o //
translated: If he perceives it as it really is, there is a downfall of the main part.

original: don ji lta ba nyid ma yin pa la ni gang zhig de dang nye ba'o zhes bya ba ni bar med pa'i tshigs su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: don ji lta ba nyid ma yin pa la ni gang zhig de dang nye ba'o zhes bya ba ni bar med pa'i tshigs su gyur pa'o //
translated: If he perceives it as not being what it really is, then if it is similar to that, there is a downfall of the main part.

original: yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni yid gnyis ni 'du shes dang 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: Doubt is like perception.

original: yid gnyis za ba la yang don de la ltung ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid gnyis za ba la yang don de la ltung ba de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If he is doubtful about the matter, he incurs the same downfall.

original: gang zhig de la 'du shes shing zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig de la 'du shes shing zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If he perceives it as it really is, there is a downfall of the main part.

original: dge 'dun gyi @148b khrims su bca' ba bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi @148b khrims su bca' ba bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: The rules of the community should be observed.

original: glo bur du 'ongs pas kyang de las mi 'gal ba nyid du bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: glo bur du 'ongs pas kyang de las mi 'gal ba nyid du bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: A visitor should not violate them.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni khrims su bca' ba rjes su bsrung ba las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni khrims su bca' ba rjes su bsrung ba las so //
translated: “Them” means the rules.

original: glo bur du 'ongs pas kyang de la rjes su bsrung bar bya ba nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: glo bur du 'ongs pas kyang de la rjes su bsrung bar bya ba nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: A visitor should observe them.

original: yod dam med pa nyid dang ji lta bu yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir des de dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshogs 'di na dge 'dun gyi khrims su bya ba 'ga' zhig yod dam 'on te med yod na ji lta bu zhig ces bya ba
analyzed: yod dam med pa nyid dang ji lta bu yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir des de dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshogs 'di na dge 'dun gyi khrims su bya ba 'ga' zhig yod dam 'on te med yod na ji lta bu zhig ces bya ba
translated: In order to know whether or not there is a gathering, and if so, what it is like, he should ask about it. This means: Is there any rule of the Saṅgha to be observed in this community or not? If so, what is it like?

original: de yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir glo bur du 'ongs pa des de dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir glo bur du 'ongs pa des de dri bar bya'o //
translated: In order to know that, the newly arrived monk should ask about it.

original: dus gang gi tshe zhe na /
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe zhe na /
translated: At what time?

original: de'i phyir ha cang yun ring ba'o zhes bya ba smos te ha cang yun ring du gnas pa bas snga rol du zhes bya ba'i don to //

translated: Thus, the monks should be made suitable for full enjoyment by those who are without those, i.e. by those who are without bowls, etc.

analyzed: gang du ji zhig lhag par spyad na ltung ba ji lta bur 'gyur zhe na // de'i phyir blangs na nyes byas kyi'o //
translated: If one uses something else, what kind of downfall does one commit?

original: thob na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: thob na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If one accepts it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽If one obtains it, there is the basic offense.”

original: byed pa po ma rnyed pa la de las blangs na dngos gzhi'i spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byed pa po ma rnyed pa la de las blangs na dngos gzhi'i spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if one takes it from that person who is not a worker, there is a basic downfall of abandonment.

original: ci zhig thob na zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig thob na zhe na /
translated: What is obtained?

original: de'i phyir chos gos so zhes bya ba smos so ;
analyzed: de'i phyir chos gos so zhes bya ba smos so ;
translated: Therefore, it is said, “a robe.”

original: / tshad ji tsam zhig ce na /
analyzed: / tshad ji tsam zhig ce na /
translated: What is the measure?

original: de'i phyir mi chung ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi chung ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “not small.”

original: chos gos gsum gang yang rung ba las tshad dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chos gos gsum gang yang rung ba las tshad dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is the measure of any of the three robes.

original: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What kind?

original: de'i phyir rin thang dang / kha dog dang khru tshad las rnam pa gang blangs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rin thang dang / kha dog dang khru tshad las rnam pa gang blangs pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “any kind of value, color, or cubit.”

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / mthug po dang / le brgan rnams ni /🔽'dir kha dog gi rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / mthug po dang / le brgan rnams ni / 'dir kha dog gi rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: Blue, yellow, red, thick, and magenta🔽are the colors here.

original: de bas na 'dir kha dog byed pa can la kha dog gi sgra'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir kha dog byed pa can la kha dog gi sgra'o //
translated: Therefore, the word “color” is used for the maker of color here.🔽There is no offense if it is another value, another color,

original: gzhan la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni rin thang gzhan nam kha dog gzhan nam /
analyzed: gzhan la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni rin thang gzhan nam kha dog gzhan nam /
translated: or another cubit.

original: khru tshad gzhan thob pa ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: khru tshad gzhan thob pa ni ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one obtains another measure.

original: 'dir gzhung kha cig las ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung kha cig las ni /
translated: In this regard, some texts state:

original: dge slong gis chos gos sngon po slong par byed cing sngon po nyid thob nas de la slong bar byed na nyes byas so //
analyzed: dge slong gis chos gos sngon po slong par byed cing sngon po nyid thob nas de la slong bar byed na nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk asks for a blue robe and obtains a blue one, then when he asks for it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: thob pa na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: thob pa na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: When he obtains it, there is a pāyattika offense.

original: 'og ma la ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: 'og ma la ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no /
translated: There is no offense if it is less than that.

original: rin thang gi gzhung ni dge slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: rin thang gi gzhung ni dge slong ma'i rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: The standard for value is stated in the Bhikṣuṇī Vinaya:

original: dge slong mas chos @150b gos k'ar sh'a pa na lnga ri ba de nyid slong bar byed na nyes byas so /
analyzed: dge slong mas chos @150b gos k'ar sh'a pa na lnga ri ba de nyid slong bar byed na nyes byas so /
translated: If a bhikṣuṇī asks for a Dharma robe worth five kārṣāpaṇas, then when she asks for it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: thob pa na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: thob pa na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: When she obtains it, there is a pāyattika offense.

original: 'og ma la ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'og ma la ni ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: There is no offense if it is less than that.🔽The standard is stated in the Bhikṣu Vinaya:

original: tshad ni gzhung yang dge slong gi chos gos khru lnga pa slong bar byed cing des gos khru lnga pa nyid thob na slong ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: tshad ni gzhung yang dge slong gi chos gos khru lnga pa slong bar byed cing des gos khru lnga pa nyid thob na slong ba la nyes byas so //
translated: If a monk asks for a robe five cubits in size and obtains a robe five cubits in size, then when he asks for it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: thob pa na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
analyzed: thob pa na spang ba'i ltung byed do //
translated: When he obtains it, there is a pāyattika offense.

original: 'og ma la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'og ma la ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: There is no offense for the lower one.

original: 'dir 'og ma la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i tshig ni tha dad par 'gyur ba nyid la yin par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: 'dir 'og ma la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i tshig ni tha dad par 'gyur ba nyid la yin par rig par bya'i /
translated: Here, the phrase “there is no offense for the lower one” should be understood to refer to a different size.

original: 'og ma khru lnga pa slong ba la khru bcu pa thob pa la chos gos de nyid la khru lnga pa rnams la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: 'og ma khru lnga pa slong ba la khru bcu pa thob pa la chos gos de nyid la khru lnga pa rnams la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense for the lower one, a robe that is five cubits long, when it is obtained in exchange for a robe that is ten cubits long.

original: lnga po rnams la ni spang ba zhes bya ba'o //🔽slong ba la rnam par spyad pa ni thams cad spang ba'o //
analyzed: lnga po rnams la ni spang ba zhes bya ba'o // slong ba la rnam par spyad pa ni thams cad spang ba'o //
translated: The term “abandon” means “give up.”

original: ras ma dang kha tshar dag slong na'o zhes bya ba ni ltung ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽kha tshar dag slong ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ras ma dang kha tshar dag slong na'o zhes bya ba ni ltung ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar ro // kha tshar dag slong ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: “There is no offense when one is using what was obtained in exchange for something else” means that there is no offense when one is using a robe that was obtained in exchange for a robe that was requested.🔽There is no offense when one requests fringe material.

original: kha tshar bslangs pa las ras ma thob pa la yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: kha tshar bslangs pa las ras ma thob pa la yang ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense when one obtains cloth in exchange for fringe material.

original: ras ma bslangs nas ras yug chen dang / ras yug phran dag thob bo snyam nas bslangs shing thob pa na yang ltung ba med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ras ma bslangs nas ras yug chen dang / ras yug phran dag thob bo snyam nas bslangs shing thob pa na yang ltung ba med par rig par bya'o //
translated: If one asks for a piece of cloth, and receives a large or small piece of cloth, there is no offense.

original: gang zhig sbyor ba la ltung ba med par brjod pa de dag gis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig sbyor ba la ltung ba med par brjod pa de dag gis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The offenses that are included in the above are those that are said to be without offense in the performance.

original: rnyed pa la ni gang zhig ltung ba med pa'i tshig shin tu mang ba la yang 'di lta bu la 'dir nyes pa med par brjod pas de la grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnyed pa la ni gang zhig ltung ba med pa'i tshig shin tu mang ba la yang 'di lta bu la 'dir nyes pa med par brjod pas de la grub pa nyid do //
translated: As for the offense that is said to be without offense in the acquisition, there are many such statements, but here it is established that there is no offense in this case.

original: rgyu dang spun la ni na smad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni chos go tshad dang ldan pa longs spyod par gyur pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang spun dag lan smad pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu dang spun la ni na smad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni chos go tshad dang ldan pa longs spyod par gyur pa la sogs pa'i rgyu dang spun dag lan smad pa nyid do //
translated: As for the offense that is said to be without offense in the cause and in the relative, the cause is the possession of the proper measure of robes, and so on. The relative is one’s relatives.

original: chos gos mi chog pa nyid zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos gos mi chog pa nyid zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “the offense of not having enough robes” is that one does not have enough robes.

original: nyes byas tsam la ni 'di byed pa po de /
analyzed: nyes byas tsam la ni 'di byed pa po de /
translated: As for the offense that is said to be without offense in the performance, the agent of that offense

original: 'dis ni zhu ba las nye du ma yin pa las chos gos mi chog pa nyid slong na nyes byas kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽rgyu slong na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni zhu ba las nye du ma yin pa las chos gos mi chog pa nyid slong na nyes byas kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro // rgyu slong na yang nyes byas so //
translated: This includes the statement in the Questions of Upāli: “If one asks for a Dharma robe from someone who is not a relative, it is a minor offense.”🔽“If one asks for thread, it is a minor offense.”

original: spun slong na yang nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa de dag bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: spun slong na yang nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa de dag bsdus pa yin no //
translated: “If one asks for yarn, it is a minor offense.”

original: de'i rang bzhin ni de rdang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni de rdang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Its nature is the same as that.”

original: rgyu dang spun gyi skud pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang spun gyi skud pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: “Its nature is the same as that of thread and yarn.”

original: 'dis ni tha ga ba'i zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dis ni tha ga ba'i zhu ba las /
translated: This includes the statement in the Questions of the Weaver:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong ras ba la slong bar bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong ras ba la slong bar bgyid na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: “Lord, if a monk asks for cloth, what is the offense?”

original: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa de bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes gsungs pa de bsdus pa yin no //
translated: “It is a minor offense.”

original: slong ba'i spang ba ste drug pa'o /
analyzed: slong ba'i spang ba ste drug pa'o /
translated: This is the sixth training rule, on asking.

original: // / byin gyis brlab par bya ba thams cad med na slong bar rig pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / byin gyis brlab par bya ba thams cad med na slong bar rig pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: “If there is no one to consecrate it, one should know to ask.”

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni byin @151a * //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni byin @151a * //
translated: “No one” means no one who is a monk.

original: gyis brlab par bya ba chos gos gsum las gzhan pa la yang yo byad dang chos gos bcu gsum po rnams la ni rjes su gnang ba'o //
analyzed: gyis brlab par bya ba chos gos gsum las gzhan pa la yang yo byad dang chos gos bcu gsum po rnams la ni rjes su gnang ba'o //
translated: The other requisites, apart from the three robes, which are to be blessed, and the thirteen robes, are permitted.

original: med par gyur na yo byad thams cad blang bar rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: med par gyur na yo byad thams cad blang bar rig pa nyid do //
translated: If they are lost, all the requisites should be accepted.

original: chos gos gsum po 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos gos gsum po 'ba' zhig tu ma zad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not only the three robes.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: The text here is:

original: yi ge kha cig las ni dbyar gyi ras chen mi smos par khrus ras zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: yi ge kha cig las ni dbyar gyi ras chen mi smos par khrus ras zhes 'byung ste /
translated: In some manuscripts, instead of the rainy season robe, it says bathing robe.

original: nye du ma yin pa'i drung nas slong bar byed na ltung ba med ces bya'o //
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa'i drung nas slong bar byed na ltung ba med ces bya'o //
translated: If one begs from a non-relative, there is no offense.

original: de ni ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba la de ni zhes bya ba ni slong bar rigs pa la'o //
analyzed: de ni ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba la de ni zhes bya ba ni slong bar rigs pa la'o //
translated: That is the agent of the downfall means that is the one who should beg.

original: spyi tsam la 'di nye bar gnas pa ste rdzas la yang ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi tsam la 'di nye bar gnas pa ste rdzas la yang ma yin no //
translated: This is a general rule, not a rule about substances.

original: 'dir gang zag ni slong bar rigs par brjod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gang zag ni slong bar rigs par brjod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the person who should beg should be understood to be the one who is said to be suitable to beg.

original: nye du ma yin pa las chos gos slong ba rigs pa zhes bya ba byas nas so //
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa las chos gos slong ba rigs pa zhes bya ba byas nas so //
translated: It is proper to request Dharma robes from those who are not relatives.

original: slar yang de gang zhe na chos gos phrogs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: slar yang de gang zhe na chos gos phrogs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: What is that? It is the taking of Dharma robes and so on.

original: gang las 'dir nyes byas brjod pa nyid kyis slong bar mi rigs pa slong ba'i rnyed pa la snga ma'i ltung ba'o //
analyzed: gang las 'dir nyes byas brjod pa nyid kyis slong bar mi rigs pa slong ba'i rnyed pa la snga ma'i ltung ba'o //
translated: Here, the former downfall is to request from those who are not relatives, since it is improper to request.

original: 'di ni slong bar rigs pa slong bar byed pa'i dbang gis byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni slong bar rigs pa slong bar byed pa'i dbang gis byas pa'o //
translated: This is done by the power of requesting what is proper to request.

original: de gang las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de gang las 'byung zhe na /
translated: From what is it derived?

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo las chos gos chus khyer na nye du ma yin pa'i khyim bdag gam khyim bdag gi chung ma'i drung du song ste chos gos blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo las chos gos chus khyer na nye du ma yin pa'i khyim bdag gam khyim bdag gi chung ma'i drung du song ste chos gos blang bar bya'o //
translated: The Sūtra on the Discipline of Nuns says, “If your Dharma robes are carried off by water, you should go to a householder or the wife of a householder who is not a relative and take Dharma robes from them.”

original: de la gal te bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis chos gos rab tu mang po dag dus kyis stobs par gyur pa na dge slong des 'dod na chos gos de las stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs su bcas pa man chad blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la gal te bram ze dang khyim bdag dad pa can dag gis chos gos rab tu mang po dag dus kyis stobs par gyur pa na dge slong des 'dod na chos gos de las stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs su bcas pa man chad blang bar bya'o //
translated: If many robes are offered by faithful brahmins and householders, then if the monk desires them, he may accept up to three robes and a rains cloth.🔽If he accepts more than that, he commits a minor offense.

original: de las lhag par len na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes slong par rigs pas blangs te thob pa na ltung byed do zhes rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las lhag par len na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes slong par rigs pas blangs te thob pa na ltung byed do zhes rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Exposition declares:

original: gang zhig yang rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong gis khyim gyi nang du 'og ma 'og ma la slong bar byed cing /
analyzed: gang zhig yang rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong gis khyim gyi nang du 'og ma 'og ma la slong bar byed cing /
translated: If a monk begs for more than that, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.🔽The Bases of Discipline declares:🔽If a monk begs for more than that, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de blangs pa na nyes byas su 'gyur te spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de blangs pa na nyes byas su 'gyur te spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes brjod do //
translated: If he accepts it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: de la sbyor ba thob pa'i phyir sngar gyi bslab pa'i gzhi brjod pa dngos gzhi thob pa'i phyir gnyis ka dang 'brel pa 'dir bslang bar bya ba dang / slong bar byed pa'i dbang nyid kyis de rnyed pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sbyor ba thob pa'i phyir sngar gyi bslab pa'i gzhi brjod pa dngos gzhi thob pa'i phyir gnyis ka dang 'brel pa 'dir bslang bar bya ba dang / slong bar byed pa'i dbang nyid kyis de rnyed pa 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: Since one obtains the preparatory rite, one is to be initiated in the present context in order to obtain the actual rite.

original: gzhan yang bslang bar bya ba dang bslab pa'i dbang gis kyang bslab pa'i gzhi 'di dang 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang bslang bar bya ba dang bslab pa'i dbang gis kyang bslab pa'i gzhi 'di dang 'brel pa'o //
translated: Moreover, one is connected with this basis of training by the power of being initiated and the power of training.🔽Otherwise, one would not obtain it by the power of being initiated, since one would not have obtained the actual rite.🔽That which is stated by the power of being initiated is connected with the former basis of training.

original: @151b gzhan du na dngos gzhi longs ma spyad pa nyid thob pa'i phyir bslang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i dbang gis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni sngar gyi bslab pa'i gzhi dang 'brel pa bslang bar bya ba dang / slong bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir bslab pa'i gzhi las 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: @151b gzhan du na dngos gzhi longs ma spyad pa nyid thob pa'i phyir bslang bar bya ba ma yin pa'i dbang gis gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni sngar gyi bslab pa'i gzhi dang 'brel pa bslang bar bya ba dang / slong bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni 'dir bslab pa'i gzhi las 'brel pa'o //
translated: That which is stated by the power of training is connected with this basis of training.

original: zung bslang bar bya ba nyid ces bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba de'i rang bzhin bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: zung bslang bar bya ba nyid ces bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ba de'i rang bzhin bstan par bya ste /
translated: The nature of that which is to be initiated will be explained below.

original: khyim pa'i stod g-yogs che tshad ni ras yug chen khru bcu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i stod g-yogs che tshad ni ras yug chen khru bcu gnyis pa'o //
translated: The maximum size of a householder's upper robe is a large cloth of twelve cubits.🔽The lower robe is seven small cloths and a large one.

original: smad g-yogs ni ras yug phran bdun pa dang do pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir dge slong gi stod g-yogs che tshad kyi rkyen mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba rnam par gnas pa yin no ;
analyzed: smad g-yogs ni ras yug phran bdun pa dang do pa'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir dge slong gi stod g-yogs che tshad kyi rkyen mngon par 'dod pa zhes bya ba rnam par gnas pa yin no ;
translated: Here, the maximum size of a monk's upper robe is understood as the condition.

original: / de bas na dngos po gsum ni 'dir che tshad ces bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: / de bas na dngos po gsum ni 'dir che tshad ces bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the three things should be understood here as the maximum size.

original: dge slong gi che tshad ni /
analyzed: dge slong gi che tshad ni /
translated: The maximum size of a monk's robe

original: snam sbyar dang sham thabs kyi rim pa ji skad bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: snam sbyar dang sham thabs kyi rim pa ji skad bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: is the sequence of the patched robe and lower robe, as taught.

original: 'dir che tshad ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir che tshad ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Here, the maximum size is applied.🔽The pair should be made from discarded cloth.

original: zung bslang bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs kyi zung 'di la khyim pa dag dang / dge slong gi zung 'di dag las gang bslang bar bya ba nyid yin ce na /
analyzed: zung bslang bar bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs kyi zung 'di la khyim pa dag dang / dge slong gi zung 'di dag las gang bslang bar bya ba nyid yin ce na /
translated: This pair of upper and lower robes, from these pairs of householders and monks, which should be made from discarded cloth?

original: de'i phyir gang yang rung ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang yang rung ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said that any is suitable.

original: khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa 'am /
analyzed: khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa 'am /
translated: The upper robe and lower robe of a layperson,

original: dge slong gi stong g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge slong gi stong g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: or the upper robe and lower robe of a monk.

original: shugs kyis rtogs pa dang dngos su brjod par bya ste /🔽tshad de las lhag pa ni bslang bar bya ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tha dad par gyur kyang rung tha dad par gyur pa ma yin pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: shugs kyis rtogs pa dang dngos su brjod par bya ste / tshad de las lhag pa ni bslang bar bya ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tha dad par gyur kyang rung tha dad par gyur pa ma yin pa yang rung ste /
translated: The meaning is that it is understood by implication and should be stated explicitly.🔽It is not to be made more than that size, whether it is made separately or not.

original: tshad las lhag par bslang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad las lhag par bslang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be made more than that size, whether it is made separately or not.

original: de'i snga ma nyid la bslab pa'i gzhi las ltung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i snga ma nyid la bslab pa'i gzhi las ltung ba'o //
translated: The former is a downfall from the fundamental trainings.

original: 'dir zung bshad pa'i tshad gtso bo brjod par 'dod pa ma yin pa gcig dang 'brel pa nyid der byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir zung bshad pa'i tshad gtso bo brjod par 'dod pa ma yin pa gcig dang 'brel pa nyid der byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the size explained in the sutra is not intended to be the primary size, so it is made to be just that.

original: 'dis tha dad du gyur pa la chung ba rnyed pa la rdzogs par bya ba la blangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dis tha dad du gyur pa la chung ba rnyed pa la rdzogs par bya ba la blangs pa nyid do //
translated: By this, it is completed for one who obtains a smaller size separately.

original: de ni khyim pa'i stong g-yogs dang smad g-yogs las 'da' bar brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni khyim pa'i stong g-yogs dang smad g-yogs las 'da' bar brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be said that it exceeds the householder's upper and lower robes.

original: tshad de las lhag par ni bslang bar bya ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad de las lhag par ni bslang bar bya ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be made larger than that.

original: snga ma las na kha ba skang ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bslang bar bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: snga ma las na kha ba skang ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bslang bar bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: And also because it exceeds the former, means that the word also is stated because it exceeds the former.

original: snga ma zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs ma cho ga pa rnyed pa la de'i kha bskang ba bslang @152a * //
analyzed: snga ma zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs ma cho ga pa rnyed pa la de'i kha bskang ba bslang @152a * //
translated: The former means that it is not to be made larger than the householder's upper and lower robes, which are the measure of the robes.

original: bar mi bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bar mi bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not to be made larger than that.

original: khyim pa'i che tshad ni khru bcu gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba ni mchog tu gyur pa la khyim pa'i stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs kyi tshad du gsungs so //
analyzed: khyim pa'i che tshad ni khru bcu gnyis pa'o zhes bya ba ni mchog tu gyur pa la khyim pa'i stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs kyi tshad du gsungs so //
translated: The measure of the householder's is twelve cubits, means that the measure of the householder's upper and lower robes is stated as the maximum.

original: de bas na 'di las chung ba thams cad nyid du khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs la med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di las chung ba thams cad nyid du khyim pa'i stod g-yogs smad g-yogs la med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, all that is smaller than this is not the householder's upper and lower robes.

original: slar gang zhig 'di'i mthar thug pa'i rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: slar gang zhig 'di'i mthar thug pa'i rigs pa yin te /
translated: What is the limit of this?

original: ras yug chen khru bcu gnyis pa dang / ras yug phran bdun pa dang / do pa man chad nas ras yug chen khru phyed dang gsum pa dang / ji srid du phyed pa dang lnga pa'i bar dang ras yug phran 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad kyi bar ni chung ba'i mtha' yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ras yug chen khru bcu gnyis pa dang / ras yug phran bdun pa dang / do pa man chad nas ras yug chen khru phyed dang gsum pa dang / ji srid du phyed pa dang lnga pa'i bar dang ras yug phran 'khor gsum khebs pa'i tshad kyi bar ni chung ba'i mtha' yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The large cloth is twelve cubits, the small cloth is seven cubits, and the smallest is one cubit and three finger-widths. The large cloth is one cubit and three finger-widths, and so on up to half a cubit and five finger-widths. The small cloth is the size that covers the three areas. This is the limit of smallness.🔽Because the purpose of this is to show that when one has obtained the large and small cloths, one should not take more than that.

original: gang gi phyir 'di'i don grub pa nyid la ma blangs pa nyid ni rgyu nyid 'dir mthar thug pa'i don mthar thug pa'i khyim pa'i stong g-yogs dang smad g-yogs thob pa la khru bcu gnyis pa la sogs pa kha skong bar byed pa la 'di bslang bar mi🔽bya ba nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di'i don grub pa nyid la ma blangs pa nyid ni rgyu nyid 'dir mthar thug pa'i don mthar thug pa'i khyim pa'i stong g-yogs dang smad g-yogs thob pa la khru bcu gnyis pa la sogs pa kha skong bar byed pa la 'di bslang bar mi bya ba nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The purpose of this is to show that when one has obtained the large and small cloths, one should not take more than that.

original: mthar thug par gyur pa las kyang ma chog pa rnyed pa la blangs pa nyid kho na zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mthar thug par gyur pa las kyang ma chog pa rnyed pa la blangs pa nyid kho na zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The purpose of this is to show that when one has obtained the large and small cloths, one should not take more than that.

original: chos gos ma dras par 'chang bar 'dod pa las lhag ma gang zhig khyim pa'i stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs 'dod pa 'di la ma chog pa nyid kyis rdzogs pa nyid kyang ma yin zhes bya ba ma tshang ba 'di la bslang bar bya ba nyid ma yin
analyzed: chos gos ma dras par 'chang bar 'dod pa las lhag ma gang zhig khyim pa'i stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs 'dod pa 'di la ma chog pa nyid kyis rdzogs pa nyid kyang ma yin zhes bya ba ma tshang ba 'di la bslang bar bya ba nyid ma yin
translated: If one wishes to keep uncut Dharma robes, but does not have the remainder of a householder’s upper and lower robe, then since one does not have the complete set, one should not request the ceremony.

original: no // lhag pa sbyin par bya ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ji tsam gyis yang mchog tu gyur pa'i dge slong gi stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs yongs su rdzogs pa de tsam la yin gyi /
analyzed: no // lhag pa sbyin par bya ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ji tsam gyis yang mchog tu gyur pa'i dge slong gi stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs yongs su rdzogs pa de tsam la yin gyi /
translated: One should not give the remainder, because the ceremony is complete when one has the upper and lower robes of a fully ordained monk.

original: 'di las 'og tu ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di las 'og tu ma yin no //
translated: One should not give the remainder if one has less than that.

original: phyi ma thob na lhag ma sbyin par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyi ma thob na lhag ma sbyin par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one obtains the remainder later, one should give it.

original: gal te dge slong gis stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs dang bcas pa slong bar byed pa ni tshad las ches lhag pa zhig thob na de ni sbyin bdag de nyid la sbyin par bya ba ste yongs su rdzogs pa'i don las 'di lhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro
analyzed: gal te dge slong gis stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs dang bcas pa slong bar byed pa ni tshad las ches lhag pa zhig thob na de ni sbyin bdag de nyid la sbyin par bya ba ste yongs su rdzogs pa'i don las 'di lhag pa nyid kyi phyir ro
translated: If a monk asks for an upper robe and a lower robe, and obtains one that exceeds the proper size, then that is to be given to the donor himself, because it is more than the proper size.

original: // yongs su longs spyod pa'i don du ngo bo gang zhig chig rkyang la sogs pa 'dod pa des 'dir rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: // yongs su longs spyod pa'i don du ngo bo gang zhig chig rkyang la sogs pa 'dod pa des 'dir rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The nature of the proper size should be understood as established here by the one who desires a single robe, etc. for the purpose of complete enjoyment.

original: bor rlag byung ba nyid la nye du ma yin pa'i dge slong ma las chos gos len pa la rjes su gnang ba gang yin pa de'i stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs med pa der gtso bo nyid do //
analyzed: bor rlag byung ba nyid la nye du ma yin pa'i dge slong ma las chos gos len pa la rjes su gnang ba gang yin pa de'i stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs med pa der gtso bo nyid do //
translated: The principal rule is that when a monk who has lost all his robes is permitted to take robes from a nun who is not a relative, he should take an upper robe and a lower robe.

original: 'di tsam ni gzung bar @152b bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di tsam ni gzung bar @152b bya ba nyid do //
translated: This much is to be taken.

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa 'di med pa la rdzogs pa tsam la zhes bya ba 'di las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa 'di med pa la rdzogs pa tsam la zhes bya ba 'di las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The complete size is understood from this statement: “If it is incomplete, it is just complete.”

original: gang gi phyir 'di la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba sngar brjod pa de yang 'di las stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs tsam nyid la zhes bya ba shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la ltung ba med do zhes bya ba sngar brjod pa de yang 'di las stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs tsam nyid la zhes bya ba shes par bya'o //
translated: And the reason stated above, “because there is no offense for him,” should be understood as “because he has only the upper and lower robes.”

original: gang gi phyir slong ba la zhugs pa nyid ni 'dir phyi ma so sor 'dzin pa spong bar byed pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir slong ba la zhugs pa nyid ni 'dir phyi ma so sor 'dzin pa spong bar byed pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: The reason why engaging in begging is the cause for abandoning later personal belongings is as follows.

original: de bas na slong ba la ma zhugs pa nyid la chos gos med pa nyid dang chos gos yongs su rdzogs pa nyid thob pa la shin tu mang ba yin na yang 'di la 'dzin pa skyong med pa zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na slong ba la ma zhugs pa nyid la chos gos med pa nyid dang chos gos yongs su rdzogs pa nyid thob pa la shin tu mang ba yin na yang 'di la 'dzin pa skyong med pa zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even though not engaging in begging is the most important cause for obtaining the absence of robes and the completion of robes, it should be understood that he has no attachment to them.

original: ci ste blangs pa gzhan rnams la de sngon du 'gro ba can gyis don bsgrub pa rnams la gtogs pa gang yin pa de tsam gyi chos gos la skyon yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste blangs pa gzhan rnams la de sngon du 'gro ba can gyis don bsgrub pa rnams la gtogs pa gang yin pa de tsam gyi chos gos la skyon yod pa ma yin te /
translated: If one takes up other robes, there is no fault in having robes, since they are included in the accomplishment of the goal that is preceded by that.

original: chos gos ma yin pa la dgos pa med pa'am /
analyzed: chos gos ma yin pa la dgos pa med pa'am /
translated: But if one does not have robes, there is no need for them.

original: lhag pa 'chang ba'i dgos pa can yod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lhag pa 'chang ba'i dgos pa can yod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “having an excess for a purpose.”

original: slong bar rigs pa yin no snyam du rtogs pa 'dis slong ba la zhugs na bya ba gang la ltung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: slong bar rigs pa yin no snyam du rtogs pa 'dis slong ba la zhugs na bya ba gang la ltung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one engages in begging with the thought “It is proper to beg,” what action will cause a downfall?

original: de'i phyir bslang bar bya ba ma yin pa bslangs na nyes byas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bslang bar bya ba ma yin pa bslangs na nyes byas so //
translated: Therefore, “if one begs what should not be begged, it is wrong by action.”

original: thob na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig dge slong la gos dang kha zas la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa de slong pa las nyes byas so //
analyzed: thob na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig dge slong la gos dang kha zas la sogs pa rung ba ma yin pa de slong pa las nyes byas so //
translated: “If one obtains it, it is the actual basis” means that if one begs a monk for improper robes, food, and so on, it is wrong by action.

original: bslangs nas rnyed na dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: bslangs nas rnyed na dngos gzhi'o //
translated: If one obtains it by begging, it is the actual basis.

original: ma rnyed na nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma rnyed na nyes byas so //
translated: If one does not obtain it, it is wrong by action.

original: don gyis snga mar gtogs te 'di ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: don gyis snga mar gtogs te 'di ni nyes byas so //
translated: The former is included in the meaning.

original: gal te dngos gzhi'i las slong ba 'di ni 'di'i bslang bar bya ba las sngar rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: gal te dngos gzhi'i las slong ba 'di ni 'di'i bslang bar bya ba las sngar rnyed pa'o //
translated: If one begs for the actual basis of an action, it is obtained before one begs.

original: bslang bar bya ba ma yin ba slong bar byed pa sbyin par bya ba mi sbyin na yang ngo zhes bya ba la dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: bslang bar bya ba ma yin ba slong bar byed pa sbyin par bya ba mi sbyin na yang ngo zhes bya ba la dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: If one does not give to one who is not to be given to, when one is asked, it is also a root downfall.🔽The word also is mentioned because it is a continuation of the word “also” in the root text.🔽Here, the phrase “that which is to be given in excess” is mentioned in the case of not obtaining by asking that which is not to be asked for.

original: bslang bar bya ba ma yin pa bslangs pas ma thob pa la 'dir lhag par sbyin par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba smos pas thob pa nyid la gzhan la ltung ba 'grub ba la yang mi rigs pa'i phyir sbyin par bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: bslang bar bya ba ma yin pa bslangs pas ma thob pa la 'dir lhag par sbyin par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba smos pas thob pa nyid la gzhan la ltung ba 'grub ba la yang mi rigs pa'i phyir sbyin par bya ba nyid de /
translated: Since it is not reasonable for a downfall to be established in the case of that which is to be given,

original: de bas na 'di nyid 'dir ma sbyin na dngos gzhi'i zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di nyid 'dir ma sbyin na dngos gzhi'i zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: therefore, it should be understood that this is a root downfall if one does not give that which is to be given.

original: slong bar rigs pa'i spang ba'o /
analyzed: slong bar rigs pa'i spang ba'o /
translated: The rejection of that which is proper to ask for.

original: // / spags pa slong ba'i spang ba ni slong ba'i rab tu dbye bar gyur pa yin pas spags pa slong pa'i spang ba de nyid 'dir cho ga thob pa'i bsam pa tsam gyi bye brag de la de'i cho ga thob pa la 'di la brjod par bsgrub par🔽'gyur te / @153a * //
analyzed: // / spags pa slong ba'i spang ba ni slong ba'i rab tu dbye bar gyur pa yin pas spags pa slong pa'i spang ba de nyid 'dir cho ga thob pa'i bsam pa tsam gyi bye brag de la de'i cho ga thob pa la 'di la brjod par bsgrub par 'gyur te / @153a * //
translated: Therefore, the difference here is merely the intention to obtain a specific procedure.

original: de'i cho ga yongs su thob pa bsgrub pa'i don du bye brag 'di mtshungs pa nyid brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i cho ga yongs su thob pa bsgrub pa'i don du bye brag 'di mtshungs pa nyid brjod par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of obtaining a specific procedure is that this is accomplished by stating the following:

original: de'i phyir spags pa ma phul ba shes pa ni ma spags pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir spags pa ma phul ba shes pa ni ma spags pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The knowledge that one has not been offered fine robes is similar to not being offered robes.

original: 'dir yul gyi khyad par ni bye brag go zhes bya ba 'di tsam gyi mtshungs pa nyid brjod pas ma phul ba yod par gyur pa la /
analyzed: 'dir yul gyi khyad par ni bye brag go zhes bya ba 'di tsam gyi mtshungs pa nyid brjod pas ma phul ba yod par gyur pa la /
translated: Here, the similarity is merely the difference in the object.

original: gang zhig 'di la chos gos ster bar 'gyur ba zhes bya bar spags pa ji ltar yang ma shes pa de ni ma spags pa dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig 'di la chos gos ster bar 'gyur ba zhes bya bar spags pa ji ltar yang ma shes pa de ni ma spags pa dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: When one has not been offered robes, if one does not know that one has been offered fine robes, that is similar to not being offered robes.

original: bslangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bslangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: “in order to be given.”

original: de nyid gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis ma shes pa spags pa ni ma spags pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid gzhan yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis ma shes pa spags pa ni ma spags pa nyid do //
translated: “That very thing is another” means that what is not known by another is not known.

original: 'di ni slong pa'i spang ba'i gzhi nyid kyi khongs su gtogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni slong pa'i spang ba'i gzhi nyid kyi khongs su gtogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as included in the very basis of training for the one who asks.

original: de'i bslab pa'i gzhir gyur pa 'di la 'jug pa la skyed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i bslab pa'i gzhir gyur pa 'di la 'jug pa la skyed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the basis of training for that one. The meaning of “engaging in this” is “producing.”

original: rang nyid 'di la don gyis 'jug pa zhes bya ba dgongs pa'i dbang gis 'dir 'jug pa'i rnam pa nyid de ;
analyzed: rang nyid 'di la don gyis 'jug pa zhes bya ba dgongs pa'i dbang gis 'dir 'jug pa'i rnam pa nyid de ;
translated: The meaning of “engaging in this by oneself” is “engaging in this by the power of intention.”

original: de bas na mi bskyed pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na mi bskyed pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is not produced.

original: 'di mi shes pa nyid la zhes bya ba 'di shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di mi shes pa nyid la zhes bya ba 'di shes pa'o //
translated: “This is ignorance” means this is knowledge.

original: gang la mi shes pa nyid la slong ba la 'jug pa shes pa nyid la yang len pa la de dngos gzhi 'di yin nam /
analyzed: gang la mi shes pa nyid la slong ba la 'jug pa shes pa nyid la yang len pa la de dngos gzhi 'di yin nam /
translated: “In regard to what is not known, engaging in asking” means “in regard to what is known, engaging in taking.” Is this the actual basis?

original: 'on te de dang 'brel ba'i nyes byas zhes bya ba 'di las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te de dang 'brel ba'i nyes byas zhes bya ba 'di las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Or is it a fault connected with that? This should be understood from the text.

original: spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'o /
analyzed: spags pa slong ba'i spang ba'o /
translated: Asking for what is not known is the basis of training.

original: // / sbyin pa po 'di dag las sbungs che ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'dir rab tu gtong ba nyid dang tsham tshom med pa nyid la don gyis 'jug pa 'di zhes bya ba bye brag 'dis so sor spags pa dag la slong pa dang de sngon
analyzed: // / sbyin pa po 'di dag las sbungs che ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'dir rab tu gtong ba nyid dang tsham tshom med pa nyid la don gyis 'jug pa 'di zhes bya ba bye brag 'dis so sor spags pa dag la slong pa dang de sngon
translated: The phrase among these givers, the one who is most magnanimous refers to the one who is most generous and who is free of hesitation. The term this one in the phrase this one is the best refers to the one who is most magnanimous.

original: du 'gro ba can gyi slong ba la 'jug pa 'di gzhan yin te snga ma ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i blo'o //
analyzed: du 'gro ba can gyi slong ba la 'jug pa 'di gzhan yin te snga ma ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i blo'o //
translated: The meaning of these givers are more magnanimous is that they engage in the meaning of generosity and lack of hesitation. This is the distinction. The thought is that the engagement in giving to those who are beggars and the engagement in giving to those who are not beggars is different, not the same. The former is not the latter.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir 'jug pa yang nyes pa med pa'i blos sngar bslab pa'i gzhi yod pa la yod par gyur pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi gzhan yod par 'gyur ba de la btags pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir 'jug pa yang nyes pa med pa'i blos sngar bslab pa'i gzhi yod pa la yod par gyur pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi gzhan yod par 'gyur ba de la btags pa'o //
translated: Because here, the thought is without fault. The basis of training that exists is the basis of training that exists. That is designated.

original: 'di ni ltung ba dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni ltung ba dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a downfall.

original: sngar nyid du mi 'jug pa bya ba srid pa yin no //
analyzed: sngar nyid du mi 'jug pa bya ba srid pa yin no //
translated: It is possible to act without engaging in it from the beginning.

original: de la 'di la yang de'i cho ga yongs su thob pas nye bar brjod pa mi slu bar byed cing /
analyzed: de la 'di la yang de'i cho ga yongs su thob pas nye bar brjod pa mi slu bar byed cing /
translated: In that regard, here too, by attaining the rite of that, one acts without deceiving the statement.

original: de'i cho ga yongs su thob pa la bsgrub pa'i don du yul 'di la mtshungs pa nyid du bye brag la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i cho ga yongs su thob pa la bsgrub pa'i don du yul 'di la mtshungs pa nyid du bye brag la brjod par bya ste /
translated: In order to establish the obtainment of its rite, the object is described as being the same in the case of distinctions.

original: sbyin par byed pa spungs che ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni spags pa ma phul ba zhes bya ba @153b ni ma spags pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //🔽sbyor ba gcig pa'i phyir thob na gcig nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sbyin par byed pa spungs che ba yang ngo zhes bya ba ni spags pa ma phul ba zhes bya ba @153b ni ma spags pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o // sbyor ba gcig pa'i phyir thob na gcig nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The giver is also a great heap means that the giving is not a small amount.

original: sbyor ba gcig pa'i phyir thob na rdzas tha dad pa can la yang rnyed pa la gcig pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: yin no // 'di ltar 'brog phyogs dag tu grang ba'i gnyen po ni 'ding ba'i dgos pa ste /

original: 'di rgyu mtshan du rjes su gnang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rgyu mtshan du rjes su gnang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha permitted this as a reason for using a covering.

analyzed: de'i phyir srin bal gyi las byas sam byed du bcug na'o zhes bya ba smos te /

original: byas pa 'am byed du bcug pa la srin bal gyi gding ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byas pa 'am byed du bcug pa la srin bal gyi gding ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “a woolen item” is that which is made or caused to be made with black antelope skin.

original: thams cad pa 'am so so ba byas pa 'am byed du bcug pa dag la nyes pa dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: thams cad pa 'am so so ba byas pa 'am byed du bcug pa dag la nyes pa dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: If one makes or causes to be made all or part of it, one comes to possess an offense.

analyzed: gang zhig gnas pa la mthar thug pas 'khor gsum g-yogs pa nyid do //
translated: If one is a resident monk, the three spheres are complete because of the finality of the action.

original: de nyid 'di spang bar byed pa nyid la rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid 'di spang bar byed pa nyid la rtogs par bya'o //

analyzed: 'di tsam nyid kyis 'dir yang mthar thug par gyur pa'i don la bkram pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the meaning of the finality of the action is the spreading out, etc.

original: gang zhig mthar thug pa'i gos rnying par gyur pa rnams la brkus na longs spyod pa rnams ni bal las byas pa rnams la spang bar byed pa nyid du rnam par gnas pa zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //

translated: If one steals old robes that have reached the final stage of use, one comes to possess an offense in relation to the use of woolen items. This should be understood.

original: 'di rnams la thams cad phyi ma dag la nyes byas nyid de chung ba la yang 'dir 'jug pas rjes su mthun pa nyid kyang byi dor la sogs pa'i don de la de tsam du'o //

translated: For all of these, it is a wrong action in the future, and it is also suitable to engage in this small one.

original: stan la ni bkram pa nyid byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po nyid yin no zhes bya ba las gding ba nyid thams cad kyi dang po'o //
analyzed: stan la ni bkram pa nyid byed pa mthar thug pa'i dang po nyid yin no zhes bya ba las gding ba nyid thams cad kyi dang po'o //

original: 'di tsam byas pa la dngos gzhi bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di tsam byas pa la dngos gzhi bskyed pa'o //

original: gang tshun chad bkram par gyur na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang tshun chad bkram par gyur na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: gang gi tshe dkar po dang / 'khob bal dag ni lhag par gyur la lug gi bal nag po dag ni nyung ba 'am mnyam par gyur na ni de'i tshe ltung ba med do //
translated: When the white and black wool are predominant, and the sheep’s black wool is small or equal, then there is no offense.

original: phyed dkar po dang 'khob bal dag las cha mnyam pa nyid du'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyed dkar po dang 'khob bal dag las cha mnyam pa nyid du'o zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: ci'i phyir slar 'di la gsungs te /

analyzed: bal gyis byas pa la ni ltung bas de yang ras bal las byas pa la ni ltung ba med pa'o //

analyzed: bal nag po 'ba' zhig la ltung ba med de /

translated: The meaning of the rule is that it is difficult to obtain and expensive, since it is made of the essence of the substance.🔽What is white sheep’s wool? What is blanket wool?

analyzed: ltung ba med par byas pa nyid du gyur pa la yang yongs su bsgyur ba skyes pa ma yin no ;
translated: And when one has already made it so that there is no downfall, the transformation does not arise.

original: / de bas na 'dir sbyor ba la ltung ba ma yin par byas pa nyid du rtogs par bya ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'di'i dag gi don to //
analyzed: / de bas na 'dir sbyor ba la ltung ba ma yin par byas pa nyid du rtogs par bya ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni 'di'i dag gi don to //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of this passage is that one should not understand that the preparation is made so that there is no downfall.

original: rab tu byung ba gzhan gyi ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba gzhan gyi ni tha dad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The other is different.

original: sngon dang phyis rab tu byung ba dang rab tu dbyung ba dag la rgyun gcig pa nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di shes par gyur pa'i don la 'di rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: sngon dang phyis rab tu byung ba dang rab tu dbyung ba dag la rgyun gcig pa nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di shes par gyur pa'i don la 'di rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: This is a statement about the meaning that should be understood, that the prior and subsequent renunciations and the prior and subsequent initiations are not in the same continuum.🔽The other is not made in the case of one who has already gone forth, or who has not obtained the requisite robe.

original: rab tu byung ba gzhan byas pa mi rtsom ba'am rnyed pa ma yin pa gding ba la gzhan rab tu ma byung ba la dus 'og ma yongs su rdzogs pa la bya ba nyid med pa 'di bstan pa'i don du gcig brtsams pa la gzhan mthar thug pa
analyzed: rab tu byung ba gzhan byas pa mi rtsom ba'am rnyed pa ma yin pa gding ba la gzhan rab tu ma byung ba la dus 'og ma yongs su rdzogs pa la bya ba nyid med pa 'di bstan pa'i don du gcig brtsams pa la gzhan mthar thug pa
translated: This is taught for the purpose of showing that one who has gone forth does not make an effort, or one who has not obtained the requisite robe does not go forth, and that one who has gone forth does not have the same time period for completing the robe.

original: la dngos gzhi med pa la ji ltar yang khyim pa'i gnas skabs bzhin te /
analyzed: la dngos gzhi med pa la ji ltar yang khyim pa'i gnas skabs bzhin te /
translated: It is like the state of a layperson.

original: mi rtsom pa 'am thob par bya ba nyid med pa de bzhin du 'dir yang zhes bya ba rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtsom pa 'am thob par bya ba nyid med pa de bzhin du 'dir yang zhes bya ba rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Just as there is no need to begin or obtain that state, so too there is no need to begin or obtain the state of a fully ordained monk.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhub kha cig las dge slong 'ga' zhig yod de /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhub kha cig las dge slong 'ga' zhig yod de /
translated: Here, some texts state:

original: lo drug gi mdun rol du des gding ba byed du bcug na ltung ba med par yang 'gyur la lo @158b drug gi mdun rol du babs shing des slar yang bsnyen par rdzogs nas stan gzhan byed du bcug na ltung ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: lo drug gi mdun rol du des gding ba byed du bcug na ltung ba med par yang 'gyur la lo @158b drug gi mdun rol du babs shing des slar yang bsnyen par rdzogs nas stan gzhan byed du bcug na ltung ba med pa yin no //
translated: If a fully ordained monk has six years remaining, if he makes another mat, there is no offense. If he has less than six years remaining, if he again completes the novitiate and makes another mat, there is no offense.

original: brtsams te 'babs pa yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽lo drug tu bcang ba'i spang ba'o /
analyzed: brtsams te 'babs pa yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no // lo drug tu bcang ba'i spang ba'o /
translated: If he begins and then has six years remaining, it is the same.🔽This is the exception to the rule to keep a mat for six years.

original: // / ci zhig byas na mtho gang gis spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / ci zhig byas na mtho gang gis spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is done to make it an exception to the rule to keep a mat for six years?

original: de'i phyir gding pa rnying pa las /
analyzed: de'i phyir gding pa rnying pa las /
translated: Therefore, the old mat is discarded.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa'i gding ba sar pa spyod na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa'i gding ba sar pa spyod na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one uses a new blanket that is not reinforced with a patch the size of a sugata.

original: gding ba sar pa gang la gding ba rnying pa las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa de ni gding ba las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa ste /
