analyzed: gding ba sar pa gang la gding ba rnying pa las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa de ni gding ba las bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang gis ma glan pa ste /
translated: A new blanket that is not reinforced with a patch the size of a sugata is a new blanket that is not reinforced with a patch the size of a sugata.

original: yongs su longs ma spyad pa'i sar pa zhes bya ba ni sar pa rnyed kyang rnyed pa byas pa la yang sbyin pa nyid mthong ba rdzas rnying pa la yang 'dir sbyin par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: yongs su longs ma spyad pa'i sar pa zhes bya ba ni sar pa rnyed kyang rnyed pa byas pa la yang sbyin pa nyid mthong ba rdzas rnying pa la yang 'dir sbyin par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Even if one obtains a new blanket, one should make a gift of it, and one should make a gift of it even if it is an old substance.

original: 'dir byas pa nyid kyi sar pa nyid du brjod de rdzas la ni ma yin zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir byas pa nyid kyi sar pa nyid du brjod de rdzas la ni ma yin zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, it is said to be new because it is made, and not because of the substance. This should be understood.

original: ci mnyam pa nyid la yang gding ba las khru gang ma glan par sar pa longs spyod pa la ltung ba 'di yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci mnyam pa nyid la yang gding ba las khru gang ma glan par sar pa longs spyod pa la ltung ba 'di yin nam zhe na /
translated: Here, is this downfall for using a new blanket that is not reinforced with a patch the size of a sugata also for one who uses a blanket the same size as a sugata?

original: de'i phyir gal te de yod na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te de yod na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, “If it exists.”

original: ci gal te ril gyis mi bdog na yang /
analyzed: ci gal te ril gyis mi bdog na yang /
translated: What if it is not completely destroyed?

original: de'i phyir ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Is there a downfall in this case?

original: de'i phyir de tsam na yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de tsam na yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “Even if it is that much,”

original: gal te bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang tsam zhig yod na yang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho gang tsam zhig yod na yang ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning that even if the Blessed One’s height is that much.

original: ci gal te sra ba de tsam zhig yod na 'am zhes /🔽de'i phyir bcos par nus na yang ngo //
analyzed: ci gal te sra ba de tsam zhig yod na 'am zhes / de'i phyir bcos par nus na yang ngo //
translated: What if it is that much of a solid object?🔽Therefore it says, “If it can be repaired,”

original: mthud cing sbyar du rung bas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni bcos par rung ba yang gal te de tsam du gyur na mthud pas sam /
analyzed: mthud cing sbyar du rung bas kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni bcos par rung ba yang gal te de tsam du gyur na mthud pas sam /
translated: meaning that if it is possible to repair it, it is also to be accepted if it is possible to join it together.

original: dam dum du sbyar du rung na des kyang gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dam dum du sbyar du rung na des kyang gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is also to be accepted if it is possible to join it together tightly.

original: de ltar yang med pa nyid la ltung ba med ces bya ba 'dir skyes par rig par bya'o //🔽mtho gang gi spang ba'o /
analyzed: de ltar yang med pa nyid la ltung ba med ces bya ba 'dir skyes par rig par bya'o // mtho gang gi spang ba'o /
translated: Thus, if it does not exist in that way, there is no downfall. This is to be understood as the origin of the rule.🔽This is the origin of the rule about a cubit.

original: // / ci zhig byas na bal thogs pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / ci zhig byas na bal thogs pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the downfall for possessing wool?

original: de'i phyir khyer ba med na dpag tshad gsum las lhag par lug gi bal khyer na'o //🔽yod na yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyer ba med na dpag tshad gsum las lhag par lug gi bal khyer na'o // yod na yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, if one does not carry wool, one commits an offense if one carries more than three yojanas.🔽If one does carry it, one commits an offense if one carries it more than three yojanas.

original: khyer ba med na dpag tshad gsum las 'das par khur ba yod pa la khur ba nyid du brtsams nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyer ba med na dpag tshad gsum las 'das par khur ba yod pa la khur ba nyid du brtsams nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one does not carry it, one commits an offense if one carries it more than three yojanas.

original: 'gro ba ni gnyis su gsungs te /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni gnyis su gsungs te /
translated: Two kinds of going are taught:

original: ltung ba dang bcas pa dang / ltung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba dang bcas pa dang / ltung ba med pa'o //
translated: with downfall and without downfall.

original: de la ltung ba dang bcas pa ni bal thogs pa dang / dge slong ma @159a * //
analyzed: de la ltung ba dang bcas pa ni bal thogs pa dang / dge slong ma @159a * //
translated: Among them, going with downfall is carrying wool, going on the road with a nun,

original: dang lhan cig lam du 'gro ba dang / dge slong ma dang / lhan cig grur 'jug pa dang / skyes pa med par lam du 'gro ba dang rkun ma dang lhan cig lam du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dang lhan cig lam du 'gro ba dang / dge slong ma dang / lhan cig grur 'jug pa dang / skyes pa med par lam du 'gro ba dang rkun ma dang lhan cig lam du 'gro ba'o //
translated: going in a boat with a nun, going on the road without a man, and going on the road with thieves.

original: de la ltung ba med pa ni yang yang za ba dang / 'dus shing za ba dang / khrus byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la ltung ba med pa ni yang yang za ba dang / 'dus shing za ba dang / khrus byed pa'o //
translated: Among them, going without downfall is eating again, eating in an assembly, and bathing.

original: de la ltung ba med pa ni dpag tshad phyed do zhes 'og nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de la ltung ba med pa ni dpag tshad phyed do zhes 'og nas 'byung ngo //
translated: Among them, going without downfall is half a yojana, as will be explained below.

original: de'i tshad ltung ba la bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshad ltung ba la bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The measure of that is taught in the case of falling:

original: lam du 'gro ba ni rgyang grags kyi bdag po nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lam du 'gro ba ni rgyang grags kyi bdag po nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: “One who goes by a path is the owner of a krośa.”

original: dmag la lta ba'i phyir 'gro bar bya ba la sogs pa las rnam par bcad pa'i phyir 'dir lam gyi tshig go //
analyzed: dmag la lta ba'i phyir 'gro bar bya ba la sogs pa las rnam par bcad pa'i phyir 'dir lam gyi tshig go //
translated: The word “path” here is to exclude going to see an army, and so on.

original: gang zhig chu'i lam nas 'gro ba ni 'di yin te grus gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig chu'i lam nas 'gro ba ni 'di yin te grus gang yin pa'o //
translated: One who goes by a water path is one who goes by boat.

original: de bas na 'di dang 'gro ba'i don du lam bzung bas 'phangs pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di dang 'gro ba'i don du lam bzung bas 'phangs pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the meaning of “going” is taken to be the path.

original: de ltar na gru'i lam gyis song ba dang / chu'i lam gyis song ba zhes bya ba ni grags pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gru'i lam gyis song ba dang / chu'i lam gyis song ba zhes bya ba ni grags pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is well known that one goes by a path of a boat and one goes by a water path.

original: de bas na rkun ma dang lhan cig gam skyes pa med par bud med dang lhan cig gru gcig gi nang du 'gro bar mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rkun ma dang lhan cig gam skyes pa med par bud med dang lhan cig gru gcig gi nang du 'gro bar mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand that one should not go in a boat with a thief or with a woman without a man.

original: 'di ni shin tu yang skyon dang ldan pa lam du 'gro ba las shin tu gsang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni shin tu yang skyon dang ldan pa lam du 'gro ba las shin tu gsang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is a very great fault, because it is extremely secret for one who is on the path.

original: gleng gzhi las mi 'byung bas 'dir tha dad pa'i tshig ni grub pa ma yin zhes bya ba rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: gleng gzhi las mi 'byung bas 'dir tha dad pa'i tshig ni grub pa ma yin zhes bya ba rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Since it does not occur in the nidana, the statement here that it is distinct is not established.

original: khrus la ni cho ga 'di mi rigs pas ma grub pa'i phyir grur 'gro ba la khrus la 'ongs pa nyid la yang yang za ba la 'dir lhag por med par de'i dbang gis kyang nyam chung ba dang shin tu grags pa dag la tshogs su za ba
analyzed: khrus la ni cho ga 'di mi rigs pas ma grub pa'i phyir grur 'gro ba la khrus la 'ongs pa nyid la yang yang za ba la 'dir lhag por med par de'i dbang gis kyang nyam chung ba dang shin tu grags pa dag la tshogs su za ba
translated: Since this rite is not appropriate for bathing, it is not established. Therefore, for one who has come to bathe while going in a boat, for one who eats again, for one who is weak due to that, and for one who is very famous, it is not possible to eat in the assembly here.

original: la 'dir yod pa yin no //
analyzed: la 'dir yod pa yin no //
translated: Here it exists.

original: rgyu mtshan ni sbyin pa po gcig ma grub pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan ni sbyin pa po gcig ma grub pa'o //
translated: The reason is that one donor is not established.

original: bal thogs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi gzhan yod pas lhag por gyi glags med pa'o //
analyzed: bal thogs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi gzhan yod pas lhag por gyi glags med pa'o //
translated: Since there is another basis of training for carrying wool, it is not possible to add.

original: mtshan nyid brjod pa nyid kyi phyir mdo 'di la thams cad du dbang byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid brjod pa nyid kyi phyir mdo 'di la thams cad du dbang byas pa nyid do //
translated: Since it is stated in the characteristics themselves, in this sutra it is always controlled.

original: 'di'i dmigs kyis bsal ba ni dpag tshad phyed kyi lam zhes bya ba ni rgyang grags kyi tha mar yongs su rdzogs pa nyid 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid la 'di tsam rdzogs pa la lhag por ram /
analyzed: 'di'i dmigs kyis bsal ba ni dpag tshad phyed kyi lam zhes bya ba ni rgyang grags kyi tha mar yongs su rdzogs pa nyid 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid la 'di tsam rdzogs pa la lhag por ram /
translated: This much is completed in the definition of going.🔽Here, the primary factor is the cognition that arises simultaneously with it.

original: de 'dir de dang lhan cig skyes pa'i rnam par rig pa la dngos gzhi rgyang grags re re gzhan dang gzhan zhes bya ba 'di'i byed pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dir de dang lhan cig skyes pa'i rnam par rig pa la dngos gzhi rgyang grags re re gzhan dang gzhan zhes bya ba 'di'i byed pa'o //
translated: Each krośa is different from the other. This is its function.

original: phyed du na sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyang grags kyi phyed kyi bdag po nyid du song na sbyor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyed du na sbyor ba'o zhes bya ba ni rgyang grags kyi phyed kyi bdag po nyid du song na sbyor bar 'gyur te /
translated: Half of that is preparation. When it becomes the master of half a krośa, it becomes preparation.

original: de tsam du son na sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs pa nyid @159b yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de tsam du son na sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs pa nyid @159b yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When it reaches that much, it is the completion of preparation. This is the meaning.

original: 'di nas brtsams te /
analyzed: 'di nas brtsams te /
translated: From here on,

original: sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: sbyor ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa nyid do //
translated: it becomes the definition of the completion of preparation.

original: mdun du ni na smad pa med pa nyid dang na smad pa'i dmun nas nyes byas med pa 'di nas brtsams te rdzogs pa nyid la 'di byed pa'o //
analyzed: mdun du ni na smad pa med pa nyid dang na smad pa'i dmun nas nyes byas med pa 'di nas brtsams te rdzogs pa nyid la 'di byed pa'o //
translated: In front, it is the absence of contempt and the absence of fault beginning from the absence of contempt.

original: 'dir gzhung ni rgyang grags phyed du son por kyur na nyes byas kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni rgyang grags phyed du son por kyur na nyes byas kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, the text says: “If one goes half a krośa, there is a transgression of an offense.

original: rgyang grags su son na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyang grags su son na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one goes a krośa, there is a downfall of a partial defeat.”

original: rdzu 'phrul gzhan bas nam mkha' la 'gro na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gzhan bas nam mkha' la 'gro na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one goes through the air by means of magical power, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang bcas pas nam mkha' nas 'gro na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang bcas pas nam mkha' nas 'gro na ltung ba med do //
translated: If one goes through the air by means of magical power, there is no offense.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis nam mkha' nas 'gro na nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽sprul pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba las kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis nam mkha' nas 'gro na nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i don to // sprul pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba las kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni /
translated: If one goes through the air by some other means, there is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽Also by means of a magical creation.

original: nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word also is for the purpose of connecting it with the offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'di yang rdzu 'phrul dang bcas par 'gro ba zhes bya ba de'i phyir ltung ba med pa'i skabs yod pa la rtsom pa 'di'o /
analyzed: 'di yang rdzu 'phrul dang bcas par 'gro ba zhes bya ba de'i phyir ltung ba med pa'i skabs yod pa la rtsom pa 'di'o /
translated: Also, it is called “going with supernatural power” because it is a basis for the non-lapse of the mind.

original: // /'di yang mi rigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: // /'di yang mi rigs pa ma yin te //
translated: This is not illogical.

original: de'i lus kyi rnam par rig byed yang dag par ldang bar byed pa mngon par brtson pa sprul pa la yod pa'i phyir brgyud nas 'byung ba'i yod pas mtshan nyid pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i lus kyi rnam par rig byed yang dag par ldang bar byed pa mngon par brtson pa sprul pa la yod pa'i phyir brgyud nas 'byung ba'i yod pas mtshan nyid pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the body of the emanation is engaged in manifesting physical action, it is not a real basis, but a basis that occurs through a continuum.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: Here, the text of the Questions of Upāli states:

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis nam mkha' las bal 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis nam mkha' las bal 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: “If a bhikṣu eats wool that is in the sky, what is his offense?”

original: rdzu 'phrul gyis khyer na ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyis khyer na ni ltung ba med do //
translated: “If he takes it with supernatural power, there is no offense.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis khyer na ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis khyer na ni nyes byas so //
translated: If he takes it in another way, there is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis sbrul pas rung bar ba gyis pa 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis sbrul pas rung bar ba gyis pa 'tshal na ltung ba cir 'gyur /
translated: “If a bhikṣu eats wool that is approved by a magical emanation, what is his offense?”

original: nyes byas 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin no /
analyzed: nyes byas 'gyur zhes gsungs pa yin no /
translated: “It is said that there is an offense of wrong conduct.”

original: zhva dang lham sgro gu can dang stod kor nang tshangs can dang / rgya cang dang lcag po dang shur bu phre'u la sogs pa'i don du de tsam dag la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni zhva la sogs pa'i tshad ldang ba'i bal rnams la zhva la sogs pa'i tshad du khyer ba la ni ltung ba med do🔽zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhva dang lham sgro gu can dang stod kor nang tshangs can dang / rgya cang dang lcag po dang shur bu phre'u la sogs pa'i don du de tsam dag la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni zhva la sogs pa'i tshad ldang ba'i bal rnams la zhva la sogs pa'i tshad du khyer ba la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no offense for carrying wool that is the measure of shoes and so on to the measure of shoes and so on.

original: rgyang grags kyi tshad brjod par bya ste /🔽rdul phra rab dang / rdul phra mo dang / chu dang / lcags dang / ri bong dang / lug dang / glang dang / nyi zer gyi rdul dang / sro ma dang / shig dang / nas dang / sor rnams ni snga ma drug la phyi ma'o //
analyzed: rgyang grags kyi tshad brjod par bya ste / rdul phra rab dang / rdul phra mo dang / chu dang / lcags dang / ri bong dang / lug dang / glang dang / nyi zer gyi rdul dang / sro ma dang / shig dang / nas dang / sor rnams ni snga ma drug la phyi ma'o //
translated: The measure of a krośa should be stated.🔽The measure of a krośa is six measures of a dhanus, and a dhanus is four cubits.🔽The measure of a dhanus is four cubits.🔽The measure of a cubit is four times the length of a finger joint.

original: sor bzhi drug la khru gang ngo //🔽khru phyed dang bzhi la ni mi'i srid do //
analyzed: sor bzhi drug la khru gang ngo // khru phyed dang bzhi la ni mi'i srid do //
translated: The measure of a finger joint is the width of a barley seed.🔽The measure of a barley seed is seven of the smallest particles.

original: khru bzhi la gzhu gang ngo //
analyzed: khru bzhi la gzhu gang ngo //
translated: The measure of the smallest particle is the measure of an atom.

original: de lnga brgya la rgyang grags so zhes bya ba ni nas 'bru drug glos gzhibs @160a * //🔽pa la sor gcig tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de lnga brgya la rgyang grags so zhes bya ba ni nas 'bru drug glos gzhibs @160a * // pa la sor gcig tu rig par bya ste /
translated: Six barley grains are equal to one barley seed.

original: 'dir gzhung ni nas drug la sor mo'i tshigs gcig go zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni nas drug la sor mo'i tshigs gcig go zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text says that six barley seeds are equal to one finger joint.

original: sor mo gang yin pa'i tshigs kyi tshigs la zhes bya ba ni 'di bstan pa'i don du 'dir tshigs kyi tshigs rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sor mo gang yin pa'i tshigs kyi tshigs la zhes bya ba ni 'di bstan pa'i don du 'dir tshigs kyi tshigs rig par bya'o //
translated: One finger is equal to the length of one finger joint.

original: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du nags khrod dgon pa bsten pa la dge slong mas dgon par gnas par mi bya ba gsungs pas mngon par bsten par bya ba'i dgon pa'i ngo bo brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du nags khrod dgon pa bsten pa la dge slong mas dgon par gnas par mi bya ba gsungs pas mngon par bsten par bya ba'i dgon pa'i ngo bo brjod par bya ste /
translated: The Blessed One said that a nun should not live in a forest because of the danger of living in a forest. Therefore, the nature of a forest that should not be relied upon should be stated.

original: de'i phyir dgon pa'i dang po de'i mtho'i bya ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgon pa'i dang po de'i mtho'i bya ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the first forest is beyond that.

original: rgyang grags kyi mthar zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgyang grags kyi mthar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of beyond is beyond one krośa.

original: lus kyis khur mi bskur ro zhes bya ba la lus kyi khur zhes bya ba phrag gdang gi khur la bya ste /🔽phrag gdang gis khur bskur bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: lus kyis khur mi bskur ro zhes bya ba la lus kyi khur zhes bya ba phrag gdang gi khur la bya ste / phrag gdang gis khur bskur bar mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not carry a load with the body” means one should not carry a load on the shoulders.

original: glo dang rgyab dang rked pa dang / mgo bo dag gis mi bskur ro zhes bya bar ro /
analyzed: glo dang rgyab dang rked pa dang / mgo bo dag gis mi bskur ro zhes bya bar ro /
translated: “One should not carry a load with the chest, back, waist, or head” means one should not carry a load on the chest, back, waist, or head.

original: khur bskur ba thams cad la ni 'di rnams nyid bkag pa'o //
analyzed: khur bskur ba thams cad la ni 'di rnams nyid bkag pa'o //
translated: All of these are prohibited for carrying a load.

original: 'dir thun mong ma yin pa nyid du dogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni lus kyis mi bskur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge slong ma rnams kyis thun mongs yin pa nyid du dogs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir thun mong ma yin pa nyid du dogs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni lus kyis mi bskur zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dge slong ma rnams kyis thun mongs yin pa nyid du dogs par mi bya ste /
translated: “One should not suspect that this is not common” means one should not suspect that “not carrying with the body” and so on is not common to the nuns.

original: dge slong ma rnams kyis kyang 'di mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyis kyang 'di mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the nuns should not do this.

original: khur phyed las lhag pa bskur bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni mi khur gang yin de dge slong gnyis kyis bskur bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: khur phyed las lhag pa bskur bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la 'dir gzhung ni mi khur gang yin de dge slong gnyis kyis bskur bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “One should not carry more than half a load” means that in this case the text says that a load carried by one person should be carried by two monks.

original: bal thogs pa'i spang ba'o /
analyzed: bal thogs pa'i spang ba'o /
translated: This is the avoidance of carrying wool.🔽The avoidance of having wool washed is the same as the avoidance of having wool spun.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun should be distinguished from the avoidance of having wool washed.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.

original: // /'khrur 'jug pa'i spang ba la tshog gang yin pa de nyid las bal rmel du 'jug pa'i spang bal brten nas bye brag brjod par bya ste /🔽chos gos rnying pa'i gnas su lug gi bal dag go //
analyzed: // /'khrur 'jug pa'i spang ba la tshog gang yin pa de nyid las bal rmel du 'jug pa'i spang bal brten nas bye brag brjod par bya ste / chos gos rnying pa'i gnas su lug gi bal dag go //
translated: The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.

original: 'chag par rmel ba'o zhes bya ba ni gnas su zhes bya ba ni gnas su zhes bya ba nyid du 'khrur 'jug pa'i spang ba'i skabs su 'khrur 'jug pa 'am 'tshed du 'jug na'o zhes bya ba smos pa de 'dir ni 'khrur 'jug gam 'tshed du 'jug gam🔽rmel du bcug na'o zhes brjod par bya'o //🔽gang gi phyir de nyid 'dir rdzogs pa ni ltung ba'i byed pa po'i gzhung ngo //🔽bal rmel du 'jug pa'i spang ba'o /
analyzed: 'chag par rmel ba'o zhes bya ba ni gnas su zhes bya ba ni gnas su zhes bya ba nyid du 'khrur 'jug pa'i spang ba'i skabs su 'khrur 'jug pa 'am 'tshed du 'jug na'o zhes bya ba smos pa de 'dir ni 'khrur 'jug gam 'tshed du 'jug gam rmel du bcug na'o zhes brjod par bya'o // gang gi phyir de nyid 'dir rdzogs pa ni ltung ba'i byed pa po'i gzhung ngo // bal rmel du 'jug pa'i spang ba'o /
translated: The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.🔽The avoidance of having wool spun is like the avoidance of having wool washed, except that the place is different.

original: // / ci zhig byas na gser dngul la reg pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / ci zhig byas na gser dngul la reg pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: The avoidance of having wool spun

original: de'i phyir rin po che bdag gir byas na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rin po che bdag gir byas na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “if one appropriates it as one’s own.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las rkang pa'i drung na mo'i ro mya ngam @160b thob pa'i gnas sam sa le sbram gyi rdzas 'dug pa bdag gir byed na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽lcogs pa nyid na de rdzogs so zhes bya ba ni lcogs pa nyid du bdag gir bya bar nus pa nyid la thob pa lag tu 'ong bar rung ba nyid la lag tu gyur pa ma yin pa nyid la ston pa na bdag gir bya ba de yongs
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba kha cig las rkang pa'i drung na mo'i ro mya ngam @160b thob pa'i gnas sam sa le sbram gyi rdzas 'dug pa bdag gir byed na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no // lcogs pa nyid na de rdzogs so zhes bya ba ni lcogs pa nyid du bdag gir bya bar nus pa nyid la thob pa lag tu 'ong bar rung ba nyid la lag tu gyur pa ma yin pa nyid la ston pa na bdag gir bya ba de yongs
translated: Here, the text says, “If one appropriates as one’s own a dead woman’s corpse lying at the base of a wall, or a substance of refined gold lying in an isolated place, it is a pāyattika offense.”🔽If one is able to appropriate it, it is complete.

original: su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: If one is able to appropriate it, it is complete.

original: de bas pa zad na ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni /🔽lcogs pa nyid kyi gnas skabs pas gal te rdzas de 'di blangs pa la dngos gzhi ste /
analyzed: de bas pa zad na ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni / lcogs pa nyid kyi gnas skabs pas gal te rdzas de 'di blangs pa la dngos gzhi ste /
translated: If it is lost, it is half.🔽If one is able to appropriate it, it is the actual basis.

original: gal te ma yin lcogs pa nyid kyi gnas skabs na thob pa na dngos gzhi ste /
analyzed: gal te ma yin lcogs pa nyid kyi gnas skabs na thob pa na dngos gzhi ste /
translated: If one is not able to appropriate it, it is the actual basis when one obtains it.

original: len pa po'i sbyor ba la ni kha na ma thob zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: len pa po'i sbyor ba la ni kha na ma thob zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “improper” is that it is a preparation of the appropriator.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gang zhig 'di thob pa'i gnas la sa le sbram gyi rdzas 'jug pa bdag gir byed na ma thob pa'i spang ba 'di zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gang zhig 'di thob pa'i gnas la sa le sbram gyi rdzas 'jug pa bdag gir byed na ma thob pa'i spang ba 'di zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, the treatise Attainment of Knowledge says, “If one places gold in a place where it can be obtained and appropriates it, this is a downfall of appropriating what has not been given.”

original: ci ltar bdag gir byed pa zhes bya ba gcig tu rjes su sgrub na spang ba 'dir 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci ltar bdag gir byed pa zhes bya ba gcig tu rjes su sgrub na spang ba 'dir 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: How is it that one appropriates it?

original: de'i phyir rang gi rung ba ma byas pa yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi rung ba ma byas pa yang ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “Even if it has not been made one’s own.”

original: rang gi zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dag la ltung ba rnam par gzhag pas spang ba'i ltung ba 'di la zhing nyid kyi phyir ma byas pa dang 'dra ba la 'dzin pa gang zhig gsungs pa 'di ni 'dir lung ngo //
analyzed: rang gi zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dag la ltung ba rnam par gzhag pas spang ba'i ltung ba 'di la zhing nyid kyi phyir ma byas pa dang 'dra ba la 'dzin pa gang zhig gsungs pa 'di ni 'dir lung ngo //
translated: “ One’s own” means that this downfall of appropriation is like not making one’s own because it is a field of downfalls that are posited in relation to others.

original: gang gis byin pa lan tam len du 'jug pa med na 'dzin pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis byin pa lan tam len du 'jug pa med na 'dzin pa skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not give back what was given or cause it to be given back, appropriation arises.

original: 'dir bdag tu byas pa ni de dang rjes su mthun pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir bdag tu byas pa ni de dang rjes su mthun pa ste /
translated: Here, “making one’s own” is similar to that.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa ni 'dzin pa brjod kyis nges par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa ni 'dzin pa brjod kyis nges par byed pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not the case that the expression of the possession is determined by that.

original: 'di ni 'thad pa ma yin te /🔽bdag tu bya ba dang dor bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni 'thad pa ma yin te / bdag tu bya ba dang dor bar bya ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is not correct.

original: rung ba rnams la ni bdag tu bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rung ba rnams la ni bdag tu bya ba dang dor bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is the taking up of what is one’s own and the giving up of what is one’s own.🔽For what is proper is to be taken up as one’s own and given up as one’s own.

original: gang gi phyir bar du chad par gyur pa 'di rnams la bdag tu byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bar du chad par gyur pa 'di rnams la bdag tu byed pa ste /
translated: Because there is the taking up of what is one’s own in regard to these things that are interrupted,

original: gang zhig de'i logs su byed par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: gang zhig de'i logs su byed par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: that is, what is made to be on one’s side.

original: de bas na 'dir bdag gir bya ba rjes su gnang ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir bdag gir bya ba rjes su gnang ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no permission here to make something one’s own.

original: gang zhig 'dir blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang sbyin bdag de nyid la yid brtan te bcang bar bya bar rjes su ngas gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa de ni rung ba dang po yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig 'dir blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang sbyin bdag de nyid la yid brtan te bcang bar bya bar rjes su ngas gnang ngo zhes gsungs pa de ni rung ba dang po yin no //
translated: What is proper is the first, that is, what is permitted here to be taken up and, having taken it up, to be kept in trust for that very donor.

original: ji ltar 'dir bdag gir byed pa mi bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dir bdag gir byed pa mi bskyed pa'o //
translated: How is it that one does not generate the taking up of what is one’s own?

original: rung bar bya ste gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: rung bar bya ste gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba 'di'i don ni 'di yin no //
translated: The meaning of this is: “I will accept it, I will hold it.”

original: 'dud pa'i don gyis mngon par 'brel par gyur pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'dud pa'i don gyis mngon par 'brel par gyur pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The meaning of “bowing” is “to be connected with.”

original: de pas na 'dud pa nyid khas len pa ni 'dir len par shes par @161a * //
analyzed: de pas na 'dud pa nyid khas len pa ni 'dir len par shes par @161a * //
translated: Therefore, in this context, “accepting” should be understood as “bowing.”

original: bya'o ; / bdag tu ma byas pa nyid kyis 'dud par byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya'o ; / bdag tu ma byas pa nyid kyis 'dud par byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: “having bowed by not making it one’s own.”

original: bdag po nyid kyis lhag por mos pa dang por gzung nas len pa la bya ba nyid nam yang ma byas pa dang 'dra ba la len pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag po nyid kyis lhag por mos pa dang por gzung nas len pa la bya ba nyid nam yang ma byas pa dang 'dra ba la len pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as there is no accepting when one does not act as the owner, having first accepted the gift, so also there is no accepting when one does not act as the owner, having first accepted the gift.

original: 'jug pa gang la rang gir ma byas pa dang 'dra ba'i rin po che ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug pa gang la rang gir ma byas pa dang 'dra ba'i rin po che ma yin zhe na /
translated: What is the engagement that is like not making it one’s own?

original: de'i phyir reg gam reg tu bcug na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir reg gam reg tu bcug na'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “if one touches it or causes it to be touched.”

original: ji ltar reg pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar reg pas she na /
translated: How is it touched?

original: de'i phyir gang yang rung bas so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang yang rung bas so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “by anyone.”

original: phyogs gcig par reg na yang longs shig khyer cig ces bya ba lta bu dmigs kyis ma smras par yang re zhig ces bya ba dngos su tshig gis kyang ma smras shing /
analyzed: phyogs gcig par reg na yang longs shig khyer cig ces bya ba lta bu dmigs kyis ma smras par yang re zhig ces bya ba dngos su tshig gis kyang ma smras shing /
translated: Even though not explicitly stated, it is also not directly stated by the words “for a while.”

original: nye bar gnas pa la yang gnas gzhan na gnas pa de la zhes bya ba bstan pas nye bar gnas pa nyid la 'di zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar gnas pa la yang gnas gzhan na gnas pa de la zhes bya ba bstan pas nye bar gnas pa nyid la 'di zhes bya ba'o //
translated: And in “that one who is present,” the one who is present is indicated by the term “that one” in “that one who is present.”

original: snyad gdags su rung ba'i zangs ma la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni 'di la dman pa'i rin po che nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snyad gdags su rung ba'i zangs ma la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni 'di la dman pa'i rin po che nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: A misdeed is committed in relation to copper that is suitable to be called precious, because it has the nature of a lesser precious substance.

original: gzhan la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni snyad gdags su rung ba'i zangs ma 'di la ni rdzas las rin po che nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni snyad gdags su rung ba'i zangs ma 'di la ni rdzas las rin po che nyid ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no offense in relation to others, meaning that in this copper that is suitable to be called precious, there is no substance that is precious.

original: zha nye dang khro chu dang ro nye dang lcags dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'di rnams kyang rin po che nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zha nye dang khro chu dang ro nye dang lcags dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'di rnams kyang rin po che nyid ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is also in relation to tin, lead, and iron, meaning that these are not precious substances.

original: dge tshul gnyis kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge tshul gnyis kyis kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And also for the two novices.

original: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma gnyis kyis rin po che la reg gam reg tu bcug na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: dge tshul dang dge tshul ma gnyis kyis rin po che la reg gam reg tu bcug na ltung ba med do //
translated: If a precious thing is touched or made to be touched by two novices or a novice and a female novice, there is no offense.🔽If it is not consecrated, it is also permissible.

original: gang gi rung ba ma byas pa yang ngo zhes smras na rung ba gang la byas na rung ba ma yin pa'i rung ba de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang gi rung ba ma byas pa yang ngo zhes smras na rung ba gang la byas na rung ba ma yin pa'i rung ba de ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: If it is consecrated, what is it like?

original: de'i phyir sbyin bdag bdag po nyid du smos su gzhug pa dang / zhal ta byed pa bdag po nyid du khas len du gzhug pa dang / byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya ba ni rung ba dag yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyin bdag bdag po nyid du smos su gzhug pa dang / zhal ta byed pa bdag po nyid du khas len du gzhug pa dang / byin gyis brlab pa zhes bya ba ni rung ba dag yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that consecration is the consecration of the donor, the consecration of the owner, and the consecration of the manager.

original: 'dir rung ba gsum gyi gzhung ni dge slong dag de lta bas na rjes su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir rung ba gsum gyi gzhung ni dge slong dag de lta bas na rjes su shes par bya ste /
translated: The text on the three consecrations here is:

original: chos gos kyi rin dag rnyed pa na blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang sbyin bdag de nyid la yid brtan te bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos kyi rin dag rnyed pa na blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang sbyin bdag de nyid la yid brtan te bcang bar bya'o //
translated: Monks, therefore, you should understand that when you obtain the price of robes, you should accept it and, having accepted it, you should keep it with confidence in that donor.

original: de bzhin du sbyin bdag kyang spro bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyin bdag kyang spro bar bya'o //
translated: So too, the donor should be encouraged.🔽The consecration is stated in the Sutra Requested by the Daughter of a Brahmin:

original: byin gyis brlab pa yang bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa'i gzhung las gang zhig bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bar dngos po rung ba ma lags pa 'dis dngos po rung bar bsgrub par bgyi zhing de ni bdag gir bgyi'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa yang bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa'i gzhung las gang zhig bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bar dngos po rung ba ma lags pa 'dis dngos po rung bar bsgrub par bgyi zhing de ni bdag gir bgyi'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Whatever I, the bhikṣu named so-and-so, do with this unallowable thing, I will make it allowable and I will accept it.”

original: lan ji lta bar @161b 'di rnams la gtso bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lan ji lta bar @161b 'di rnams la gtso bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: These should be understood as the principal ones in accordance with the text.

original: gang gi phyir sbyin bdag gi shin tu gsal ba bdag po nyid du lhag par mos pas zhal ta byed pa'i bdag po nyid du khas len pa la gzhan gyi blo dang gzhan gyi rnam par rig byed dang bdag gir byed pa nyid la shin tu gsal ba
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbyin bdag gi shin tu gsal ba bdag po nyid du lhag par mos pas zhal ta byed pa'i bdag po nyid du khas len pa la gzhan gyi blo dang gzhan gyi rnam par rig byed dang bdag gir byed pa nyid la shin tu gsal ba
translated: Because the donor is very clear about the master, he accepts the master as the one who performs the consecration. The other’s mind, the other’s informative form, and the acceptance itself are very clear.

original: nyid do // gang zhig 'dir zhal ta byed pa la bdag po nyid du khyod kyis khas len zhing 'di ltar spro par byed pa 'di 'dir bdag po nyid du khas len par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyid do // gang zhig 'dir zhal ta byed pa la bdag po nyid du khyod kyis khas len zhing 'di ltar spro par byed pa 'di 'dir bdag po nyid du khas len par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this is the self that you accept as the owner of the monastery and so on, and that you encourage to protect the monastery and so on.

original: yang ci'i phyir bdag tu bya ba ma yin pa la go bar byed pa dang / byin gyis brlabs pa yongs su skyong ba nyid kyis bdag gi 'di gtsug lag khang la sogs pa dang 'dra bar bsrung ba dang byin gyis brlab par bgyi'o //
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir bdag tu bya ba ma yin pa la go bar byed pa dang / byin gyis brlabs pa yongs su skyong ba nyid kyis bdag gi 'di gtsug lag khang la sogs pa dang 'dra bar bsrung ba dang byin gyis brlab par bgyi'o //
translated: Why do you protect and bless the monastery and so on as if it were your own, even though it is not your own?

original: 'dir bdag gi blo ni 'di yin te bdag tu bya bas ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir bdag gi blo ni 'di yin te bdag tu bya bas ni ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, our view is this: It is not the self that is the object of the notion of “I,”

original: bdag la bdag tu bya ba'i dbang gis bsgrub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag la bdag tu bya ba'i dbang gis bsgrub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: nor is it established by the power of the notion of “I.”

original: 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol zhes bya ba'i ngo bo las gang zhig bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bas dngos po rung ba ma lags pa 'di rnyed de zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di de ji ltar bdag tu bya ba rung ba nyid
analyzed: 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa dgongs su gsol zhes bya ba'i ngo bo las gang zhig bdag dge slong ming 'di zhes bgyi bas dngos po rung ba ma lags pa 'di rnyed de zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di de ji ltar bdag tu bya ba rung ba nyid
translated: This is the meaning: “Venerable ones, please listen! I, the monk named so-and-so, have obtained this unsuitable thing.” The phrase “I, the monk named so-and-so” is to be applied to oneself.

original: khas len pa ni 'dir bsgrub pa ste /🔽bdag tu bya ba 'ongs pa'i don dang sbyar ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khas len pa ni 'dir bsgrub pa ste / bdag tu bya ba 'ongs pa'i don dang sbyar ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the monk named so-and-so is the one who is to be established as the subject.🔽It is not the case that the meaning of the subject is to be applied.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i don mi bdog pa'i rkyen las gzhan pa la mi 'chags so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i don mi bdog pa'i rkyen las gzhan pa la mi 'chags so zhes bya ba la /
translated: “I will not confess to anyone else who is not a suitable person” means:

original: chos las mi 'da' ba'i chos dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: chos las mi 'da' ba'i chos dang ldan pa ste /
translated: “I will not transgress the Dharma.”

original: rang gi don du chos gos dang sman la sogs pa yo byad dag go //
analyzed: rang gi don du chos gos dang sman la sogs pa yo byad dag go //
translated: “Suitable person” refers to the requisites such as Dharma robes and medicine for one’s own use.

original: de ni chos dang ldan pa yang yin la don yang yin pas chos dang ldan pa'i don te /
analyzed: de ni chos dang ldan pa yang yin la don yang yin pas chos dang ldan pa'i don te /
translated: That is suitable and meaningful, so it is a suitable meaning.

original: chos gos dang sman la sogs pa'i don to //
analyzed: chos gos dang sman la sogs pa'i don to //
translated: It is the meaning of Dharma robes, medicine, and so on.

original: de'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni rdzas gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rkyen zhes bya ba ni rdzas gang yin pa ste /
translated: “Its condition” refers to the substance.

original: rdzas ji tsam gyis chos dang ldan pa'i don te /
analyzed: rdzas ji tsam gyis chos dang ldan pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning is: by how much substance one is endowed with a Dharma matter.

original: sgrub par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: One is established.

original: de mi bdog par gyur pa la rung ba 'di rnams grags pa'o //
analyzed: de mi bdog par gyur pa la rung ba 'di rnams grags pa'o //
translated: When one does not have that, these are suitable.

original: chos dang ldan pa'i don mi bdog pa de'i rkyen las gzhan du grags pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i don mi bdog pa de'i rkyen las gzhan du grags pa ma yin no //
translated: The meaning is: when one does not have the substance endowed with Dharma, that is not a condition for the other, which is well known.🔽The meaning is: if one has the substance, then even when there is no meaning endowed with Dharma, it is suitable for it to remain.

original: gal te bdog pa nyid re zhig rkyen rdzas su gyur na chos dang ldan pa'i don med par yang lhag par gnas na rung ba 'di rnams kyang skye bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te bdog pa nyid re zhig rkyen rdzas su gyur na chos dang ldan pa'i don med par yang lhag par gnas na rung ba 'di rnams kyang skye bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: these are not produced.🔽The meaning is: because of that, these are not suitable.

original: der byas pa nyid yang rung ba 'di rnams chos 'di ma yin pa la ltung ba nyid kyi phyir de byed pa dang / de la reg pa dang reg par byed pa dag la spang ba'i ltung byed skyed pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: der byas pa nyid yang rung ba 'di rnams chos 'di ma yin pa la ltung ba nyid kyi phyir de byed pa dang / de la reg pa dang reg par byed pa dag la spang ba'i ltung byed skyed pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: because of that, the one who does it and the one who touches it and the one who causes to do it, they generate a downfall through a partial defeat.

original: 'dir lung ni chos @162a * //
analyzed: 'dir lung ni chos @162a * //
translated: Here, the scriptures are:

original: gos sems par byed cing thob par gyur pa rnams sbyin pa po'i lag tu yid brtan pas bcang bar bya zhes bya ba chos gos la sems par byed pa'i tshig ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gos sems par byed cing thob par gyur pa rnams sbyin pa po'i lag tu yid brtan pas bcang bar bya zhes bya ba chos gos la sems par byed pa'i tshig ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: and having obtained them, he should keep them in the hand of the donor with confidence.

original: chos gos kyi don du sems par byed pa'i tshig ni dper shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chos gos kyi don du sems par byed pa'i tshig ni dper shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase “he should keep them in mind for the sake of the Dharma robes” should be understood as an example.

original: de ltar yang lam du mdza' bo'i don du yang gzung bar bya zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ltar yang lam du mdza' bo'i don du yang gzung bar bya zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Thus, he should keep them in mind even for the sake of a friend on the road.

original: chu dang me'i don du chu shel dang me shel dag bcang bar bya bar gsungs so //
analyzed: chu dang me'i don du chu shel dang me shel dag bcang bar bya bar gsungs so //
translated: He should keep water crystals and fire crystals for the sake of water and fire.🔽Since they are not in accord with the practice, renunciates should not engage in the excessive keeping of these things even for the sake of mere alms, which are for the sake of sustaining the body.

original: sbyor ba dang yang mi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir rab tu byung ba rnams kyi lus 'tsho bar bya ba'i don du bsod snyoms tsam la yang 'di rnams kyis lhag par 'chang ba la rung ba rnams la mi 'jug pas rnam par rtog pa tsam mam tshig sbyor
analyzed: sbyor ba dang yang mi mthun pa nyid kyi phyir rab tu byung ba rnams kyi lus 'tsho bar bya ba'i don du bsod snyoms tsam la yang 'di rnams kyis lhag par 'chang ba la rung ba rnams la mi 'jug pas rnam par rtog pa tsam mam tshig sbyor
translated: Therefore, this is mere speculation or a verbal construction.

original: ba tsam 'dir spong ba la gtso bo yin pas gzhan nyid du thob pas sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun rnams la bya ba byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba tsam 'dir spong ba la gtso bo yin pas gzhan nyid du thob pas sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun rnams la bya ba byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the principal factor here is the relinquishment of the three spheres, one will then be able to serve the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha.

original: rnam par nyams par gyur pa tshangs par spyod pa dang bcas pa rnams la yo byad bcu gsum rnams las cig shos ma tshang bas rjes su gzung bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: rnam par nyams par gyur pa tshangs par spyod pa dang bcas pa rnams la yo byad bcu gsum rnams las cig shos ma tshang bas rjes su gzung bar bgyi'o //
translated: Those who have violated their vows of pure conduct and who are lacking in any of the thirteen articles of a monk should be supported.🔽Those who are destitute and who have attained the realization of the renunciate and the fully ordained monk should be provided with a begging bowl and robes.

original: phongs pa rab tu dbyung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams la lhung bzed dang chos gos bsgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa de la ni chos dang mi ldan pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: phongs pa rab tu dbyung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams la lhung bzed dang chos gos bsgrub par bgyi zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa de la ni chos dang mi ldan pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of this is not that they are not in accord with the Dharma.

original: bdag po ring ba nyid yin na yang nyams pa med do zhes bya ba ni bdag po sbyin bdag gam zhal ta byed pa ring ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: bdag po ring ba nyid yin na yang nyams pa med do zhes bya ba ni bdag po sbyin bdag gam zhal ta byed pa ring ba nyid yin te /
translated: Even if the master is far away, there is no violation.

original: yul thag ring po nyid du song zhing yul gyis bskal pa nyid yin yang rung ba dag la nyams pa med do //
analyzed: yul thag ring po nyid du song zhing yul gyis bskal pa nyid yin yang rung ba dag la nyams pa med do //
translated: Even if one goes to a distant place, or even if one is separated from the place, there is no fault.

original: bdag nyid kyi don du bza' ba byed du gzhug tu rung ngo //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi don du bza' ba byed du gzhug tu rung ngo //
translated: It is proper to make one eat for one’s own sake.🔽And it is proper to accept a kārṣāpaṇa for the sake of making a gift to him.🔽In the Kṣudraka-vastu it is said, “In this path and so forth, one should eat and accept jewels and so forth.

original: de byad pa la dbul ba'i phyir k'ar sh'a pa na blang ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni phran tshegs rnams las 'di la sogs pa'i lam du bza' ba dang rin po che la sogs pa rnams 'di spang ba'i ji srid du sa'i rang bzhin zhes bya
analyzed: de byad pa la dbul ba'i phyir k'ar sh'a pa na blang ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni phran tshegs rnams las 'di la sogs pa'i lam du bza' ba dang rin po che la sogs pa rnams 'di spang ba'i ji srid du sa'i rang bzhin zhes bya
translated: This is the nature of the earth.

original: ba 'di mthar de byed pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba byed pa la dbul ba'i phyir k'ar sh'a pa na blang ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba 'di mthar de byed pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba byed pa la dbul ba'i phyir k'ar sh'a pa na blang ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ” Up to here it is said, “He makes a gift for the sake of making one eat.” The meaning is, “He accepts a kārṣāpaṇa for the sake of making a gift to him.”🔽It should be understood that this is not the meaning of “not in accordance with the Dharma.”

original: 'di'i chos dang mi ldan pa'i don ma yin zhes bya bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di la 'di bstan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di'i chos dang mi ldan pa'i don ma yin zhes bya bar shes par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di la 'di bstan pa ste /
translated: This is taught here:

original: rung ba med pas len pa rjes su gnang ba ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rung ba med pas len pa rjes su gnang ba ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “It is not permitted to accept what is not proper.”

original: 'di ni rung ba gzhan brjod pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni rung ba gzhan brjod pa ste /
translated: This is a statement of another allowance.

original: de bzhin du rjes su gnang ba gzhan rnams la yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su gnang ba gzhan rnams la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The other permissions should be understood in the same way.

original: lam rgyags ni rin po @162b che man chad las so zhes bya ba ni rin po che man chad nas lam du bza' ba len pa rung ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lam rgyags ni rin po @162b che man chad las so zhes bya ba ni rin po che man chad nas lam du bza' ba len pa rung ba yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Provisions for the road” means from precious things and so on.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag gis lam rgyags ji lta bu mi shes nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag gis lam rgyags ji lta bu mi shes nas /
translated: The text is as follows: The monks did not know what provisions for the road were.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba smos pa lnga dang / rin po che lnga dang / rin po cher smos pa lnga'o //
analyzed: bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba smos pa lnga dang / rin po che lnga dang / rin po cher smos pa lnga'o //
translated: Five foods, five things called food, five precious things, and five precious things called precious.

original: de la bza' ba lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bza' ba lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five foods?

original: 'bras chan dang / zan dron dang sha dang nya sha dang snum khur ro //
analyzed: 'bras chan dang / zan dron dang sha dang nya sha dang snum khur ro //
translated: Cooked grain, porridge, meat, fish, and oil.

original: bca' bar smos pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: bca' bar smos pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five things called food?

original: ji tse dang khre rgod dang rgya sran dang bra rgod dang khre'o //
analyzed: ji tse dang khre rgod dang rgya sran dang bra rgod dang khre'o //
translated: Rice, wheat, beans, sesame, and mustard.

original: rin po che lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: rin po che lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five precious things?

original: gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / shel dang / mu tig go //
analyzed: gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'urya dang / shel dang / mu tig go //
translated: gold, silver, beryl, crystal, and pearl.

original: rin po che lngar smos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rin po che lngar smos pa gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five precious substances?

original: zha nye dang ro nye dang zangs dang / khro chu dang / lcags so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zha nye dang ro nye dang zangs dang / khro chu dang / lcags so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: tin, lead, copper, iron, and bronze.🔽For the sake of fire, a monk should place a fire-crystal.

original: me'i don du dge slong gis me shal nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba la 'di ni chos dang mi ldan pa'i don ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'o //
analyzed: me'i don du dge slong gis me shal nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba la 'di ni chos dang mi ldan pa'i don ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught in order to show that this is not for an improper purpose.🔽It should not be placed without being concealed.

original: de ma sbas par gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gtor ba'i skyon bsal ba'i don du sba ba'o //
analyzed: de ma sbas par gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gtor ba'i skyon bsal ba'i don du sba ba'o //
translated: This is for the purpose of removing the fault of scattering.

original: ma sbyin par len pa la bstan par mi bya'o //
analyzed: ma sbyin par len pa la bstan par mi bya'o //
translated: It should not be shown to a thief.🔽Having produced its effect, it should be given to him.

original: de'i 'bras bu phyung nas de la sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni me shel de'i 'bras bu me zhes bya ba phyung nas rkun po de la me sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu phyung nas de la sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni me shel de'i 'bras bu me zhes bya ba phyung nas rkun po de la me sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Having produced its effect, which is called fire, that fire-crystal should be given to the thief.

original: chu'i don du chu shel yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chu'i don du chu shel yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Also for the sake of water, a water-crystal.

original: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra ni nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the word also is to be supplied after should be placed.

original: bsrung ba'i cho ga ni 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni me shel de 'di ma sbas par gzhag par mi bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //🔽yo byad rjes su gnang bar rin po che bdag gir bya ba'i shan bsre bar mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang zhig rgya la sogs pa'i 'tshog chas ni yo byad de de ni rjes su gnang ba yin no //
analyzed: bsrung ba'i cho ga ni 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni me shel de 'di ma sbas par gzhag par mi bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // yo byad rjes su gnang bar rin po che bdag gir bya ba'i shan bsre bar mi bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang zhig rgya la sogs pa'i 'tshog chas ni yo byad de de ni rjes su gnang ba yin no //
translated: The protection rite is the same means that fire crystal should not be placed without being protected, and so on.🔽The permission of the requisites is that the inclusion of the portion of taking possession of jewels is not to be included.  Requisites are things like a parasol, a fan, and so on.  Permission is the permission to use them.

original: de'i rjes su gnang ba'i khongs su rin po che bdag gir bya ba'i shan bsre ba gzhug par mi bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i rjes su gnang ba'i khongs su rin po che bdag gir bya ba'i shan bsre ba gzhug par mi bya ba nyid do //
translated: The inclusion of the permission of those is not to include the inclusion of the portion of taking possession of jewels.

original: de bas na rin po che'i rang bzhin la yang 'dir rjes su gnang ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na rin po che'i rang bzhin la yang 'dir rjes su gnang ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, even in the case of jewels, there is permission here.

original: gnod par byed pa spang ba'i cho ga la zhes bya ba 'dod pa la /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa spang ba'i cho ga la zhes bya ba 'dod pa la /
translated: The rite of abandoning what is harmful is as follows.  Harmful means that which is harmful to the body and mind.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: rgya la sogs pa rjes su gnang ba gang yin pa de la rin po che'i rang bzhin gyi rgya la sogs pa la bdag tu byed pa gang yin pa de'i mtha' byas pa nyid ni ma yin te rjes su ma gnang ba nyid do //
analyzed: rgya la sogs pa rjes su gnang ba gang yin pa de la rin po che'i rang bzhin gyi rgya la sogs pa la bdag tu byed pa gang yin pa de'i mtha' byas pa nyid ni ma yin te rjes su ma gnang ba nyid do //
translated: The seal, etc. that are permitted are not to be made of precious substances, because that would be to make them one’s own.🔽“On that” means on the seal, etc.

original: de la rin po che'i rang bzhin bdag tu bya ba @163a * //🔽zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la rin po che'i rang bzhin bdag tu bya ba @163a * // zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “One should not make it one’s own” means one should not make it of precious substances.

original: de ltar yang phran tshegs rnams la 'dir rgya la sogs pa la rin po che'i rang bzhin bkag pa'i gzhung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar yang phran tshegs rnams la 'dir rgya la sogs pa la rin po che'i rang bzhin bkag pa'i gzhung ngo //
translated: Thus, the text prohibits the use of precious substances for seals, etc.

original: gleng gzhi rnams las kyang gsungs te /
analyzed: gleng gzhi rnams las kyang gsungs te /
translated: The Bases of Discipline also states:🔽The Blessed One said, “You should carry a medicine case.”

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dud pa'i sman gce'u bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / zhus pa ji lta bu bcang bar bgyi /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dud pa'i sman gce'u bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / zhus pa ji lta bu bcang bar bgyi /
translated: “How should we carry it?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: nye ba 'khor rin po che las byas pa ma gtogs so //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor rin po che las byas pa ma gtogs so //
translated: “Upāli, except if it is made of precious substances.”

original: snar blugs pa'i spyad dang 'phul ba'i btung phor dang khab dang khab ral dang mig sman gyi gab tse dang / sman phor dang rkang rten dang khri'u dang sman gyi nal ze bcang bar bya'o //🔽lcags kyi gar bu la lu gu rgyud gdags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa thams cad la yang ji lta bu zhig bcang bar bgyi /
analyzed: snar blugs pa'i spyad dang 'phul ba'i btung phor dang khab dang khab ral dang mig sman gyi gab tse dang / sman phor dang rkang rten dang khri'u dang sman gyi nal ze bcang bar bya'o // lcags kyi gar bu la lu gu rgyud gdags par bya'o zhes gsungs pa thams cad la yang ji lta bu zhig bcang bar bgyi /
translated: The monk should carry a nasal medicine dropper, a medicine cup, a needle, a knife, an eye probe, a medicine bowl, a foot support, a stool, and a medicine case.

original: nye ba 'khor rin po che'i rang bzhin las byas pa ma gtogs so zhes bka' stsal pa de lta bu'i tshig yod do //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor rin po che'i rang bzhin las byas pa ma gtogs so zhes bka' stsal pa de lta bu'i tshig yod do //
translated: The Buddha said, Except for those made of precious substances, all of these should be made of iron.

original: ra gan dang zangs dang 'khar ba dang shing gi lhung bzed dang bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: ra gan dang zangs dang 'khar ba dang shing gi lhung bzed dang bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: The Buddha said, A monk should not keep a begging bowl made of brass, copper, pewter, or wood.

original: lhung bzed ces bya ba'i sgrar ra gan la sogs pa so so dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: lhung bzed ces bya ba'i sgrar ra gan la sogs pa so so dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word bowl is to be understood as applying to each of the substances mentioned.

original: de dag bdag gir byas pa'am gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: de dag bdag gir byas pa'am gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: Whether they are made for oneself or for others,

original: gal te yongs su spyad dgos par gyur na sman phor gyis yongs su spyad pas so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te yongs su spyad dgos par gyur na sman phor gyis yongs su spyad pas so zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is necessary to use it, then it is used as a medicine bowl.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni ra gan la sogs pa'i lhung bzed la'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni ra gan la sogs pa'i lhung bzed la'o //
translated: Here, those refers to the alms bowl made of brass, etc.🔽It is not at all suitable to be a vessel for oil, etc.

original: 'bru mar gyi snod kyi rnam pa nyid kyis shin tu 'di mthun pa nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di 'chang ba dang / mngon par rjes su yi rang ba'o //
analyzed: 'bru mar gyi snod kyi rnam pa nyid kyis shin tu 'di mthun pa nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di 'chang ba dang / mngon par rjes su yi rang ba'o //
translated: This is the meaning of to hold and to rejoice in.

original: gzhan yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni bdag gir ma byas par gan la sogs pa'i lhung bzed 'di la yang yongs su spyad dgos pa sman dang sman phor gyi rigs pa nyid kyis de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni bdag gir ma byas par gan la sogs pa'i lhung bzed 'di la yang yongs su spyad dgos pa sman dang sman phor gyi rigs pa nyid kyis de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Or another means that this alms bowl made of brass, etc., which is not one's own, is also to be used as necessary, by the principle of medicine and medicine bowl. This is the meaning of that.

original: sman zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed yongs su spyad dgos pa bsal ba'i gtso bo 'di sman dang sman phor gyis yongs su spyad dgos pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: sman zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed yongs su spyad dgos pa bsal ba'i gtso bo 'di sman dang sman phor gyis yongs su spyad dgos pa'i tshig go //
translated: Medicine refers to the medicine bowl. The necessity of using the alms bowl is stated by the words medicine and medicine bowl.

original: gsungs pa'i sman dang 'brel pa nyid kyi 'bras bu nges par spyod pa la ni ma yin zhes te /
analyzed: gsungs pa'i sman dang 'brel pa nyid kyi 'bras bu nges par spyod pa la ni ma yin zhes te /
translated: It is not that one should definitely practice the fruit in connection with the medicine that was mentioned.

original: gzhan du na yang ma yin zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na yang ma yin zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Nor is it that one should practice it elsewhere.

original: 'dir gzhung ni nye bar ma bzhag pa de rnams ni nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni nye bar ma bzhag pa de rnams ni nye bar gzhag par mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: Here, the text does not state that those that are not placed should be placed.

original: gzhag par byas pa ni sman phor yongs su longs spyod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽byin gyis brlab tu rung ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhag par byas pa ni sman phor yongs su longs spyod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // byin gyis brlab tu rung ba ni gnyis te /
translated: It states that what has been placed should be enjoyed, like a bowl of medicine.🔽The bowl is suitable for consecration,

original: lcags las byas pa dang sa las byas pa'o @163b zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: lcags las byas pa dang sa las byas pa'o @163b zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: made of iron or clay.

original: lhung bzed 'ba' zhig pa 'dir bstan pa'i rin po che'i ngo bo brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed 'ba' zhig pa 'dir bstan pa'i rin po che'i ngo bo brjod par bya ste /
translated: The nature of the precious bowl that is taught here should be stated.

original: nor bu dang mu tig dang bee d'urya dang man shel dkar po dang byi ru dang dngul dang gser dang / rdo'i snying po dang spug dang dmar po dang g-yas su 'khyil ba la sogs pa ni rin po che'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nor bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas shel dag 'phangs so //
analyzed: nor bu dang mu tig dang bee d'urya dang man shel dkar po dang byi ru dang dngul dang gser dang / rdo'i snying po dang spug dang dmar po dang g-yas su 'khyil ba la sogs pa ni rin po che'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la nor bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas shel dag 'phangs so //
translated: Pearl, lapis lazuli, crystal, coral, silver, gold, cat’s eye, ruby, right-coiled shell, etc. are precious substances.

original: sogs pa zhes smos pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung la sogs pa dag bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes smos pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sku gdung la sogs pa dag bsdu ba'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the relics of the Buddha, etc.

original: chu shel dang me shel dag la yang 'dir nor bu'i tshig gis gzung ba nyid do //
analyzed: chu shel dang me shel dag la yang 'dir nor bu'i tshig gis gzung ba nyid do //
translated: Water-purifying gems and fire-producing gems are also included by the word “gems.”

original: nor bur gyur pa'i khab len gang yin pa de yang 'dis 'phangs pa nyid do //
analyzed: nor bur gyur pa'i khab len gang yin pa de yang 'dis 'phangs pa nyid do //
translated: Any gem that attracts iron is also included by this word.

original: rdo bar gyur pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rdo bar gyur pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: But not any stone,

original: der rin po che nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: der rin po che nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not precious.

original: 'dir nor bu la sogs pa brjod pa'i rin po che la dpe nyid du rig par bya ste gzhan du rin po che'i snying po la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid la 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir nor bu la sogs pa brjod pa'i rin po che la dpe nyid du rig par bya ste gzhan du rin po che'i snying po la sogs pa'i dngos po nyid la 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Here, jewels and so forth are to be understood as examples of precious substances, because they are similar to other things such as the essence of jewels.

original: dngul zhes bya ba ni dngul skya'o ;
analyzed: dngul zhes bya ba ni dngul skya'o ;
translated: Silver is white silver.

original: / gser zhes bya ba ni sa le sbram mo //
analyzed: / gser zhes bya ba ni sa le sbram mo //
translated: Gold is pure gold.

original: mdo las 'di gnyis smos pa gang yin pa de ni dpe yin te /
analyzed: mdo las 'di gnyis smos pa gang yin pa de ni dpe yin te /
translated: These two mentioned in the sutra are examples.

original: nor bu dang mu tig dang bee d'urya dang dung dang man shel dkar po dang byi ru dang dngul dang sa le sbram dang rdo'i snying po dang spug dang dmar po dang g-yas su 'khyil pa la sogs pa la reg par byed na spang ba'i ltung ba zhes
analyzed: nor bu dang mu tig dang bee d'urya dang dung dang man shel dkar po dang byi ru dang dngul dang sa le sbram dang rdo'i snying po dang spug dang dmar po dang g-yas su 'khyil pa la sogs pa la reg par byed na spang ba'i ltung ba zhes
translated: If one touches jewels, pearls, lapis lazuli, conch shells, white crystals, corals, silver, gold, emeralds, amber, red gems, right-spiraling conch shells, and so forth, it is a downfall that requires confession alone.

original: bya ba tshig tu brjod par bya ba'i phyir rnam par 'byed pa las 'dir dbyig gam gser ram sa le sbram du gyur pa 'di gnyis ka yang snyad gdags su rung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bya ba tshig tu brjod par bya ba'i phyir rnam par 'byed pa las 'dir dbyig gam gser ram sa le sbram du gyur pa 'di gnyis ka yang snyad gdags su rung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the Vinaya, it is said that both gold and silver are suitable to be called “wealth” or “money” or “treasure.”

original: 'di'i don 'di rdzas gcig pu nyid de rin po che nyid du snyad gdags su rung ba dang bcas pa rdzas nyid dang bcas cha gcig pu nyid la 'dis bstan pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di'i don 'di rdzas gcig pu nyid de rin po che nyid du snyad gdags su rung ba dang bcas pa rdzas nyid dang bcas cha gcig pu nyid la 'dis bstan pa nyid do //
translated: The meaning of this is that a single substance is suitable to be called “wealth,” and that substance is money.

original: de ltar na yang zangs ma'i snyad gdags su rung pa la ni nyes byas su rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar na yang zangs ma'i snyad gdags su rung pa la ni nyes byas su rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: However, in the case of copper, it is established as a minor offense.

original: de bas na 'di ni dpe yin te rin po che'i rang bzhin ma yin pa gzhan la yang snyad gdags su rung ba la ni nyes byas zhes rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'di ni dpe yin te rin po che'i rang bzhin ma yin pa gzhan la yang snyad gdags su rung ba la ni nyes byas zhes rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is an example. It should be understood that a minor offense is incurred in relation to anything else that is suitable to be called “wealth,” even if it is not precious.

original: gang zhig de mngon par rten pa snyad gdags su rung ba'i mngon mtshan can la 'dir ngo bo ste /
analyzed: gang zhig de mngon par rten pa snyad gdags su rung ba'i mngon mtshan can la 'dir ngo bo ste /
translated: In this case, the nature of the substance is the basis for the designation of “wealth,”

original: skyes pa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: not its being male or female, etc.

original: 'di lta bu'i mtshan nyid can khyad par med pa'i phyir gnyis po 'di dag la snyad gdags su rung ba nyo tshong gi bya ba nyid ni 'dir mngon mtshan can la gtso bo ste /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i mtshan nyid can khyad par med pa'i phyir gnyis po 'di dag la snyad gdags su rung ba nyo tshong gi bya ba nyid ni 'dir mngon mtshan can la gtso bo ste /
translated: Because they have this kind of characteristic, they are both suitable to be designated as the action of buying and selling.

original: de ltar na yang @164a * //
analyzed: de ltar na yang @164a * //
translated: But even so,

original: snyad gdags su rung ba'i zangs la reg na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snyad gdags su rung ba'i zangs la reg na zhes bya ba la /
translated: if one touches the copper that is suitable to be designated,

original: snyad gdags su rung ba'i tshig ste mngon mtshan can la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snyad gdags su rung ba'i tshig ste mngon mtshan can la ni ma yin no //
translated: it is a word that is suitable to be designated, not one that is manifest.

original: de bas na mngon mtshan can ma yin pa la yang pa na nyid kyis snyad gdags su rung ba'i rin po cher gyur pa ma yin pa la gtso bo nyid du 'dir nyes byas su bya ba nyid rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mngon mtshan can ma yin pa la yang pa na nyid kyis snyad gdags su rung ba'i rin po cher gyur pa ma yin pa la gtso bo nyid du 'dir nyes byas su bya ba nyid rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, even if it is not manifest, one should understand that it is a fault to take as primary that which is not a precious thing that is suitable to be designated.

original: dper na 'gron bu rnams la ste /
analyzed: dper na 'gron bu rnams la ste /
translated: For example, with regard to cowries,

original: 'di rnams la ni spang bar bya ba nyid ma yin par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di rnams la ni spang bar bya ba nyid ma yin par shes par bya ste /
translated: one should understand that they are not to be abandoned.

original: rin po che nyid la rdzas las med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rin po che nyid la rdzas las med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not substances that are precious.

original: rin po che'i rang bzhin snyad gdags su mi rung ba'i mngon mtshan can gyi rin po che de la snyad gdags su mi rung ba nyid la nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rin po che'i rang bzhin snyad gdags su mi rung ba'i mngon mtshan can gyi rin po che de la snyad gdags su mi rung ba nyid la nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
translated: The fault in the case of a precious gem that is not suitable for adornment is that it is not suitable for adornment.

original: tha snyad rdzogs pa la yang pa na nyid du mngon mtshan can nyid kyi gtso bo ste /
analyzed: tha snyad rdzogs pa la yang pa na nyid du mngon mtshan can nyid kyi gtso bo ste /
translated: In the case of the completion of the transaction, the fault is that the gem is not the best.

original: 'dir rin po che'i snying po'i blo la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rin po che'i snying po'i blo la ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, it is not the case that the gem is not precious.

original: gzhan yang yid ches pa la bde bar gnas pa nyid spobs pa yang dag par gnas pa'i sred pa dang rgyags pa dang nga rgyal rnams la dngos po nyid ma yin ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang yid ches pa la bde bar gnas pa nyid spobs pa yang dag par gnas pa'i sred pa dang rgyags pa dang nga rgyal rnams la dngos po nyid ma yin ste /
translated: Moreover, the fault in the case of the one who is confident and well-situated is that pride, conceit, and arrogance are not real.

original: bdag tu bya ba la reg par byed pa dag la spang ba rnam par gzhag pa la rgyu yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu bya ba la reg par byed pa dag la spang ba rnam par gzhag pa la rgyu yin no //
translated: They are the cause for the establishment of the abandonment of those who are in contact with the notion of self.

original: tha snyad lhan cig spyod pa dang nyo tshong lhan cig spyod pa 'di byed pa zhes bya ba'i lan rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad lhan cig spyod pa dang nyo tshong lhan cig spyod pa 'di byed pa zhes bya ba'i lan rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the presentation of the answer to the question, “What is the fault in the case of the one who is engaged in the transaction and the one who is engaged in buying and selling?”

original: 'dir tha dad pa la bzung ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir tha dad pa la bzung ba ste /
translated: Here, the one who is grasped is different.

original: 'di 'dir mthar thug pa zhes bya ba 'di ni mdor bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di 'dir mthar thug pa zhes bya ba 'di ni mdor bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: This is the ultimate meaning in brief.

original: rin po che la yang khas len pa nyid thams cad du bya ba bsgrub pa la sgrib byed du gyur pa gzhi byed pa lhag ma la yang thob par byed pa po rung ba la sogs pa thams cad la 'di rnams par gzhag pas so //
analyzed: rin po che la yang khas len pa nyid thams cad du bya ba bsgrub pa la sgrib byed du gyur pa gzhi byed pa lhag ma la yang thob par byed pa po rung ba la sogs pa thams cad la 'di rnams par gzhag pas so //
translated: Even in the case of jewels, all the bases for the obscurations to the accomplishment of one’s aims are established as being unsuitable for the one who is to obtain them.

original: snyad gdags su mi rung ba la ni na smad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni snyad gdags su mi rung ba ni nyo tshong byar mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: snyad gdags su mi rung ba la ni na smad pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni snyad gdags su mi rung ba ni nyo tshong byar mi rung ba ste /
translated: That which is unsuitable for designation is blameworthy. That which is unsuitable for designation is unsuitable for buying and selling.

original: de la reg pa la nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la reg pa la nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
