translated: The meaning of “one commits an offense by touching it” is that it is unsuitable for designation.

original: 'og ma dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni tha snyad rdzogs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi la yang na smad pa nyid 'di snyad gdags su mi rung ba la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'og ma dag la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni tha snyad rdzogs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi la yang na smad pa nyid 'di snyad gdags su mi rung ba la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The same applies to the other cases. In the case of the training precept on commerce, this blameworthiness is also the meaning of “unsuitable for designation.”

original: snyad gdags su mi rung ba zhes bya ba de ji lta bu zhig yin par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: snyad gdags su mi rung ba zhes bya ba de ji lta bu zhig yin par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: What is that which is unsuitable for designation?

original: de'i phyir de ni gas pa dang chag pa dang dum bu dang tshig pa dang sngon ma spyad pa dang ma byas pa dang mtshan dang mi ldan pa dang bcos pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni gas pa dang chag pa dang dum bu dang tshig pa dang sngon ma spyad pa dang ma byas pa dang mtshan dang mi ldan pa dang bcos pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: “it is cracked, broken, chipped, burned, not previously used, not made, not having the characteristics, and repaired.”

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni snyad gdags su mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni snyad gdags su mi rung ba'o //
translated: “It” refers to what is not suitable for designation.

original: gas pa nyid dang chag pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni ser ga byung ba ste /
analyzed: gas pa nyid dang chag pa nyid dang zhes bya ba ni ser ga byung ba ste /
translated: “Cracked” and “broken” means that it has become discolored.

original: 'byar kyang rung ma @164b 'byar kyang rung ba dang bu ga byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'byar kyang rung ma @164b 'byar kyang rung ba dang bu ga byung ba'o //
translated: Whether it is joined or not, it has holes.

original: tshig pa zhes bya ba ni rin po che de me dang phrad nas rin po che ma yin pa nyid du gyur te /
analyzed: tshig pa zhes bya ba ni rin po che de me dang phrad nas rin po che ma yin pa nyid du gyur te /
translated: “Burned” means that when that jewel comes into contact with fire, it becomes not a jewel.

original: nyo tshong byar mi rung bar gyur pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: nyo tshong byar mi rung bar gyur pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is not suitable for buying and selling.

original: pa na ni mngon mtshan lhag pa yod pa nyid du nyams pa yin gyi thams cad kyi thams cad du thal bar gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: pa na ni mngon mtshan lhag pa yod pa nyid du nyams pa yin gyi thams cad kyi thams cad du thal bar gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: “Not having the characteristics” means that it is damaged in having an excess of characteristics. It is not that it is completely destroyed,

original: de len pa la nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de len pa la nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no fault in accepting it.

original: sngon ma spyad pa rgyan dang 'gron bu la sogs pa'i rnam par dbyibs su nye bar mngon mtshan can no //🔽pa na nyid la 'di sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngon ma spyad pa rgyan dang 'gron bu la sogs pa'i rnam par dbyibs su nye bar mngon mtshan can no // pa na nyid la 'di sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The third is a jewel that is genuine but not well cut.

original: rin po che nyid la ni ma yin no //🔽yang na tshig pa zhes bya ba ni bdar ba ste /
analyzed: rin po che nyid la ni ma yin no // yang na tshig pa zhes bya ba ni bdar ba ste /
translated: The fourth is a jewel that is well cut but not well polished.

original: dang por dri ma can bsregs pas kyang ngo //🔽mtshan dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: dang por dri ma can bsregs pas kyang ngo // mtshan dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid dang bral ba'o //
translated: The fifth is a jewel that is well cut and well polished but is not set in a fitting mount.🔽The sixth is a jewel that is well cut, well polished, and well set in a fitting mount, but it is not used, such as in a necklace, etc.🔽The seventh is a jewel that is well cut, well polished, well set in a fitting mount, and is used, but it is not genuine, such as glass, etc.🔽The eighth is a jewel that is well cut, well polished, well set in a fitting mount, is used, and is genuine, but it is not well known.🔽The ninth is a jewel that is well cut, well polished, well set in a fitting mount, is used, is genuine, and is well known, but it is not of the right color.

original: ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni gang la mtshan nyid kho na ma byas pa'o //🔽bcos pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sa dang rtsva dang rdo la sogs pa rnams la nor bu dad dang tse dang mngon mtshan can dang rgyan dang 'gron bu la sogs pa'i rnam par dbyibs su nye bar bkod pa'o //
analyzed: ma byas pa zhes bya ba ni gang la mtshan nyid kho na ma byas pa'o // bcos pa zhes bya ba ni gang zhig sa dang rtsva dang rdo la sogs pa rnams la nor bu dad dang tse dang mngon mtshan can dang rgyan dang 'gron bu la sogs pa'i rnam par dbyibs su nye bar bkod pa'o //

original: // / rnyed pa 'dod pa la ltung ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni khe spogs 'dod pa nyid kyis 'dun pa brjod pa de'i phyir 'dir ni skyed phyin na rnyed pa yin gyi thob pa tsam ni ma yin no zhes bya bar shes par bya'o //

analyzed: bdag nyid kyi don nyid du gtso bo de la zhes bya ba 'di las rang gi don nyid la dngos gzhi ste /

analyzed: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas so //

analyzed: gzhan gyi don nyid la ni nyes byas dang 'di'i sbyor ba la ni na smad pa nyid de zhes bya ba rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The main part of the offense is in the interest of others. The preparation is a minor offense.

analyzed: ltung ba 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni dngos gzhi 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te sbyor bar gyur pa yang ngo //
translated: The phrase a downfall occurs does not refer only to the actual basis of a downfall, but also to the preparation for a downfall.

original: pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang nye du ma yin pa nyid yin na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol po gang dang lhan cig tu 'dir tha snyad du byed pa de gal te khyim pa nyid dang nye du ma yin pa nyid yin na de
analyzed: pha rol po khyim pa nyid dang nye du ma yin pa nyid yin na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba ni pha rol po gang dang lhan cig tu 'dir tha snyad du byed pa de gal te khyim pa nyid dang nye du ma yin pa nyid yin na de
translated: If the other person is a layperson and not a relative, it is the actual basis of a downfall. The phrase if the other person is a layperson and not a relative means that if the person with whom one is conversing is a layperson and not a relative, then🔽it is the actual basis of a downfall.

original: nas 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nas 'dir dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase here, the root downfall is... means that here, in this case, the root downfall is incurred.

analyzed: 'dir gzung ni zhu ba las nye du rnams dang lhan cig spyod na nyes byas so zhes @165a * //
translated: Here, the root text of the Verses of the Elder Monks states, If one engages in conversation with relatives, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bya ba ni nyes byas su gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni nyes byas su gsungs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase there is an offense of wrong conduct refers to the statement that this is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de bas na 'dir nye du'i tshig 'di yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir nye du'i tshig 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, the term relative in this case means one's own relative.

original: gzhan nye du ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dir 'gal zla'i khyad par yod pa la 'dir dngos gzhi gang du zhen /
analyzed: gzhan nye du ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'dir 'gal zla'i khyad par yod pa la 'dir dngos gzhi gang du zhen /
translated: The phrase if the other person is not a relative means that if the other person is not a relative, then what is the actual basis of a downfall?

original: de'i phyir skyed phyin na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyed phyin na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “if it is produced.”

original: gang gi tshe skyed phyin na de'i tshe dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe skyed phyin na de'i tshe dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When it is produced, then it is a downfall of the root vow.🔽If it is not produced, then it is merely preparation.

original: skyed med na ni sbyor ba tsam du zad do zhes bya ba la nor 'phel bar gyur pa'i nor la 'dir spang ba ni sbyin pa po nyid la yang dag par gnas pa dgos par bya'o //
analyzed: skyed med na ni sbyor ba tsam du zad do zhes bya ba la nor 'phel bar gyur pa'i nor la 'dir spang ba ni sbyin pa po nyid la yang dag par gnas pa dgos par bya'o //
translated: Here, in the case of wealth that has increased, it is necessary to abide in the state of a giver.

original: rtsa ba dang bcas pa la ltung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang bcas pa la ltung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as a downfall with a root.

original: skyed phyin pa'i nor bsgrub pa la sbyin pa po nyid la zhen pas rnam par gzhag cing de las skyed du gyur pa mngon par zhen pa sbyin pa po la byas pa nyid do //
analyzed: skyed phyin pa'i nor bsgrub pa la sbyin pa po nyid la zhen pas rnam par gzhag cing de las skyed du gyur pa mngon par zhen pa sbyin pa po la byas pa nyid do //
translated: When the wealth has been produced, it is established by the giver’s attachment, and the giver’s sense of ownership of it is produced.🔽The same applies to the next.

original: 'og ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni nyo tshong gis kyang rnyed par 'dod pa nyid la ltung ba ste /
analyzed: 'og ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni nyo tshong gis kyang rnyed par 'dod pa nyid la ltung ba ste /
translated: It is a downfall to desire to acquire wealth through trade.

original: nye dur ma gyur pa nyid dang khyim pa'i bdag nyid can nyid la skyed phyin pa nyid du sgrub na gzhan la dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: nye dur ma gyur pa nyid dang khyim pa'i bdag nyid can nyid la skyed phyin pa nyid du sgrub na gzhan la dngos gzhi'o //
translated: If one causes the production of that which is not a relative, or that which is not a householder, then it is a basis in another.

original: 'dir ci'i phyir skyed bsgrub pa la dngos gzhi yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir ci'i phyir skyed bsgrub pa la dngos gzhi yin zhe na /
translated: Here, why is the production of that which is not a relative a basis?

original: de'i phyir pa na 'am rin po ches spyod pa las so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir pa na 'am rin po ches spyod pa las so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “from the use of money or jewels.”

original: 'dir reg gam reg du 'jug par byed pa dag la so sor bsgrub pa sngon du 'gro bas spang ba'i ltung byed du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir reg gam reg du 'jug par byed pa dag la so sor bsgrub pa sngon du 'gro bas spang ba'i ltung byed du rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, if one touches or causes another to touch, then it should be understood as a downfall of abandoning training that is established individually.

original: nyo ba la yang rnyed pa grub na dngos gzhi ste /
analyzed: nyo ba la yang rnyed pa grub na dngos gzhi ste /
translated: If one purchases and the acquisition is established, then it is a basis.

original: nyo ba ma yin pa la yang rnyed pa ma grub pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: nyo ba ma yin pa la yang rnyed pa ma grub pa la nyes byas so //
translated: If one does not purchase and the acquisition is not established, then it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nyo ba ma yin pa la sngon du 'gro ba'i rnyed pa la yang dngos gzhi'i byas pa nyid ces bya ba 'dir rnam par gzhag pa 'di rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyo ba ma yin pa la sngon du 'gro ba'i rnyed pa la yang dngos gzhi'i byas pa nyid ces bya ba 'dir rnam par gzhag pa 'di rig par bya'o //
translated: If one does not purchase and the acquisition is established, then it is a basis. This should be understood as the presentation here.

original: sbyor ba las ni gcig po nyid do zhes bya ba ni skyed grub pa bas mdun rol du ji srid du 'dir thams cad la bsgrub pa de la gcig pa nyid de tha dad pa ni 'ga' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba las ni gcig po nyid do zhes bya ba ni skyed grub pa bas mdun rol du ji srid du 'dir thams cad la bsgrub pa de la gcig pa nyid de tha dad pa ni 'ga' yang ma yin no //
translated: From the performance, it is just one. This means that from the beginning, as long as one is establishing this, it is just one, and there is no difference at all.

original: mtha' nas phyogs yongs su btsal ba la yang 'di lta bur gyur pa gzhan thams cad la der sbyor ba'i ltung ba gcig nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtha' nas phyogs yongs su btsal ba la yang 'di lta bur gyur pa gzhan thams cad la der sbyor ba'i ltung ba gcig nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even if one searches all around the border, it is just one downfall of the vow that is applied in this way to all the others.

original: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni ji srid du rnyed pa sgrub par mi byed kyi bar du ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir gzhung ni ji srid du rnyed pa sgrub par mi byed kyi bar du ni nyes byas so //
translated: Thus, as long as one does not establish the acquisition, it is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: rnyed pa grub na ni spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnyed pa grub na ni spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //

analyzed: rnyed pa gang la mngon sum mam brgyud pas skyed pa nyid dang pa na dgos pa las skyes pa nyid der snga ma'i ltung ba'o //
translated: The former downfall is that which is produced by direct or indirect means, and that which is produced by need.

analyzed: chos dang mi ldan pa'i don la thams cad kyis rang gi don nam gzhan gyi don du 'dod pa med par spyod pa lhan cig spyod pa mi byed pa'o //
translated: The one who does not practice in accordance with the Dharma is not to be practiced with by anyone, either for his own sake or for the sake of others.

analyzed: chos dang ldan pa rjes su gnang ba nyid 'di las gzhan la zhes bya ba 'dir gnas par bya'o //
translated: The one who practices in accordance with the Dharma is to be practiced with, but only after he has been tested for four months.

original: khyim pa nyor gzhug go //

analyzed: sman phor du yongs su spyad pa'i bsam pas 'chad na de la ltung ba med par gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: If you explain it with the intention of using it as a medicine bowl, there is no offense.

original: lhung bzed kyi don du ni 'di rnams la 'chang bar bya ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi don du ni 'di rnams la 'chang bar bya ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: But these are not to be kept for the purpose of a begging bowl.

original: 'di la mi 'os pa byin gyis brlabs pa la kha zas la yongs su longs spyad pa'i don nyid du 'chang ba la nyes byas te /🔽gzhan la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la mi 'os pa byin gyis brlabs pa la kha zas la yongs su longs spyad pa'i don nyid du 'chang ba la nyes byas te / gzhan la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba'i rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The offense of wrong conduct is incurred by keeping a bowl that is consecrated as a substitute for one that is not suitable.🔽There is no offense for keeping another bowl.

original: lhung bzed chung ngu gcig la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed chung ngu gcig lhag par 'chang ba la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: lhung bzed chung ngu gcig la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed chung ngu gcig lhag par 'chang ba la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense for keeping an extra small bowl.

original: gang zhig lhung bzed chung dus ljongs rgyur 'gro bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de ni 'di'i chen po nyid 'chang ba la bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig lhung bzed chung dus ljongs rgyur 'gro bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de ni 'di'i chen po nyid 'chang ba la bstan pa'o //
translated: The Buddha taught that one should travel with a small bowl, so this refers to keeping an extra large bowl.

original: lhung bzed 'chang ba'i spang ba'o /
analyzed: lhung bzed 'chang ba'i spang ba'o /
translated: This is the prohibition against keeping an extra bowl.🔽One should not be overly attached to it.

original: // / ha cang chags par ma bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhung ni gnas mal gyi gzhir ro //
analyzed: // / ha cang chags par ma bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhung ni gnas mal gyi gzhir ro //
translated: The text for this rule is found in the chapter on bedding.

original: yo byad ces bya ba mdo dang po gnyis te gos kyi gzhir ro //
analyzed: yo byad ces bya ba mdo dang po gnyis te gos kyi gzhir ro //
translated: The term “belongings” in the first two citations refers to the chapter on robes.

original: yo byad la ha cang lhag par chags par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yo byad la ha cang lhag par chags par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should not be excessively attached to one’s possessions.

original: rang gi zhes bya bar sbyar bar gyur pa nyid kyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi zhes bya bar sbyar bar gyur pa nyid kyis shes par bya'o //
translated: “One’s own” should be supplied.

original: yo byad ni chos gos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yo byad ni chos gos la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Possessions” refers to the three robes and so on.

original: gang la zhen pa de bcang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la zhen pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang la zhen pa de bcang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la zhen pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should not keep what one is attached to.”

original: lhag par chags pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par chags pa'o //
translated: “Attached” means “excessively attached.”

original: gang du zhes bya bar lhung bzed la sogs pa las byung ba de bcang bar mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang du zhes bya bar lhung bzed la sogs pa las byung ba de bcang bar mi bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Where” refers to the alms bowl and so on. The meaning is that “one should not keep what one is attached to.”

original: lhung bzed kyang med na bslang bar bya'o zhes bya @168a * //
analyzed: lhung bzed kyang med na bslang bar bya'o zhes bya @168a * //
translated: “If one does not have an alms bowl, one should beg for one.”

original: pa ni lhung bzed yod pas slong pa'i nyes pa gang yin pa de mi 'byung zhes bya ba byas te /
analyzed: pa ni lhung bzed yod pas slong pa'i nyes pa gang yin pa de mi 'byung zhes bya ba byas te /
translated: The meaning is that the fault of begging for an alms bowl when one already has one does not occur.

original: chos gos blang bar rjes su gnang ba gang yin pa de la ltos pa ni /
analyzed: chos gos blang bar rjes su gnang ba gang yin pa de la ltos pa ni /
translated: “One should accept the three robes” is supplied.

original: 'dir yang ni sgra'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang ni sgra'o //
translated: The word “also” refers to this.

original: med pa gang zhig lhung bzed yongs su tshol ba'i so sor yang dag par ldan pa kha na ma tho bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: med pa gang zhig lhung bzed yongs su tshol ba'i so sor yang dag par ldan pa kha na ma tho bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the individual who is not a monk who is associated with the offense of seeking a begging bowl?

original: de'i phyir de yod pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de yod pa nyid na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “if it exists.”

original: lhung bzed de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhung bzed de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: “if that begging bowl exists.”

original: gzhan la ni ltung ba med ces bya ba /
analyzed: gzhan la ni ltung ba med ces bya ba /
translated: “There is no offense for another” means:

original: ltung ba'i yul nyid kyi phyir 'di'i cho ga bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba'i yul nyid kyi phyir 'di'i cho ga bsgrub pa'o //
translated: because it is the object of the offense, this is the rule for him.

original: ji lta bu zhig yod pa nyid na zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhig yod pa nyid na zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What kind of existence is there? Therefore, he says,

original: lhan pa bzhi man chad nas de dag rung zhing /
analyzed: lhan pa bzhi man chad nas de dag rung zhing /
translated: “if it is suitable to be patched up with four or more patches,

original: yongs su spyad bzod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yongs su spyad bzod pa'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: and if it is suitable to be used.”

original: lhan pa bzhi man chad nas nus pa nyid kyis lhan pa 'di tsam rnams kyis de nas brtsams te /
analyzed: lhan pa bzhi man chad nas nus pa nyid kyis lhan pa 'di tsam rnams kyis de nas brtsams te /
translated: Because it is capable of being patched up with four or more patches, it is suitable to be patched up with just those patches.

original: 'di lta bu ji srid lhung bzed yongs su longs spyad par nus pa de'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di lta bu ji srid lhung bzed yongs su longs spyad par nus pa de'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: “if it is suitable to be used as a begging bowl for as long as it is capable of being used.”

original: cung zad skyon med pa yang shin tu snyi ba nyid kyi phyir dang / 'jam pa'i sa gzhi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir yongs su longs spyad par bzod par 'gyur ba de bzlog pa'i don du yongs su spyad par bzod ba'o zhes bya ba'i bye brag go //
analyzed: cung zad skyon med pa yang shin tu snyi ba nyid kyi phyir dang / 'jam pa'i sa gzhi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir yongs su longs spyad par bzod par 'gyur ba de bzlog pa'i don du yongs su spyad par bzod ba'o zhes bya ba'i bye brag go //
translated: Also, because the earth is very soft, even if there is no fault, it is not possible to enjoy it.  The distinction is that it is “endurable to enjoy” in order to stop that.

original: de yod pa nyid na ji zhig lhag par spyad na kha na ma tho pa ci 'dra ba 'gyur zhe na /🔽de'i phyir khyim pa nye du ma yin pa las bslangs pas yongs su btsal na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yod pa nyid na ji zhig lhag par spyad na kha na ma tho pa ci 'dra ba 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir khyim pa nye du ma yin pa las bslangs pas yongs su btsal na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If it exists, what is the difference in enjoying it?  What kind of fault would there be?🔽Therefore, it is said, “if one seeks it by asking a layperson who is not a relative.”

original: khyim pa nye du ma yin pa las bslangs te yongs su btsal na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyim pa nye du ma yin pa las bslangs te yongs su btsal na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if one seeks it by asking a layperson who is not a relative.

original: de gnyis ni 'og ma gnyis la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'di'i 'og ma bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis po gang dag yin pa de dag la yang nye du ma yin pa dang / khyim pa nyid ces bya ba 'di gnyis rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de gnyis ni 'og ma gnyis la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'di'i 'og ma bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis po gang dag yin pa de dag la yang nye du ma yin pa dang / khyim pa nyid ces bya ba 'di gnyis rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the two, not a relative and not a householder, should be understood in regard to the other two bases of training.🔽A weaver, a donor, and others.

original: tha ga pa dang / sbyin pa dang / gzhan dag la'o zhes bya ba ni tha ga pa dang / sbyin pa dang / gzhan dang de rnams so //
analyzed: tha ga pa dang / sbyin pa dang / gzhan dag la'o zhes bya ba ni tha ga pa dang / sbyin pa dang / gzhan dang de rnams so //
translated: A weaver, a donor, and others, those are them.

original: de dag nye du ma yin pa dang / khyim pa ma yin pa rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag nye du ma yin pa dang / khyim pa ma yin pa rnams la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: in regard to those who are not relatives and are not householders.

original: gzhan gyis brjod pa'i don la gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgras de bzung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyis brjod pa'i don la gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgras de bzung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: The word “others” should be understood to refer to those who are mentioned by others.

original: nye du ma yin pa ltar nye du las ni skyed dang lhung bzed gnyis ma gtogs pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa ltar nye du las ni skyed dang lhung bzed gnyis ma gtogs pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: There is no offense in regard to relatives, except for the two, a weaver and a bowl.

original: nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa'o //
translated: “No offense” means no fault.

original: nye du ma yin pa ltar zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa ste /🔽nye du ma yin @168b pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi nyes pa bsod pa slong ba la sogs pa gang yin pa nyes pa de la nye du'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyis yang dag par brten ba la med pa'o //
analyzed: nye du ma yin pa ltar zhes bya ba ni 'di ni rgyu mtshan gyi bdun pa ste / nye du ma yin @168b pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi nyes pa bsod pa slong ba la sogs pa gang yin pa nyes pa de la nye du'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyis yang dag par brten ba la med pa'o //
translated: As if they were not relatives is the seventh reason.🔽There is no reliance on the reason of being a relative for the fault of begging for food, etc. when one is not a relative.

original: 'phel ba dor nas 'phel ba brten pa nyid la ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'phel ba dor nas 'phel ba brten pa nyid la ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Having given up increase, one relies on increase means that one relies on the increase of the Dharma, not on the increase of material things.

original: mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa dang nyo tshong gi spyod pa dag gis rnyed pa grub pa dang lhung bzed la yang 'di dag la na smad pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon mtshan can gyi spyod pa dang nyo tshong gi spyod pa dag gis rnyed pa grub pa dang lhung bzed la yang 'di dag la na smad pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of disparaged is that one is disparaged by those who have attained gain through conspicuous behavior and the behavior of buying and selling, and by those who have attained a begging bowl.

original: gang zhig nye dus bos pa la ltung ba med pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: gang zhig nye dus bos pa la ltung ba med pa'i tshig go //
translated: There is no offense for one who calls out to a relative.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'di yin te gcer bu pa la sbyin na nye du yin na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa dang / zhu ba las kyang nye du las zas bsod pa bslangs te rang za ba dang gcer bu pa la sbyin zhing sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang bral bar 'dod pas sbyin par byed na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'di yin te gcer bu pa la sbyin na nye du yin na ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa dang / zhu ba las kyang nye du las zas bsod pa bslangs te rang za ba dang gcer bu pa la sbyin zhing sdig pa can gyi lta ba'i rnam pa dang bral bar 'dod pas sbyin par byed na ltung ba med do //
translated: And in the Questions of Upāli, it says, “If one asks a relative for good food and eats it oneself, or if one gives to a naked ascetic, there is no offense if one wishes to be free from the aspects of sinful views.”

original: nye du yin na yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽zhar las byung ba bstan nas gang zhig gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: nye du yin na yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no // zhar las byung ba bstan nas gang zhig gang gsungs pa /
translated: “If he is a relative, it is the same.”🔽Having explained the digression, now, the topic that was presented is this.

original: khyim pa nye du ma yin pa las bslangs pas yongs su btsal na'o zhes gang smras pa'i ltung ba de'i skabs su gtogs pa bstan pa'i phyir 'dir 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: khyim pa nye du ma yin pa las bslangs pas yongs su btsal na'o zhes gang smras pa'i ltung ba de'i skabs su gtogs pa bstan pa'i phyir 'dir 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: In the context of the offense that was stated, “If one asks a layperson who is not a relative, there is an offense if one searches,” this should be stated here:

original: nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni 'tshol ba tsam las nyes byas su 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni 'tshol ba tsam las nyes byas su 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “It is an offense of wrong conduct.” The meaning is that it is an offense of wrong conduct merely from the act of searching.

original: de las gru pa na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las gru pa na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The basis of the offense is from that.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni khyim pa las blangs pa btsal na thob pa la dngos gzhi'i khan ma tho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽med pa nyid la yod pa'i blo can la ni na smad pa med do zhes bya ba ni bdag la lhung bzed gzhan yod do snyam pa'i blo gang yin pa 'di yod cing de'i tshe gal te 'tshol bar byed na rnyed par 'gyur ba dang yod par 'gyur
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni khyim pa las blangs pa btsal na thob pa la dngos gzhi'i khan ma tho bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // med pa nyid la yod pa'i blo can la ni na smad pa med do zhes bya ba ni bdag la lhung bzed gzhan yod do snyam pa'i blo gang yin pa 'di yod cing de'i tshe gal te 'tshol bar byed na rnyed par 'gyur ba dang yod par 'gyur
translated: The meaning of “from that” is that if one seeks and obtains a begging bowl from a layperson, there is the basis of the offense.🔽There is no offense for one who has the thought that it exists when it does not exist.

original: ba'i lhung bzed dag gi nang nas gzhan dag la med pa nyid la ni med pa ste /
analyzed: ba'i lhung bzed dag gi nang nas gzhan dag la med pa nyid la ni med pa ste /
translated: If one has the thought “I have another begging bowl,” and at that time if one seeks and finds another begging bowl, then among the existing begging bowls, there is no offense for one who has the thought that it does not exist in the other bowls.

original: dbye ba la sogs pas 'gyur na de la lhung ba la na smad pa nyid de dngos gzhi'i lhung ba nyid ni med do /
analyzed: dbye ba la sogs pas 'gyur na de la lhung ba la na smad pa nyid de dngos gzhi'i lhung ba nyid ni med do /
translated: If it were to change through division and so on, then there would be the offense of the basis of the offense, but there is no offense of the basis.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong 'ga' zhig yod de lhung bzed mchis bzhin du lhung bzed gzhan la bslangs par gyur la ltung bar mi 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig mchis sam /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong 'ga' zhig yod de lhung bzed mchis bzhin du lhung bzed gzhan la bslangs par gyur la ltung bar mi 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig mchis sam /
translated: Here, the text is: “There are some monks who, while having a begging bowl, ask for another begging bowl. Is there any case where there is no offense?🔽”

original: bka' stsal pa yod de /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa yod de /
translated: The Buddha said, “There is.

original: gal te bslangs pa dag snga phyi med par lhung bzed chag par gyur na lhung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽'dir spang ba med pa la dgongs nas ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin pas sbyor ba med pa'i @169a * //
analyzed: gal te bslangs pa dag snga phyi med par lhung bzed chag par gyur na lhung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin no // 'dir spang ba med pa la dgongs nas ltung ba med do zhes gsungs pa yin pas sbyor ba med pa'i @169a * //
translated: If the begging bowls that are asked for are not received simultaneously, and one of the begging bowls is broken, there is no offense.”

original: dgongs pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dgongs pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, intending that there is no offense that is to be confessed, he said, “There is no offense.” Therefore, this is not a case of indirect intention.

original: 'dir na smad pa'i tshig gis dngos gzhi'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: 'dir na smad pa'i tshig gis dngos gzhi'i nyes byas so //
translated: Here, the word “disapproved” refers to a fault in the actual basis.

original: sbyor ba la ni 'di ma chog pa zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba la ni 'di ma chog pa zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa'o //
translated: In the preparation, this is taught as “improper.”

original: rang gi yo byad dag gis so //
analyzed: rang gi yo byad dag gis so //
translated: “With one’s own articles” means

original: de dag yod pa nyid na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni yo byad rnams la na smad pa nyid ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dag yod pa nyid na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni yo byad rnams la na smad pa nyid ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: that even if one has them, one should not use them.

original: 'dir gnyis ka'i yo byad rnams kyis lhung bzed gzhan tshol bar byed na nyes byas te /
analyzed: 'dir gnyis ka'i yo byad rnams kyis lhung bzed gzhan tshol bar byed na nyes byas te /
translated: Here, if one seeks another alms bowl with the requisites of either, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: yod cing bdog pa nyid na lhung bzed tshol bar byed na nyes byas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod cing bdog pa nyid na lhung bzed tshol bar byed na nyes byas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one seeks an alms bowl when one has and possesses one, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'dir yang dngos gzhi'i slad du ltung ba med par bstan te sbyor ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang dngos gzhi'i slad du ltung ba med par bstan te sbyor ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, it is taught that there is no offense for the actual basis, but not for the preparation.

original: rjes su gnang ba'i slong ba gzhan la yang rang gi rin thang yod na 'jug pa la nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di la rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su gnang ba'i slong ba gzhan la yang rang gi rin thang yod na 'jug pa la nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di la rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Also, one should understand that if one engages in trading one’s own alms bowl for another permitted alms bowl of equal value, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: bzang po 'dod pas brje na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bzang po 'dod pas brje na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one trades it desiring a better one, there is a serious offense.

original: lhung bzed bzang po 'dod pa la ni bzang po 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed bzang po 'dod pa la ni bzang po 'dod pa ste /
translated: Desiring a better one means desiring a better alms bowl.

original: tshol bar byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bzang po de'i 'dun pas brje bar byed na ltung ba na smad par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: tshol bar byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi bzang po de'i 'dun pas brje bar byed na ltung ba na smad par shes par bya'o //
translated: If one trades it with the intention of obtaining a better one, preceded by the desire to seek one, one should understand that there is a serious offense.

original: brje bas len na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba gang zhig gsungs pa ni bzang ba 'dod pa med par brje ba'i dbang du byas te de rig par bya'o //
analyzed: brje bas len na ltung ba med do zhes bya ba gang zhig gsungs pa ni bzang ba 'dod pa med par brje ba'i dbang du byas te de rig par bya'o //
translated: If one exchanges it, there is no offense.

original: khyim pa nye du ma yin pa las bslangs te thob na dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: khyim pa nye du ma yin pa las bslangs te thob na dngos gzhi'o //
translated: If one obtains it from a non-relative householder who is not solicited, it is the actual basis.

original: ma bslangs par btsal na spangs nas brje ba nye du ma yin pa'i khyim pa 'am gzhan la spangs te thob par gyur pa la bzang po 'dod pas kyang brje ba thams cad du sbyor ba la ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: ma bslangs par btsal na spangs nas brje ba nye du ma yin pa'i khyim pa 'am gzhan la spangs te thob par gyur pa la bzang po 'dod pas kyang brje ba thams cad du sbyor ba la ni nyes byas so //
translated: If one seeks without being solicited, there is an offense of wrong conduct in all cases of exchanging with a non-relative householder or another who has discarded it, if one exchanges it with the desire for something better.

original: btsal ba med par brje bas bzang po 'dod pa nyid med par grub na ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba 'di 'dir gnas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: btsal ba med par brje bas bzang po 'dod pa nyid med par grub na ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba 'di 'dir gnas par rig par bya'o //
translated: If one exchanges it without seeking, and one obtains something better without desire for something better, there is no offense. This should be understood here.

original: zhag bcu las 'da' bar byed pa la spang ba'i ltung byed gzhan du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhag bcu las 'da' bar byed pa la spang ba'i ltung byed gzhan du shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that passing beyond ten days is another downfall of a novice.

original: 'di ni dge 'dun la spang ngo zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed lhag pa 'di ni ji ltar spang ba gzhan gang zag la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dge 'dun la spang ngo zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed lhag pa 'di ni ji ltar spang ba gzhan gang zag la ni ma yin no //
translated: This is to be relinquished to the Saṅgha means that this extra alms-bowl is to be relinquished to the Saṅgha, not to another person.

original: ci lhung bzed thams cad dge 'dun la spang bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci lhung bzed thams cad dge 'dun la spang bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Is every alms-bowl to be relinquished to the Saṅgha?

original: ma yin te de'i phyir du ma nyid yin na mchog tu 'dod pa gcig go zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma yin te de'i phyir du ma nyid yin na mchog tu 'dod pa gcig go zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: No, therefore it says, if there are many, the best one is to be relinquished to the Saṅgha.

original: lhung bzed lhag ma du ma nyid du yin na mchog tu 'dod pa gcig dge 'dun la spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed lhag ma du ma nyid du yin na mchog tu 'dod pa gcig dge 'dun la spang bar bya'o //
translated: If there are many extra alms-bowls, the best one is to be relinquished to the Saṅgha.

original: 'o na lhag ma gzhan spang bar bya ba 'am ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na lhag ma gzhan spang bar bya ba 'am ma yin zhe na /
translated: But is the other extra one to be relinquished or not?

original: de'i phyir gzhan ni thams cad kyi thams cad du spang bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan ni thams cad kyi thams cad du spang bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, the other one is to be relinquished in every way.

original: gang du yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang du yin zhe na /
translated: Where is it to be relinquished?

original: de'i phyir rab tu byung ba 'di la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rab tu byung ba 'di la'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore it says, to this renunciant.

original: zhu ba las lhung bzed lhag @169b ma rnams ni dge slong rnams la bgo bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhu ba las lhung bzed lhag @169b ma rnams ni dge slong rnams la bgo bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In the Questions of Upāli it says, “The extra alms-bowls are to be distributed to the monks.”

original: dge slong zhes smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam du zad de chos 'di la rab tu byung ba thams cad kyang spyir bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam du zad de chos 'di la rab tu byung ba thams cad kyang spyir bsdu ba'o //
translated: The term “monk” is only an illustration; all those who have gone forth in this Dharma are included in general.

original: de la tha chad sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spangs pa de nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la tha chad sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni spangs pa de nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: “The worst should be given to him” means that it should not be given to the one who has been expelled.

original: gzhan du na yang lhung bzed tha chad gang yin pa de 'di la sbyin par bya'o //🔽'on te de nyid dge 'dun de la tha chad 'byung bar 'gyur na de nyid la sbyin par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan du na yang lhung bzed tha chad gang yin pa de 'di la sbyin par bya'o // 'on te de nyid dge 'dun de la tha chad 'byung bar 'gyur na de nyid la sbyin par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Otherwise, the worst alms-bowl should be given to him.🔽But if the worst thing happens to that Saṅgha, then it should be given to him.

original: brim pas bsnyigs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tha chad de dge 'dun de las so //
analyzed: brim pas bsnyigs par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tha chad de dge 'dun de las so //
translated: “He should be made the worst by the distributor” means that the worst should be given to him from that Saṅgha.

original: byed pa po ji lta bus brim pas dge 'dun las tha chad de bsnyigs par bya zhe na de'i phyir bskos pas so //
analyzed: byed pa po ji lta bus brim pas dge 'dun las tha chad de bsnyigs par bya zhe na de'i phyir bskos pas so //
translated: By what kind of distributor should the worst be made by the distributor from the Saṅgha? Therefore it is said: “by the appointed one.”

original: des sang de byed par 'gyur ba na tshogs kyi dus su dge 'dun la gzhal bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: des sang de byed par 'gyur ba na tshogs kyi dus su dge 'dun la gzhal bar bya'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: When he is going to do that tomorrow, he should be weighed against the Saṅgha at the time of the assembly.

original: de zhes bya ba ni brim pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni brim pa la bya'o //
translated: “That” refers to the distributor.

original: de zhes bya ba ni bskos pas so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bskos pas so //
translated: The term that refers to the one who is appointed.

original: ji skad gzhal bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad gzhal bar bya zhe na /
translated: How is this to be done?

original: de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag sang lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'drim par 'gyur gyis khyer cag rang rang gi lhung bzed dag thogs la dge 'dun gyi nang du gshegs par mdzod cig ces so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag sang lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa 'drim par 'gyur gyis khyer cag rang rang gi lhung bzed dag thogs la dge 'dun gyi nang du gshegs par mdzod cig ces so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, Venerable ones, tomorrow I will distribute the unrelated bowls. You should each take your own bowls and enter the saṅgha.

original: lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed 'di au na dha de 'brel pa med pa dang byin gyis brlab par bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'chag par bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'bangs bzhin du spang ba dang bcas bzhes bya ba 'di ni 'di'i ming ngo //
analyzed: lhung bzed 'brel pa med pa zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed 'di au na dha de 'brel pa med pa dang byin gyis brlab par bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'chag par bya ba ma yin pa dang / 'bangs bzhin du spang ba dang bcas bzhes bya ba 'di ni 'di'i ming ngo //
translated: The term unrelated bowls means that this bowl is unrelated to that bowl, it is not to be blessed, it is not to be walked on, it is to be abandoned like a piece of wood. This is its name.

original: 'khod pa'i don du nan tan bya'o zhes bya ba ni bskos pa nyid kyis gnyis ka dag gi snga rol du zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di las ji srid du bskos pa la zhes bya ba dbang du bya ba nyid len pa dang ma blangs pa zhes bya ba
analyzed: 'khod pa'i don du nan tan bya'o zhes bya ba ni bskos pa nyid kyis gnyis ka dag gi snga rol du zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di las ji srid du bskos pa la zhes bya ba dbang du bya ba nyid len pa dang ma blangs pa zhes bya ba
translated: The phrase one should make an effort to assign means that both the one who is appointed and the one who is not appointed should make an effort to assign.🔽 The phrase prior to both in the sutra means prior to the one who is appointed and the one who is not appointed.

original: 'di dag la shugs kyis len pa po'i byed pa po nyid du rtogs par bya'o //🔽bsngags pa brtsam zhing dbul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di dag la shugs kyis len pa po'i byed pa po nyid du rtogs par bya'o // bsngags pa brtsam zhing dbul bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase one who is appointed and one who is not appointed should be understood to refer to the one who takes and the one who does not take, respectively.🔽 The phrase one should begin praise and offer means

original: des lhung bzed kyi dbang du bya ba ste /
analyzed: des lhung bzed kyi dbang du bya ba ste /
translated: that the one who is appointed should begin praise and offer the alms-bowl.🔽 What kind of praise should one begin and offer?

original: rnam pa ji lta bu'i bsngags pa brtsam zhing dbul bar bya zhe na de'i phyir gnas brtan lhung bzed 'di ni shin tu gsal ba dbyibs legs pa longs spyad bzod pa lags kyi gal te bzhed na snoms shig ces so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa ji lta bu'i bsngags pa brtsam zhing dbul bar bya zhe na de'i phyir gnas brtan lhung bzed 'di ni shin tu gsal ba dbyibs legs pa longs spyad bzod pa lags kyi gal te bzhed na snoms shig ces so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, Elder, this alms-bowl is very clear, well-shaped, and suitable for use. If you wish, take it.

original: ci 'di lta bu nyid thams cad la brjod par bya 'am zhe na de'i phyir yon tan ji lta ba bzhin du'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci 'di lta bu nyid thams cad la brjod par bya 'am zhe na de'i phyir yon tan ji lta ba bzhin du'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To respond, the root text states, “In accordance with their qualities.”

original: 'di ni dpe yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dpe yin no //
translated: This is an example.

original: gang la yon tan gang dang gang yod pa de dang de dag la brjod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽'dod na blang bar @170a * //
analyzed: gang la yon tan gang dang gang yod pa de dang de dag la brjod par bya zhes bya ba'i don to // 'dod na blang bar @170a * //
translated: The meaning is that whatever qualities exist in whatever objects should be mentioned.

original: bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa yod na gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa yod na gzung bar bya'o //
translated: “If one wishes, one should take them up” means that if one wishes, one should grasp them.

original: med na ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med na ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that if one does not wish to, one should not.

original: bar du chod pas blangs pa blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir gcig gis bar du chod pa nyid ni brten pa'o //🔽gang gi phyir gsum pas blangs pa na du mas bar du chod pa nyid la ni shin tu yang blang bar mi bya ba nyid du bya'o zhes bya ba 'di brjod do //
analyzed: bar du chod pas blangs pa blang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir gcig gis bar du chod pa nyid ni brten pa'o //🔽gang gi phyir gsum pas blangs pa na du mas bar du chod pa nyid la ni shin tu yang blang bar mi bya ba nyid du bya'o zhes bya ba 'di brjod do //
translated: “One should not take up what has been taken up by someone else” means that in this context, one should not take up what has been taken up by another if it is something that is held in common.🔽The meaning of “if it is something that is held in common” is that if it is something that is not held in common, then it should be understood that one should not take up what has been taken up by another even if it is not something that is held in common.

original: slong ba yod na tshig gnyis pa la ni mi sbyin zhing gsum pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gsum pa la ni mi rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: slong ba yod na tshig gnyis pa la ni mi sbyin zhing gsum pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni tshig gsum pa la ni mi rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If there is a beggar, he should not give in response to the second statement, but he should in response to the third.

original: 'brel pa med par shin tu 'da' bar byed na zhes bya ba 'di tsam ni 'dir rgyu mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med par shin tu 'da' bar byed na zhes bya ba 'di tsam ni 'dir rgyu mthong ba yin te /
translated: This much is seen as the cause here: if he does not give in response to the third statement, he is in error.

original: de bas na gsum pa'i tshig la ci nas kyang sbyin par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na gsum pa'i tshig la ci nas kyang sbyin par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, he should give in response to the third statement.🔽It should be understood that one should not abandon or consecrate a downfall that has occurred.

original: ltung ba byung ba la spang bar mi bya ba nyid dang byin gyis brlab par mi bya ba nyid dag go bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlab par yang mi bya ba nyid dang / spang bar mi bya ba nyid ces bya ba 'di ltar bskos pas ltung bar 'gyur ba la go bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ltung ba byung ba la spang bar mi bya ba nyid dang byin gyis brlab par mi bya ba nyid dag go bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlab par yang mi bya ba nyid dang / spang bar mi bya ba nyid ces bya ba 'di ltar bskos pas ltung bar 'gyur ba la go bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means that one should not consecrate or abandon a downfall that has been appointed.

original: nye bar spyod pa la ma chag gi bar du dal bu ngal bus spyod cig ces so zhes bya ba ni ltung ba la go bar bya zhes pa nyid du rim gyis dal bu dal bus yongs su longs spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: nye bar spyod pa la ma chag gi bar du dal bu ngal bus spyod cig ces so zhes bya ba ni ltung ba la go bar bya zhes pa nyid du rim gyis dal bu dal bus yongs su longs spyad par bya ste /

translated: This is the meaning: One should use it slowly, slowly, until the bowl is broken.🔽 This is the meaning: One should use it slowly, slowly, until the bowl is broken.🔽 This is the meaning: One should use it slowly, slowly, until the bowl is broken.🔽 This is the meaning: One should use it slowly, slowly, until the bowl is broken.🔽 This is the meaning: One should use it slowly, slowly, until the bowl is broken.🔽 This is the meaning: One should use it slowly, slowly, until the bowl is broken.🔽 This is the meaning: One should use it slowly, slowly, until the bowl is broken.🔽 This is the meaning: One should use it slowly, slowly, until the bowl is broken.

original: de gnyis kas kun du spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba la gnyis kas zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed dag gis so //
analyzed: de gnyis kas kun du spyad par bya'o zhes bya ba la gnyis kas zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed dag gis so //

original: des zhes bya ba ni ltung ba byung bas de kun du spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni ltung ba byung bas de kun du spyad par bya'o //
translated: This is the meaning: One should use it slowly, slowly, until the bowl is broken.🔽 This is the meaning: One should use it slowly, slowly, until the bowl is broken.

original: 'di'i chad pa'i las ni 'di lta ste /🔽lhung bzed gzhan la dad pas gcod pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'di'i chad pa'i las ni 'di lta ste /🔽lhung bzed gzhan la dad pas gcod pa'i don du'o //
translated: This is the meaning: One should use it slowly

original: de la yo byad ches bzang po nges par sbyar bar bya'i zhes bya ba ni gang 'di tha chad 'di lta bu byung nas 'di la sbyin pa de la lhung bzed kyi snod dang kha g-yogs la sogs pa yo byad ches bzang po nges par sbyar bar bya
analyzed: de la yo byad ches bzang po nges par sbyar bar bya'i zhes bya ba ni gang 'di tha chad 'di lta bu byung nas 'di la sbyin pa de la lhung bzed kyi snod dang kha g-yogs la sogs pa yo byad ches bzang po nges par sbyar bar bya
translated: One should definitely apply the best equipment to it means that when this kind of inferior thing occurs, one should definitely apply the best equipment to it, such as a begging bowl and a cover.

original: ba'o // spyod pa ni ches yang ba'o zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms blang ba la sogs pa la nges par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ba'o // spyod pa ni ches yang ba'o zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms blang ba la sogs pa la nges par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The practice is very light means that one should definitely apply it to receiving alms and so on.

original: zas kyi bya ba nyid la ni mi bya ba kho na'o zhes bya ba ni zas bza' ba'i bya ba bsgrub pa nyid la ni 'di nges par sbyar bar mi bya ba kho na'o //
analyzed: zas kyi bya ba nyid la ni mi bya ba kho na'o zhes bya ba ni zas bza' ba'i bya ba bsgrub pa nyid la ni 'di nges par sbyar bar mi bya ba kho na'o //
translated: But one should not apply it to the very act of eating means that one should not definitely apply it to the very accomplishment of the act of eating food.

original: lhung bzed tshol ba'i spang ba'o /
analyzed: lhung bzed tshol ba'i spang ba'o /
translated: This is the prohibition against seeking a begging bowl.

original: // / gang du 'thag tu 'jug pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / gang du 'thag tu 'jug pa'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Where does the prohibition against having it woven become applicable?

original: @170b de'i phyir rin thang med par bsgo bas sam gzhan gyis kyang 'thag tu bcug na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: @170b de'i phyir rin thang med par bsgo bas sam gzhan gyis kyang 'thag tu bcug na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, If one orders it to be woven without value, or if another has it woven.

original: khyim pa nye du ma yin pa zhes bya ba sngar bstan pa'i rin thang med par ngag gis bsgo bas 'thag tu bcug na dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyim pa nye du ma yin pa zhes bya ba sngar bstan pa'i rin thang med par ngag gis bsgo bas 'thag tu bcug na dngos gzhi'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes a monk who is not a relative weave without paying the price as previously explained, one commits a downfall by the root verse.

original: rang gis bsgo ba gcig pur ma zad kyi 'on kyang pho nya la sogs pa gzhan gyis kyang 'thag tu bcug na dngos gzhi'i ltung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: rang gis bsgo ba gcig pur ma zad kyi 'on kyang pho nya la sogs pa gzhan gyis kyang 'thag tu bcug na dngos gzhi'i ltung ba kho na'o //
translated: Not only does one commit a downfall by oneself ordering the weaving, but also if one orders another messenger and so on to weave, one commits a root downfall.

original: phan tshun brgyud nas byed du bcug na na smad pa'i tshig la dmigs kyis bsal ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun brgyud nas byed du bcug na na smad pa'i tshig la dmigs kyis bsal ba'o //
translated: If one orders another to weave through a series of intermediaries, one commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: 'di gleng gzhi las 'di shes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di gleng gzhi las 'di shes pa yin te /
translated: This is understood from the nidana.

original: blangs pa'i skud pa nyid 'di la ma chog par spong ba ste /
analyzed: blangs pa'i skud pa nyid 'di la ma chog par spong ba ste /
translated: If the thread that one has obtained is insufficient, one may add more.

original: dge slong gis nye du la skud pa blangs nas tha ga pa nye du ma yin pa la 'thag tu bcug nas slong ba po de la ni ltung ba med la tha ga pa nye du ma yin pa la 'thag tu bcug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed
analyzed: dge slong gis nye du la skud pa blangs nas tha ga pa nye du ma yin pa la 'thag tu bcug nas slong ba po de la ni ltung ba med la tha ga pa nye du ma yin pa la 'thag tu bcug pa ni spang ba'i ltung byed
translated: If a monk obtains thread from a relative and has a weaver who is not a relative weave it, there is no downfall for the monk who solicits, but there is a downfall of abandoning the robe for having a weaver who is not a relative weave it.

original: du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is stated in the Kṣudraka Collection.

original: gzhan nyid dang bcas pa la ni de la byas pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang lhan cig tu gang gis gang byed pa de ni des ma byas par gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan nyid dang bcas pa la ni de la byas pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang lhan cig tu gang gis gang byed pa de ni des ma byas par gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If it is together with another, it is not made by that. The meaning is: if someone makes something together with another, it is not the case that it is not made by that.

original: nye du dang nye du ma yin pa gnyis ka las 'thag tu bcug na yang nye du'i phyir ltung ba med kyi nye du ma yin pa'i dbang gis spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye du dang nye du ma yin pa gnyis ka las 'thag tu bcug na yang nye du'i phyir ltung ba med kyi nye du ma yin pa'i dbang gis spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro //
translated: If one has weaving done by both a relative and one who is not a relative, there is no offense due to the relative, but there is an offense of wrong conduct due to the one who is not a relative.

original: bdag nyid dang nye du ma yin par bcas pas bdag nyid la dgos pa nyid bya ba'i phyir dge slong bzo byed pa la nyes byas zhes bya ba gsungs pa gang yin pa de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid dang nye du ma yin par bcas pas bdag nyid la dgos pa nyid bya ba'i phyir dge slong bzo byed pa la nyes byas zhes bya ba gsungs pa gang yin pa de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This includes what was said about a monk who is a craftsman committing an offense of wrong conduct if he makes something for himself and not for a relative.

original: rin byin pa dang ma byin pa gnyis ka la 'thag tu bcug na yang cho ga 'di rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: rin byin pa dang ma byin pa gnyis ka la 'thag tu bcug na yang cho ga 'di rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: If one has weaving done by both those who give the price and those who do not, this rule is established.

original: 'di yang 'dis bye brag yongs su ma bzung ba'i phyir bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yang 'dis bye brag yongs su ma bzung ba'i phyir bsdus pa'o //
translated: This is also included because it does not specify any exceptions.

original: 'thag tu bcug pa'i spang ba'o /
analyzed: 'thag tu bcug pa'i spang ba'o /
translated: The branch of relinquishment of having it woven.

original: // / 'thag pa skyed pa dang 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i spang ba'i yan lag gang dag byed pa por gyur pa de dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / 'thag pa skyed pa dang 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i spang ba'i yan lag gang dag byed pa por gyur pa de dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the branches of relinquishment that cause the weaving to increase and expand?

original: de'i phyir btags par bya ba bsams pa las byung ba nyid do zhes te /
analyzed: de'i phyir btags par bya ba bsams pa las byung ba nyid do zhes te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The thought of what is to be designated arises.”

original: bsam pa dgos pa 'di la yod pas na sems pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dgos pa 'di la yod pas na sems pa'o //
translated: Since the purpose of thought exists in this, it is thought.

original: de'i dngos po sems pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po sems pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The state of that is arising from thought.

original: de'i zhes bya ba 'dis ni ltung ba bzung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba 'dis ni ltung ba bzung ba'o //
translated: By this “that,” the downfall is referred to.

original: kho lag che ba nyid dang 'bras bzang ba nyid la tha ga pa nges par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni ring ba ni 'di tsam zheng che ba ni 'di tsam zhes bya ba kho lag che ba nyid la 'di nges par sbyar bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: kho lag che ba nyid dang 'bras bzang ba nyid la tha ga pa nges par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni ring ba ni 'di tsam zheng che ba ni 'di tsam zhes bya ba kho lag che ba nyid la 'di nges par sbyar bar byas pa'o //
translated: “The weaver must be engaged to make the cloth of such length and width and of such good quality” means that the weaver must be engaged to make the cloth of such length and such width.

original: gos gzhan 'dod pa ma yin pa la sbyin pa pos don gyis bsgrub pa'o //
