original: 'dir gzhan byed du 'jug pa 'am byas pa las bye brag ces bya ba 'di brjod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhan byed du 'jug pa 'am byas pa las bye brag ces bya ba 'di brjod pa'o //
translated: The phrase “that is included in his or her own continuum or that is separate from it” is a reference to the phrase “that is included in his or her own continuum or that is separate from it” that occurs earlier in this section.

original: 'dir kha na ma tho ba ji lta bu gang gi phyir byed pa pa dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir kha na ma tho ba ji lta bu gang gi phyir byed pa pa dag yin zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of the offense that is incurred by an agent in this case?

original: de'i phyir lus las tha dad pa'i dngos por gyur pa mthar thug pa na mtha'i'o //🔽sbyor ba la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes @172b bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus las tha dad pa'i dngos por gyur pa mthar thug pa na mtha'i'o //🔽sbyor ba la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes @172b bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase “that is included in his or her own continuum or that is separate from it” refers to the final form of the object that is the basis of the offense.🔽The phrase “that is included in his or her own continuum or that is separate from it” is a reference to the phrase “that is included in his or her own continuum or that is separate from it” that occurs earlier in this section.🔽The phrase “that is included in his or her own continuum or that is separate from it” is a reference to the phrase “that is included in his or her own continuum or that is separate from it” that occurs earlier in this section.

original: 'dir dbral bar bya ba bstan pa gang yin pa de'i lus gang yin pa de las tha dad pa'i mthar thug pa la dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: 'dir dbral bar bya ba bstan pa gang yin pa de'i lus gang yin pa de las tha dad pa'i mthar thug pa la dngos gzhi'o //
translated: Here, the body from which that which is to be separated is taught is the ultimate separate from that.

original: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyor ba la ni nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the preparation, it is a minor offense.

original: de'i phyir sbyin par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sbyin par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is to be given.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni dbrog pa de'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni dbrog pa de'o //
translated: Here, that refers to the taking.

original: 'dir ni 'ju bar 'os pa nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'ju bar 'os pa nyid ma yin te zhes bya ba ni gnyis ka bstan pa'o //
translated: Here, it is not suitable to take, this teaches both.

original: 'dir gzhung ni lhag ma yod pa thams cad slar byin ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni lhag ma yod pa thams cad slar byin ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says give back all that remains.

original: 'di la rang gi don nyid yan lag ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir dge slong la bral ba tsam ni gtso bo ste bdag tu bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la rang gi don nyid yan lag ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dir dge slong la bral ba tsam ni gtso bo ste bdag tu bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, mere separation from the monk is primary, not making it one's own.

original: rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don du zhes bya ba khyad par la mi bsten pa'i dbrog pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don du zhes bya ba khyad par la mi bsten pa'i dbrog pa'o //
translated: Taking without relying on the distinction of one's own purpose and another's purpose.

original: de bas na gzhan nges par sbyor bas bral ba la 'dir dngos gzhi'i kha nam tho ba nyid ces bya ba gsungs pa yin no //🔽rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa la ni skrod pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir skabs ma yin zhes bya bas 'dir zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di la ;
analyzed: de bas na gzhan nges par sbyor bas bral ba la 'dir dngos gzhi'i kha nam tho ba nyid ces bya ba gsungs pa yin no // rdzogs par ma bsnyen pa la ni skrod pa dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir skabs ma yin zhes bya bas 'dir zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di la ;
translated: Therefore, it is called the actual basis of expulsion, since one is definitely expelled from the community.🔽For one who has not been fully admitted, it is like expulsion.

original: 'di zhes bya ba yongs su gyur pa la 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba yongs su gyur pa la 'brel pa'o //
translated: Since this is not the proper occasion, the word here is connected with the transformation of this.

original: 'di skrod pa ni dper na gtsug lag khang nas skrod pa la dge slong ma la sogs pa rnams la skrod par byed pa nyid dang bskrad par bya ba nyid la nyes byas su gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di skrod pa ni dper na gtsug lag khang nas skrod pa la dge slong ma la sogs pa rnams la skrod par byed pa nyid dang bskrad par bya ba nyid la nyes byas su gsungs so //
translated: This expulsion is like the expulsion from the monastery, where it is said that nuns and so on who expel or are expelled commit an offense of wrong conduct.🔽And householders who expel them increase their nonmeritorious action.

original: khyim pa rnams kyang skrod par byed pa ni bsod nams ma yin pa mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di yang 'di rnams la kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyim pa rnams kyang skrod par byed pa ni bsod nams ma yin pa mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di yang 'di rnams la kha na ma tho ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement that this is a fault for them.

original: de ltar yang 'dir dge slong ma la sogs pa rnams la dbrog pa nyid la gzhung ni dge slong ma dang dge tshul dang dge tshul mas ni nyes byas kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'dir dge slong ma la sogs pa rnams la dbrog pa nyid la gzhung ni dge slong ma dang dge tshul dang dge tshul mas ni nyes byas kyi ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in this case, the text says that a nun and so on who steals from a nun and so on commits a heinous act.

original: khyim pa dang khyim pa mos ni bsod nams ma yin pa mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim pa dang khyim pa mos ni bsod nams ma yin pa mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: A layperson and a laypersoness who steals from a layperson and so on generate much demerit.

original: 'phrog pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /🔽rang gi nyid sel bar gyur pa dang gzhan ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'phrog pa ni rnam pa gsum ste / rang gi nyid sel bar gyur pa dang gzhan ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Stealing is of three types:🔽from a superior, from an equal, and from an inferior.

original: blo gros ngan pas byas pa dang / rigs don gyi dbang du byas pa'o //🔽de la blo gros ngan pa ni blo gros 'de ni legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: blo gros ngan pas byas pa dang / rigs don gyi dbang du byas pa'o // de la blo gros ngan pa ni blo gros 'de ni legs pa ma yin te /
translated: The first is done by one of evil mind, the second by one of evil views.🔽One of evil mind is one who is not of good mind, not of excellent mind, not of superior mind, and not of elevated mind.

original: mchog ma yin pa dang lhag pa'i chos su gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mchog ma yin pa dang lhag pa'i chos su gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: One of evil views is one who does not have the view that it is not good, that it is not inferior, and that it is not a superior Dharma.

original: de ltar gang zhig grangs su 'gro ba des so //
analyzed: de ltar gang zhig grangs su 'gro ba des so //
translated: Thus, one who goes to the number of these commits a heinous act.

original: 'de lta ste yi chad par gyur cig / gnod par gyur cig / mthu brtan par gyur cig / stobs nye bar gnas par gyur cig ces 'dis 'di bya ste sbyin par bya'o @173a * //🔽zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: 'de lta ste yi chad par gyur cig / gnod par gyur cig / mthu brtan par gyur cig / stobs nye bar gnas par gyur cig ces 'dis 'di bya ste sbyin par bya'o @173a * // zhes bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: Thus, he should give this to him.

original: de la ci thams cad rnam pa gsum po 'dir rtogs par bya ba 'am 'on te thams cad ma yin /
analyzed: de la ci thams cad rnam pa gsum po 'dir rtogs par bya ba 'am 'on te thams cad ma yin /
translated: Here, is everything to be understood in these three ways, or is not everything?

original: gang du 'dir ci zhig rtogs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang du 'dir ci zhig rtogs par bya zhe na /
translated: Where is this here to be understood?

original: de'i phyir 'di nyid brjod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di nyid brjod par bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, this should be stated:

original: de'i phyir rang gi nyid sel bar gyur pa'i 'phrog pa 'dir bsdus pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi nyid sel bar gyur pa'i 'phrog pa 'dir bsdus pa yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the removal of one's own is included here in the taking away.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba bslab pa'i gzhi la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba bslab pa'i gzhi la'o //
translated: Here refers to the bases of training.

original: dbral bar bya ba'i chos gos kyi tha ma las de bsal bar gyur pa 'dir 'phrog pa bzung ba gang yin pa de'i don du 'jug pa la 'dir sbyor ba la nyes byas su brjod do //
analyzed: dbral bar bya ba'i chos gos kyi tha ma las de bsal bar gyur pa 'dir 'phrog pa bzung ba gang yin pa de'i don du 'jug pa la 'dir sbyor ba la nyes byas su brjod do //
translated: The removal of that which is to be removed from the end of the robe is included here in the taking away. For the sake of that which is grasped, the application here is stated as a fault.

original: mthar ni dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mthar ni dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the end, it is the actual basis. This is the meaning.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gos 'o na cig khyod la mi sbyin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gos 'o na cig khyod la mi sbyin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the text is: “Monks, I will not give it to you.”

original: blo gros ngan pas byas pa ni rjes su 'phrod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yi chad par gyur cig ces bya ba blo gros ngan pas 'phrogs pa gang yin pa byed par gyur pa ni rjes su 'phrod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: blo gros ngan pas byas pa ni rjes su 'phrod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yi chad par gyur cig ces bya ba blo gros ngan pas 'phrogs pa gang yin pa byed par gyur pa ni rjes su 'phrod pa nyid yin no //
translated: “The one who is carried away by bad thoughts is in agreement with the deed” means that the one who is carried away by bad thoughts, “May I be disappointed,” is in agreement with the deed.

original: rjes su 'phrod pa nyid kyi phyir 'dir nyes byas rtogs par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rjes su 'phrod pa nyid kyi phyir 'dir nyes byas rtogs par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Because of being in agreement, here the offense is understood.

original: gnod pa dang mi phan par byed pa la 'jug pa'i gegs bya ba'i phyir ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa'i phyir 'jug pa las te /
analyzed: gnod pa dang mi phan par byed pa la 'jug pa'i gegs bya ba'i phyir ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pa'i phyir 'jug pa las te /
translated: “There is no offense if one engages in harming and not benefiting in order to prevent harm” means that there is no offense if one engages in harming in order to prevent harm.

original: mi phan par byed pa'i phyir ram gegs bya ba'i phyir 'phrog pa la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: mi phan par byed pa'i phyir ram gegs bya ba'i phyir 'phrog pa la ltung ba med do //
translated: There is no offense if one steals in order to not benefit or in order to prevent.

original: 'dir gzhung ni don gzhan dang 'dul ba'i yo byad kyi phyir ni ltung ba med pa'i tshig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni don gzhan dang 'dul ba'i yo byad kyi phyir ni ltung ba med pa'i tshig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Here the text is: “There is no offense if it is for the sake of another meaning or for the sake of the requisites of the Vinaya.”

original: gnyis po 'di las gzhan du ltung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis po 'di las gzhan du ltung ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One falls from these two.

original: 'phrog pa'i spang ba'o /
analyzed: 'phrog pa'i spang ba'o /
translated: The rule about the robe in the wilderness🔽The rule about the robe in the wilderness is that one should have only one robe.🔽If one is in a village, one’s dwelling is like the wilderness.

original: // / dgon pa pa'i chos gos gcig la ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na grong yang rang gi gnas dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni dgon pa ni 'dir gnas te zhes bya ba ni dgon pa pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: // / dgon pa pa'i chos gos gcig la ni 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na grong yang rang gi gnas dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni dgon pa ni 'dir gnas te zhes bya ba ni dgon pa pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis rtogs pa'o //
translated: The term “wilderness dweller” is understood to mean “one who dwells in the wilderness.”

original: 'dir lor ma tshang ba nyid ni 'di'i bye brag tu byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dir lor ma tshang ba nyid ni 'di'i bye brag tu byung ba yin no //
translated: Here, the fact that one is not complete for one year is a specific condition.

original: rnam par 'byed pa las kyang 'di'i don gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa las kyang 'di'i don gsungs te /
translated: The Exposition also explains the meaning of this:

original: lo phyi ma la nye bar 'brel par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lo phyi ma la nye bar 'brel par 'gyur te /
translated: “One is connected to the following year.

original: de ni 'dir rten pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'dir rten pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not the basis here.

original: gang gi phyir 'di la ltung ba bstan pa'i gnas skabs su yang dag par brten pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di la ltung ba bstan pa'i gnas skabs su yang dag par brten pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Because in the situation of teaching the downfall, there is no basis here.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir de bzung zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir de bzung zhe na /
translated: But why is it accepted?

original: gleng gzhi'i dbang gis skabs ma yin par gyur pa'i don rnams la yang bzung ba rnams yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gleng gzhi'i dbang gis skabs ma yin par gyur pa'i don rnams la yang bzung ba rnams yod par 'gyur te /
translated: And also those that are not the occasion, but are mentioned in the nidana, are to be taken as existing.

original: 'di lta ste dper na rang gis blangs pa'i skud pa'i zhes bya ba dang gcig tu gos zhes bya ba gang gi phyir der 'bral pa'i nyes pa @173b bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na rang gis blangs pa'i skud pa'i zhes bya ba dang gcig tu gos zhes bya ba gang gi phyir der 'bral pa'i nyes pa @173b bskyed pa'o //
translated: For example, “the thread that one has taken up” and “the cloth” are mentioned in the nidana, and the fault of separation is generated by them.

original: chos gos gcig la ni zhes bya ba gang gi phyir der 'bral ba'i nyes pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: chos gos gcig la ni zhes bya ba gang gi phyir der 'bral ba'i nyes pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: “One robe” is mentioned in the nidana, and the fault of separation is generated by it.

original: grong zhes ba ni gang zhig dgon pa de'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i zhes bya ba shugs kyis rtogs pa'o //🔽'dir gzhung ni de bas na chos gos gsum las gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: grong zhes ba ni gang zhig dgon pa de'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i zhes bya ba shugs kyis rtogs pa'o // 'dir gzhung ni de bas na chos gos gsum las gang yang rung ste /
translated: “The village” is mentioned in the nidana, and the fault of separation is generated by it.🔽The text here is: “Therefore, one of the three robes should be left in the house.”

original: chos gos khyim gyi nang du gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: chos gos khyim gyi nang du gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The three robes are mentioned in the nidana, and the fault of separation is generated by them.

original: don gyi dbang gis grong gzhan du 'dug pa de las zhag drug tshun chad du dbral bar bya'o zhes bya ba la 'dir dbral par bya ba ni 'dug pa'i gnas dang / grong de'i phyi rol gyi nyen kor du skya rengs shar ba'o //
analyzed: don gyi dbang gis grong gzhan du 'dug pa de las zhag drug tshun chad du dbral bar bya'o zhes bya ba la 'dir dbral par bya ba ni 'dug pa'i gnas dang / grong de'i phyi rol gyi nyen kor du skya rengs shar ba'o //
translated: Here, “to separate” means to leave the place where he is staying and to go to the outskirts of that village at dawn.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni chos gos gcig las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni chos gos gcig las so //
translated: “From that” means from one robe.

original: des zhes bya ba ni dgon pa pa ste /
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni dgon pa pa ste /
translated: “By that” means by the wilderness dweller.

original: gang zhig 'di'i grong du brjod pa 'di la de rnam pa gzhan gyis grong khyer gzhan du 'dug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di'i grong du brjod pa 'di la de rnam pa gzhan gyis grong khyer gzhan du 'dug pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “In that” means in the village that is mentioned. The meaning is: he should stay in another village in a different way.

original: skyabs dang bcas pa nyid dang dben pa'i gnas yongs su bzung ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: skyabs dang bcas pa nyid dang dben pa'i gnas yongs su bzung ba'i don du'o //
translated: The purpose is to show that he has a refuge and to show that he has taken possession of a solitary place.

original: don gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don gyi dbang gis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Because of some business” means

original: chos dang ldan pa'i dgos pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i dgos pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: because of some necessary business that is in accordance with the Dharma.

original: zhag drug tshun chad ces bya ba ni nyin mtshan drug pa tshun chad du'o //
analyzed: zhag drug tshun chad ces bya ba ni nyin mtshan drug pa tshun chad du'o //
translated: “For six days at the most” means for six days and nights at the most.

original: lhag pa la ni bag yangs med do zhes bya ba ni zhag drug pa las lhag pa 'dir bral ba'i cho ga la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lhag pa la ni bag yangs med do zhes bya ba ni zhag drug pa las lhag pa 'dir bral ba'i cho ga la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no relaxation in the rest, means that beyond the sixth day, one enters into the rite of separation.

original: bag yangs kyi dbang gis dus thams cad du 'dir nyes pa dang bral ba nyid du nges pa la 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: bag yangs kyi dbang gis dus thams cad du 'dir nyes pa dang bral ba nyid du nges pa la 'di gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in order to ascertain that there is no fault in this relaxation at all times.

original: de'i phyir 'di la bslab pa'i gzhi khongs su bsdu ba nyid kyis bgrang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la bslab pa'i gzhi khongs su bsdu ba nyid kyis bgrang ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is counted as included in the training precept.

original: 'di la ni de'i phyogs gcig tu gyur ba nyid do //🔽bar chad kyi dbang gis ma 'ongs pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di la ni de'i phyogs gcig tu gyur ba nyid do // bar chad kyi dbang gis ma 'ongs pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: But here, it is only a part of that.

original: bar chad kyi dbang gis ma 'ongs pa la lhag par yang bag yangs dang bral ba'i cho ga las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bar chad kyi dbang gis ma 'ongs pa la lhag par yang bag yangs dang bral ba'i cho ga las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: There is no fault in the future due to the power of an obstruction, means that due to the power of an obstruction, in the future, one enters into the rite of separation.🔽This is stated in order to ascertain that there is no fault in this relaxation at all times.

original: 'dir btsun pa dge slong dgon pa bas grong gzhan du chos gos bzhag ste bgyi ba 'ga' zhig gi slad du mtshams kyi slad rol du mchi zhing de nyid du slar bzlog par bgyi'o snyam pa las gal te de la bar chad 'ga' zhig byung nas slar mchi
analyzed: 'dir btsun pa dge slong dgon pa bas grong gzhan du chos gos bzhag ste bgyi ba 'ga' zhig gi slad du mtshams kyi slad rol du mchi zhing de nyid du slar bzlog par bgyi'o snyam pa las gal te de la bar chad 'ga' zhig byung nas slar mchi
translated: Here, Venerable Bhikṣu Aḍakodara, having placed his Dharma robes in another village, goes outside the boundary for some purpose, thinking, “I will return right there.” If an obstacle arises and he is unable to return,

original: bar rngo ma thogs na chos gos de dang 'bral zhes bgyi ba lags sam /
analyzed: bar rngo ma thogs na chos gos de dang 'bral zhes bgyi ba lags sam /
translated: is that considered separation from the Dharma robes?

original: nye ba 'khor mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nye ba 'khor mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Upāli, it is not.”

original: kha cig 'di ltar rnam par rtog ste dge slong dag gis zhag drug phyi rol du 'gro bar bya'o snyam du brnag pa sngon du byas te phyi rol du 'gro zhing zhag las 'das pa la ni 'bral ba'i nyes pa med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: kha cig 'di ltar rnam par rtog ste dge slong dag gis zhag drug phyi rol du 'gro bar bya'o snyam du brnag pa sngon du byas te phyi rol du 'gro zhing zhag las 'das pa la ni 'bral ba'i nyes pa med pa yin gyi /
translated: Some imagine it this way: Bhikṣus, having made the prior resolution, “We will go outside for six nights,” go outside and there is no fault of separation for exceeding the nights.
However,

original: te de ltar brnag pa ma byas par nyin gcig gam mtshan gcig 'gro bar brnags te song ba las zhag drug 'das pa de la ni nyes pa kho nar 'gyur snyam du rtog pa dag yong pas de bsal ba'i phyir 'dir zhag drug tu 'gro ba ha cang🔽thal pa nyid la ni brnag pa yan lag ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: te de ltar brnag pa ma byas par nyin gcig gam mtshan gcig 'gro bar brnags te song ba las zhag drug 'das pa de la ni nyes pa kho nar 'gyur snyam du rtog pa dag yong pas de bsal ba'i phyir 'dir zhag drug tu 'gro ba ha cang thal pa nyid la ni brnag pa yan lag ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: Since such thoughts arise, in order to dispel them, the text says, “If one goes for six days, it is not an offense to not make a commitment.”🔽Here, if one makes a commitment to go for six days and then stays away for six days, there is no offense.

original: 'dir zhag drug tu 'gro ba'i dus de la brnag pa byas nas zhag drug 'bral bar gyur pa la nyes pa med ces bya ba ni 'dir rnam par gzhag pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir zhag drug tu 'gro ba'i dus de la brnag pa byas nas zhag drug 'bral bar gyur pa la nyes pa med ces bya ba ni 'dir rnam par gzhag pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not a rule here,

original: ji ltar yang rung bar 'gro ba la nyes pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar yang rung bar 'gro ba la nyes pa med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: but it means that there is no offense if one goes for any length of time.

original: zhag drug na 'bral ba'i spang ba'o /
analyzed: zhag drug na 'bral ba'i spang ba'o /
translated: The rejection of separation for six days.

original: // / bdag nyid gnas par khas blangs pas khas blangs pa'i nyin mo'i zla ba snga ma'i dang po tshun cad nas dbyar gyi ras chen pa btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang 'di'i ltung ba khas blangs pa'i nyin mo ni khas blangs pa'i zhag gang zhig 'dis🔽nye bar 'khor ba'i phyir snga ma'am phyi ma 'am mngon par 'dod pa'i nyi ma'o //
analyzed: // / bdag nyid gnas par khas blangs pas khas blangs pa'i nyin mo'i zla ba snga ma'i dang po tshun cad nas dbyar gyi ras chen pa btsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang 'di'i ltung ba khas blangs pa'i nyin mo ni khas blangs pa'i zhag gang zhig 'dis nye bar 'khor ba'i phyir snga ma'am phyi ma 'am mngon par 'dod pa'i nyi ma'o //
translated: The phrase from the first day of the former month of the rainy season means that the monk who has accepted the rainy season practice should seek out the large robe from the first day of the month in which he accepted the rainy season practice.🔽The first day of the month is the day on which he accepted the rainy season practice.🔽The former month of the rainy season is the month prior to the month in which he accepted the rainy season practice.

original: de'i snga mar gyur pa'i zla ba gang yin pa de'i dang po gang zhig de dang por byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i snga mar gyur pa'i zla ba gang yin pa de'i dang po gang zhig de dang por byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The first day of that month is the first day of the month of the rainy season.

original: dbyar gnas pa'i zla ba phyed kyi mthar de gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbyar gnas pa'i zla ba phyed kyi mthar de gzung bar bya'o //
translated: The monk should seek out the large robe at the end of the first half of the rainy season.

original: rang gi snga ma 'am phyi ma khas blangs pa'i dbang gis 'di'i dbyar gnas pa'i gang zhig rnam par gnas pa de rnams las lhag par gyur pa'i zla ba phyed gang yin pa de'i tha ma'i dus kyi bar 'dzin par zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽grub pa'i skad cig ma tshun chad nas don gyis go ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi snga ma 'am phyi ma khas blangs pa'i dbang gis 'di'i dbyar gnas pa'i gang zhig rnam par gnas pa de rnams las lhag par gyur pa'i zla ba phyed gang yin pa de'i tha ma'i dus kyi bar 'dzin par zhes bya ba'i don to // grub pa'i skad cig ma tshun chad nas don gyis go ba'o //
translated: The meaning of holding is that they hold the last month of the rainy season, which is the month that exceeds the rainy season that they have undertaken or will undertake.🔽The meaning of until dawn is that they hold it until the end of the night, because it is understood by implication that it is completed in an instant.

original: skya rengs shar ba ni nyin mo la sogs pa'i par ro //
analyzed: skya rengs shar ba ni nyin mo la sogs pa'i par ro //
translated: The meaning of until dawn is that they hold it until the end of the night, because it is understood by implication that it is completed in an instant.

original: de bas na tshes bcu drug la skya rengs shar ba la 'dri ltung byed do //
analyzed: de bas na tshes bcu drug la skya rengs shar ba la 'dri ltung byed do //
translated: Therefore, if the dawn breaks while they are still not finished, they commit a downfall.

original: dbyar gyi ras chen rnams 'dir bzung ba ste /
analyzed: dbyar gyi ras chen rnams 'dir bzung ba ste /
translated: The rainy season robes are held at this time,

original: lo dus rnams la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi sgras rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: lo dus rnams la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni rang gi sgras rtogs par bya'o //
translated: but not at other times of the year. This is understood from the text itself.

original: 'dir mdo ni zla ba phyed kyis lhag par dbyar gnas pa rnams kyis bya ste bcang bar bya zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir mdo ni zla ba phyed kyis lhag par dbyar gnas pa rnams kyis bya ste bcang bar bya zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Here, the sutra says, Those who have stayed for the rainy season for more than a month should hold it.

original: 'di'i rnam par 'byed pa ni zla ba phyed dgos pa zhes bya ba dbyar gnas byas te zla ba phyed kyi lhag ma ni lhag par gyur pa 'chang ba'i dus na bcang bar bya zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig 'di la don 'di'o //
analyzed: 'di'i rnam par 'byed pa ni zla ba phyed dgos pa zhes bya ba dbyar gnas byas te zla ba phyed kyi lhag ma ni lhag par gyur pa 'chang ba'i dus na bcang bar bya zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig 'di la don 'di'o //
translated: ” The remaining half month of the rainy season retreat is the time for keeping the extra robe.

original: yi ge kha cig las 'di shin tu bsal bar brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: yi ge kha cig las 'di shin tu bsal bar brjod pa yin te /
translated: Some texts state that this is a very clear explanation.

original: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dbyar gyi gos ras chen rung ba ma yin pa 'chang bar byed de /
analyzed: btsun pa re zhig dge slong gis dbyar gyi gos ras chen rung ba ma yin pa 'chang bar byed de /
translated: “Venerable, if a monk keeps an improper rainy season robe,

original: lhag ma zla ba phyed dang lnga las lhag na ci ltung bar 'gyur ram nyes byas @174b su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽don ma yin pa la yang 'di ltar dus su 'chang ba skyed par 'gyur ba 'di ni mi rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lhag ma zla ba phyed dang lnga las lhag na ci ltung bar 'gyur ram nyes byas @174b su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // don ma yin pa la yang 'di ltar dus su 'chang ba skyed par 'gyur ba 'di ni mi rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: what is the offense if he keeps it for more than the remaining half month of the rainy season?” The meaning is that it is a minor offense.🔽It is not unreasonable to say that this is the time for keeping an extra robe, even though it is not the proper time.

original: gang gi phyir 'di myur ba zhes bya ba nyid du 'jug par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di myur ba zhes bya ba nyid du 'jug par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not reasonable to say that this is the time for keeping an extra robe, even though it is not the proper time.

original: gang zhig cho ga 'di las 'da' bar byed pa la kha na ma tho ba de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: gang zhig cho ga 'di las 'da' bar byed pa la kha na ma tho ba de bstan par bya ste /
translated: The offense that is incurred by transgressing this rule will be explained.

original: de'i phyir sngon dang phyi ma gnyis las de ma yin pa'i dus ni byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon dang phyi ma gnyis las de ma yin pa'i dus ni byed pa po nyid do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “The agent of the offense is the one who does not do it at the proper time, either before or after.”

original: btsal ba'i dus dang bcas pa ji ltar bstan pa las snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus de dag gi dus ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: btsal ba'i dus dang bcas pa ji ltar bstan pa las snga ma dang phyi ma'i dus de dag gi dus ltung ba'i byed pa po nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The proper time is the time for searching. The agent of the offense is the one who does not do it at the proper time, either before or after.

original: gang du phyi ma la byed pa po nyid gang du snga ma la yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang du phyi ma la byed pa po nyid gang du snga ma la yin zhe na /
translated: Where is one the agent of the offense in the future? Where is one the agent in the past?

original: de'i phyir gzhan du 'chang ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /🔽rigs pa las ma 'das pa'i 'chang ba'i dus las gzhan pa'i dus te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan du 'chang ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te / rigs pa las ma 'das pa'i 'chang ba'i dus las gzhan pa'i dus te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “The agent of the offense is the one who keeps it at another time.”

original: de 'chang ba yod pa la dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
analyzed: de 'chang ba yod pa la dngos gzhi'i kha na ma tho ba'i byed pa po nyid yin no //
translated: The time for keeping is not beyond reason. The agent of the offense is the one who keeps it at another time, that is, at a time other than the time for keeping.

original: sngar btsal ba la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba ni btsal ba'i dus sngar bstan pa bas gang zhig gzhan ni dus te ;
analyzed: sngar btsal ba la ni nyes byas kyi'o zhes bya ba ni btsal ba'i dus sngar bstan pa bas gang zhig gzhan ni dus te ;
translated: the latter is the time.

original: de btsal na btsal ba tsam la nyes byas 'di la byed pa po nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de btsal na btsal ba tsam la nyes byas 'di la byed pa po nyid ma yin no //
translated: If one searches for it at that time, there is a misdeed for merely searching, but not for the one who is the agent.

original: da ni dngos gzhi la du yin zhe na /
analyzed: da ni dngos gzhi la du yin zhe na /
translated: Now, what is the actual basis?

original: de'i phyir grub na mtha'i'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir grub na mtha'i'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “if it is established, it is the end.”

original: gang gi tshe btsal bar gyur pa la de grub par gyur na de'i tshe dngos gzhi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe btsal bar gyur pa la de grub par gyur na de'i tshe dngos gzhi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When it becomes established that it was searched for, at that time it is called the actual basis.🔽There is no fault for an old blanket.

original: rnyang rnying la ni na smad pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
analyzed: rnyang rnying la ni na smad pa med do zhes bya ba ni 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las /
translated: Here the text of the questions and answers is:

original: dbyar gyi gos ras chen rnyang rnying du gyur pa zhig zla ba phyed dang lnga las lhag par 'chad na nyes byas so //
analyzed: dbyar gyi gos ras chen rnyang rnying du gyur pa zhig zla ba phyed dang lnga las lhag par 'chad na nyes byas so //
translated: If one keeps an old blanket for the rainy season for more than five and a half months, it is a misdeed.

original: de bzhin du dbyar gyi gos ras chen bug rdol du gyur pa zhig ha cad ma tshogs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyar gyi gos ras chen bug rdol du gyur pa zhig ha cad ma tshogs te /
translated: Similarly, if one keeps a blanket with a hole for the rainy season, it is a misdeed.

original: tshol bar byed na yang nyes byas so zhes bya so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: tshol bar byed na yang nyes byas so zhes bya so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one searches for it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: de'i rjes su 'gro ba ni khas blangs pa ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba khas blangs pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang 'brel pa la gang cung zad de thams cad ni khas blangs pa ji lta bur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'gro ba ni khas blangs pa ji lta ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba khas blangs pa ni rjes su 'gro ba dang 'brel pa la gang cung zad de thams cad ni khas blangs pa ji lta bur rig par bya'o //
translated: Following it is as promised means that if one promises to follow it, then whatever one promises, one should know that all of it is to be followed.

original: gal te sngar khas len na de'i dbang gis de nas de'i phyi ma'o //
analyzed: gal te sngar khas len na de'i dbang gis de nas de'i phyi ma'o //
translated: If one promises it previously, then later it is the latter by the power of that.

original: 'di lta ste mtha'i zhag bcu la brtad pa las byung ba'i gos blangs so snyam pa'i zhag bcu pa la phyi ma nyid nyes pa ma yin pa'i 'byung gnas nyid du gyur pa dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyis dbyar gnas par bya ba'i tshad la ltos nas dgag🔽dbye dang sra brkyang 'ding pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mtha'i zhag bcu la brtad pa las byung ba'i gos blangs so snyam pa'i zhag bcu pa la phyi ma nyid nyes pa ma yin pa'i 'byung gnas nyid du gyur pa dbyar gyi gos ras chen gyis dbyar gnas par bya ba'i tshad la ltos nas dgag dbye dang sra brkyang 'ding pa'o //
translated: For example, if one thinks, I will take cloth arising from the urgency of the ten day limit, then the latter is not a fault, but the source of nonfault is the rainy season cloth, which is the measure of abiding in the rains.🔽The chapter on the rainy season cloth has three sections:

original: dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang ba'o /
analyzed: dbyar gyi ras chen gyi spang ba'o /
translated: 1) the rainy season cloth,🔽2) the benefits of the rainy season cloth,🔽and 3) the relinquishment of the rainy season cloth.

original: // / brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba la don @175a * //
analyzed: // / brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba la don @175a * //
translated: The offense that arises from agitation.

original: gang zhig byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhig byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: What is the agent?

original: de'i phyir dbyar gyi rnyed pa ni byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyar gyi rnyed pa ni byed pa po nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “The agent is the one who obtains the summer rains.”

original: dbyar gnas pa'i phyir rnyed pa gang yin pa la ste /
analyzed: dbyar gnas pa'i phyir rnyed pa gang yin pa la ste /
translated: The one who obtains the summer rains is the agent.

original: gzhan dbyar gyi rnyed pa la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dbyar gyi rnyed pa la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is not the one who obtains the summer rains.

original: 'di'i byed pa po nyid gang du yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di'i byed pa po nyid gang du yin zhe na /
translated: Where is the agent?🔽Therefore it says, “If one appropriates it during the summer.”

original: de'i phyir dbyar gyi nang logs su bdag gir byed na'o zhes bya ba smos te dbyar gnas par bya ba'i nang rol du bdag gir byed na'o zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyar gyi nang logs su bdag gir byed na'o zhes bya ba smos te dbyar gnas par bya ba'i nang rol du bdag gir byed na'o zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: The meaning is that if one appropriates it during the summer, when one is to abide in the rains retreat.

original: de la dmigs kyis bsal bar bya bar 'dod nas brtad pa'i dbang gis mtha' zhag bcu la rnyed pa ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la dmigs kyis bsal bar bya bar 'dod nas brtad pa'i dbang gis mtha' zhag bcu la rnyed pa ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to exclude that, it says, “Except for the ten days at the end, which are obtained through agitation.”

original: mtha'i zhag bcu la brtad pa tsam nye bar brtags pas byas pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mtha'i zhag bcu la brtad pa tsam nye bar brtags pas byas pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no fault in making a robe from cloth that is the equivalent of ten days at the most, if it is made in haste.🔽The five kinds of robe-cloth that arise from a transaction are: given to the sick, given for the sick, given at death, given for death, and given to one who is setting out on a journey.

original: brtad pa las byung ba'i gos lnga po nad pa la sbyin pa dang / nad pa'i phyir sbyin pa dang / 'chi ba la sbyin pa dang / 'chi ba'i phyir sbyin pa dang / 'gro bar chas pa la sbyin pa zhes bya ba brtag pa las byung ba lnga po rnams la 'dir bzung ngo zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni dpe tsam du rnam par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: brtad pa las byung ba'i gos lnga po nad pa la sbyin pa dang / nad pa'i phyir sbyin pa dang / 'chi ba la sbyin pa dang / 'chi ba'i phyir sbyin pa dang / 'gro bar chas pa la sbyin pa zhes bya ba brtag pa las byung ba lnga po rnams la 'dir bzung ngo zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de ni dpe tsam du rnam par gnas pa'o //
translated: The five kinds of robe-cloth that arise from a transaction are mentioned here, but they are only examples.

original: rgyal po dang chom rkun dang rigs rgyud dang chu la sogs pas khyer du dogs pa dang / yongs su zad pa khas blangs pa lta bu skyes pa'i zhag la sogs pa'i skbabs su blang bar byed pa po'i khongs su bsdus pa mchod gnas bgo skal la gtogs pa'i 'chir dogs pa la sogs pa dag kyang 'di rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: rgyal po dang chom rkun dang rigs rgyud dang chu la sogs pas khyer du dogs pa dang / yongs su zad pa khas blangs pa lta bu skyes pa'i zhag la sogs pa'i skbabs su blang bar byed pa po'i khongs su bsdus pa mchod gnas bgo skal la gtogs pa'i 'chir dogs pa la sogs pa dag kyang 'di rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: There is the fear of being carried off by kings, thieves, relatives, water, and so on, and the fear of death of those who are included in the category of those who take up the vow, such as those who have accepted complete exhaustion, those who have taken up the vow for a day and night, and so on, and those who are the objects of worship.

original: de bas na brtad pa tsam nye bar brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na brtad pa tsam nye bar brtags pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is merely a pretense.

original: de bgos na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni brtad pa'i dbang gis kyang rnyed par 'gyur ba lad byar gyi nang logs su bog na yang byed pa po nyid yin pa dang ; dbyar gyi rnyed pa gzhan gcig pu la ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bgos na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni brtad pa'i dbang gis kyang rnyed par 'gyur ba lad byar gyi nang logs su bog na yang byed pa po nyid yin pa dang ; dbyar gyi rnyed pa gzhan gcig pu la ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even if it is distributed, it is said that it is also obtained by the power of pretense. If it is distributed internally, it is the agent itself, and it is not just the summer gain of one person.

original: 'dir gzhung ni blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang gos 'gyed pa'i dus la ma bab kyi bar du chongs shig ces bya ba gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽'dir bgo bar mi bya ba'i tshig ni mngon par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni blang bar bya zhing blangs nas kyang gos 'gyed pa'i dus la ma bab kyi bar du chongs shig ces bya ba gsungs pa'i phyir ro // 'dir bgo bar mi bya ba'i tshig ni mngon par 'dod pa ste /
translated: Here, the text states, “You should accept this robe, and having accepted it, you should keep it until the time of the robe distribution.”

original: rnam par bgos pas ma yin zhes bya ba rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bgos pas ma yin zhes bya ba rtogs pa'o //
translated: Here, the phrase “you should not distribute” is understood to mean “you should not distribute it to yourself.”🔽The phrase “you should not distribute it” is understood to mean “you should not distribute it to yourself.”

original: brtad pa las byung ba'i dbyar gyi rnyed pa la dbyar gyi nang logs su bgo bar mi bya ba'i rnam pa la yang bdag tu spang ba'o //
analyzed: brtad pa las byung ba'i dbyar gyi rnyed pa la dbyar gyi nang logs su bgo bar mi bya ba'i rnam pa la yang bdag tu spang ba'o //
translated: Also, in the case of the summer retreat gift that arises from a challenge, it should not be distributed during the summer retreat.

original: brtad pa las byung ba'i bgo ba la yang bgo ba nyid do zhes bya ba 'dir rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: brtad pa las byung ba'i bgo ba la yang bgo ba nyid do zhes bya ba 'dir rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: In this case, the distribution itself is to be distributed.

original: gtsug lag khang gang dag na chos gos kyi zong nges @175b par gyur pa yod pa de la bsgrub pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gang dag na chos gos kyi zong nges @175b par gyur pa yod pa de la bsgrub pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: In the case of a monastery where the robe-cloth is definite, what is the procedure?

original: bzung ba nyid na de bdag tu bya ba nyid de mdun du bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bzung ba nyid na de bdag tu bya ba nyid de mdun du bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: When it is accepted, it is to be accepted by oneself, but it is not to be accepted by the community.

original: ma bgos na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni de zhes bya ba'i rjes su sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma bgos na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni de zhes bya ba'i rjes su sbyar ro //
translated: If not distributed, it is also said that it is the owner’s.

original: brtad pa'i dbang gis gzhan dbyar gyi bzung ba la ma bgos pa byed pa po nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brtad pa'i dbang gis gzhan dbyar gyi bzung ba la ma bgos pa byed pa po nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is the owner’s through the power of the announcement, but not distributed to others who entered the rains residence.

original: dngos gzhi bdag gir byed pa dang / 'god pa dang mi 'god pa rnams la byed pa po nyid 'dir brjod par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos gzhi bdag gir byed pa dang / 'god pa dang mi 'god pa rnams la byed pa po nyid 'dir brjod par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, it should be understood that the owner is described in terms of the actual basis, appropriation, and whether it is assigned or not assigned.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis dbyar gyi nan tshun chad du dbyar gyi rnyed la 'god par byed dam gos 'gyed par byed pa'i dus las 'das pa'i bar du 'chang bar byed na thams cad du spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong gis dbyar gyi nan tshun chad du dbyar gyi rnyed la 'god par byed dam gos 'gyed par byed pa'i dus las 'das pa'i bar du 'chang bar byed na thams cad du spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin
translated: Here, the text states: “If a monk assigns summer goods to be distributed or gives out robes before the end of the summer retreat and keeps them until the end of the period, it is a downfall that requires relinquishment in all cases.”

original: no // ma bgos na yang brtad pa las byung ba las gzhan la dbyar gyi nang rol dag tu ma byas pa la mdo'i gzhung yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: no // ma bgos na yang brtad pa las byung ba las gzhan la dbyar gyi nang rol dag tu ma byas pa la mdo'i gzhung yang rig par bya'o //
translated: If not distributed, it is also the owner’s in the case of other than that arising from the announcement. The text of the sūtra should be understood in this way.

original: ltung ba med pa rgyas par bshad pa yang brtad pa'i dbang gis zhag bcu'i mthar rnyed par gyur pa las 'di ltar blang bar bya ba nyid ces bya ba brjod pa'i phyir skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltung ba med pa rgyas par bshad pa yang brtad pa'i dbang gis zhag bcu'i mthar rnyed par gyur pa las 'di ltar blang bar bya ba nyid ces bya ba brjod pa'i phyir skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Also, the extensive explanation of the absence of downfalls would arise from the statement, “One should take it in this way,” because of the power of the request.

original: gzhan du na 'og nas rnyed par gyur pa las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na 'og nas rnyed par gyur pa las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Otherwise, it would say, “One should take it later.”

original: sbyin bdag gi tshig gis dbang med na'o zhes bya ba ni gal te sbyin bdag 'di skad ces re zhig khyed cag gis ma bgo zhig / bdag mchis nas rang gi lag nas 'bul lo zhes zer na /
analyzed: sbyin bdag gi tshig gis dbang med na'o zhes bya ba ni gal te sbyin bdag 'di skad ces re zhig khyed cag gis ma bgo zhig / bdag mchis nas rang gi lag nas 'bul lo zhes zer na /
translated: If one is powerless due to the words of the donor, if the donor says, “Do not distribute it for a while. I will give it with my own hand when I return,”

original: de'i dbang gis ma bgos na yang med ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis ma bgos na yang med ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: then, due to the power of that, if it is not distributed, it is not lost.

original: dus gang gi tshe ma bgos na zhe na /
analyzed: dus gang gi tshe ma bgos na zhe na /
translated: At what time is it not distributed?

original: de'i phyir dgag dbye'i nyin mo'i phyi de nyin par de sbed par ma bskos pa rnams la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dgag dbye'i nyin mo'i phyi de nyin par de sbed par ma bskos pa rnams la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “The next day after the invitation day, it is for those who are not appointed.”

original: dgag dbye'i nyin mo zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'i tshes bcu drug ste /
analyzed: dgag dbye'i nyin mo zhes bya ba ni de ma thag pa'i tshes bcu drug ste /
translated: The invitation day is the sixteenth day immediately following.

original: zla ba gsum gyi rjes la chos gos sred par byed pa ma bskos pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba gsum gyi rjes la chos gos sred par byed pa ma bskos pa'o //
translated: After three months, one who makes a robe out of cloth that is not assigned to him.

original: 'di rnams kyis ma bskos pa la gal te de dang 'brel pa'i kha na ma tho ba gang rnams kyis 'dod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyis ma bskos pa la gal te de dang 'brel pa'i kha na ma tho ba gang rnams kyis 'dod pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By these, if one who is not assigned to a robe commits any offense that is related to it, it is called “unacceptable.”

original: ji srid du gos 'gyed pa'i dus las 'das pa'i bar du bcang bar bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji srid du gos 'gyed pa'i dus las 'das pa'i bar du bcang bar bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said that one should keep it until the time of the distribution of robes.

original: de las lhag par 'chang bar byed na zhas bya ba ni 'dir mdo sde 'gyed pa'i dus las thob pa'i bar du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las lhag par 'chang bar byed na zhas bya ba ni 'dir mdo sde 'gyed pa'i dus las thob pa'i bar du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one keeps it beyond that, it is said that one should keep it until the time of the distribution of the sutras.

original: 'god pa'i dus thob pa ni zla ba gsum las 'das par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'god pa'i dus thob pa ni zla ba gsum las 'das par byed pa'o //
translated: The time of distribution is the time of the distribution of robes after three months.

original: zla ba gsum las gzhan pa'i dus ni 'god pa'i dus so //
analyzed: zla ba gsum las gzhan pa'i dus ni 'god pa'i dus so //
translated: The time other than three months is the time of distribution.

original: de ltar yang de'i rnam par 'byed pa las dge @176a * //
analyzed: de ltar yang de'i rnam par 'byed pa las dge @176a * //
translated: Thus, in its analysis, the Vinaya in Detail says:

original: slong gis gos 'ged pa'i dus dang skabs ma yin pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: slong gis gos 'ged pa'i dus dang skabs ma yin pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the time and occasion for a monk to distribute robes?

original: sra brkyang ma bting ba'i gnas na ni ston zla tha chungs kyi nya tshun chad do //
analyzed: sra brkyang ma bting ba'i gnas na ni ston zla tha chungs kyi nya tshun chad do //
translated: In a place where the robe season has not been entered, it is until the full moon of the last autumn month.

original: sra brkyang bting ba'i gnas na ni ston zla tha chungs nya phyin chad nas dpyid zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar te /
analyzed: sra brkyang bting ba'i gnas na ni ston zla tha chungs nya phyin chad nas dpyid zla 'bring po'i nya'i bar te /
translated: In a place where the robe season has been entered, it is from the day after the full moon of the last autumn month until the full moon of the middle month of spring.

original: de ni dge slong gi gos 'gyed pa'i dus ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni dge slong gi gos 'gyed pa'i dus ma yin no //
translated: That is not the time for a monk to distribute robes.

original: lhag ma'i dus zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa phyi ma shos nges par byas na ni ston zla chungs nya tshun chad do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: lhag ma'i dus zhes bya ba ni khas blangs pa phyi ma shos nges par byas na ni ston zla chungs nya tshun chad do zhes gsungs so //
translated: As for the time of the remainder, if the later acceptance is definitely made, it is until the full moon of the last autumn month.

original: khas blangs pa snga ma la ni ston zla 'bring po'i nya tshun chad dus ma yin no //
analyzed: khas blangs pa snga ma la ni ston zla 'bring po'i nya tshun chad dus ma yin no //
translated: In the earlier acceptance, it is not the time until the full moon of the middle month of autumn.

original: de ni mi bsko bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni brtad pa las byung ba'i dus su gtang bar bya ba nyid la gos sbed pa ma yin pa 'di bsam par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ni mi bsko bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni brtad pa las byung ba'i dus su gtang bar bya ba nyid la gos sbed pa ma yin pa 'di bsam par mi bya'o //
translated: This is not to be done without a committee.

original: zhu ba las bslab pa'i gzhi 'di la rim pa ni 'di yin no //
analyzed: zhu ba las bslab pa'i gzhi 'di la rim pa ni 'di yin no //
translated: This is the procedure for this training rule on begging.

original: rnam par 'byed pa las ni 'phrog pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi las ni de ma thag pa'o //🔽de las 'chang ba la 'chang ba'i rjes su 'brel pa'i rigs te zhes bya ba'i rim pa 'di ltar bstan pa'o //🔽brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba'o /
analyzed: rnam par 'byed pa las ni 'phrog pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi las ni de ma thag pa'o // de las 'chang ba la 'chang ba'i rjes su 'brel pa'i rigs te zhes bya ba'i rim pa 'di ltar bstan pa'o // brtad pa las byung ba'i spang ba'o /
translated: The basis of training that is to be relinquished through robbery is the immediate.🔽The system of the three vows is related to the vows of individual liberation.🔽The relinquishment of the vows of individual liberation is through the four causes of relinquishment.

original: // / ci zhig byas na bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / ci zhig byas na bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the relinquishment of that which is dedicated?

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyis gang zag gzhan rnam dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i gos shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur te thob na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyis gang zag gzhan rnam dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i gos shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur te thob na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says: If, knowingly, one dedicates to oneself that which was dedicated to the saṅgha by another person.

original: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa zhes bya ba 'di la mdo ltung ba rgyus par bshad pa la /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa zhes bya ba 'di la mdo ltung ba rgyus par bshad pa la /
translated: In the extensive explanation of the downfall in the sūtra on the four types of gifts,

original: gang zag gi yang bdag nyid la bsngos pas thob pa la dngos gzhir gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zag gi yang bdag nyid la bsngos pas thob pa la dngos gzhir gsungs so //
translated: it says that the relinquishment of the vows of individual liberation is through dedicating them to oneself.

original: dge slong gis gang zag gcig la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gang zag bdag nyid la sgyur bar byed pa de la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge slong gis gang zag gcig la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gang zag bdag nyid la sgyur bar byed pa de la nyes byas su 'gyur la /
translated: If a fully ordained monk dedicates to himself that which was dedicated to another person, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: thob na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thob na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya'o //
translated: If he obtains it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

original: de la dpe ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la dpe ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is an example:

original: skye ba'i dbang gis brten pa zhes bya ba 'dir rnam par bzhag pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi tshig go //
analyzed: skye ba'i dbang gis brten pa zhes bya ba 'dir rnam par bzhag pa'o zhes bya ba ni gang zag gi tshig go //
translated: “It is called ‘supported by birth’ because of the power of birth.” Here, the word “person” is used.

original: gang zag bdag nyid la gang zag yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang zag bdag nyid la gang zag yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: “The person himself is called a person.”

original: de bas na bye brag 'byed pa ni gang zag gzhan nam zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de bas na bye brag 'byed pa ni gang zag gzhan nam zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the distinction is made: “Is it another person?”

original: gang zhig 'di ltung ba 'byin par byed pa las gang zag gzhan la bsngos pa la ste de nyid la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di ltung ba 'byin par byed pa las gang zag gzhan la bsngos pa la ste de nyid la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the one who commits the offense, but the one to whom the robe is dedicated, not the one who is dedicated to.

original: rang gis bsngos pa la bdag nyid la bsngos pa ni 'ged pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gis bsngos pa la bdag nyid la bsngos pa ni 'ged pa ma yin no //
translated: “Dedicated to oneself” is not “dedicated to oneself.”

original: de la yang nyes byas su 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la yang nyes byas su 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, a minor offense would occur.

original: de bas na gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'i khyad par te /
analyzed: de bas na gzhan gyis zhes bya ba'i khyad par te /
translated: Therefore, the distinction is made: “Another.”

original: gzhan gyis bsngos pa ste bdag @176b nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bsngos pa ste bdag @176b nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is dedicated to another, not to oneself.

original: bsngos pa gang la yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsngos pa gang la yin zhe na /
translated: To whom is it dedicated?

original: de'i phyir gos zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gos zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, “cloth” is mentioned.

original: de ltar yang rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: de ltar yang rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Thus the Vyakhyayukti says,

original: rang gi don du 'di la gos kyi rnyed pa mngon par 'dod na zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi don du 'di la gos kyi rnyed pa mngon par 'dod na zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “If one desires to obtain clothing for oneself, one should not give away one’s robes.”

original: blangs par gyur pa su zhig dang lhan du mi shes bzhin du bsngos bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: blangs par gyur pa su zhig dang lhan du mi shes bzhin du bsngos bar 'gyur te /
translated: With whom, having accepted them, would one dedicate them without knowing?

original: dor byas pa'i dbang gis sam /
analyzed: dor byas pa'i dbang gis sam /
translated: By the power of giving up,

original: 'jam par byas pa'i dbang gis sam /🔽su zhig de la rjes su 'dod cing 'dug pa zhes bya ba 'am /
analyzed: 'jam par byas pa'i dbang gis sam / su zhig de la rjes su 'dod cing 'dug pa zhes bya ba 'am /
translated: by the power of making soft,🔽who would be inclined to that?

original: gang yang rung bder 'ged par gyur cig ces bya ba 'am /
analyzed: gang yang rung bder 'ged par gyur cig ces bya ba 'am /
translated: Or, “May it be distributed to whomever is suitable.”

original: gzhan du bsngos pa la mi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du bsngos pa la mi sbyin pa'o //
translated: Or, “I will not give to one who has dedicated it elsewhere.”

original: 'dir ni bsgyur ba nyid med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni bsgyur ba nyid med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is not that there is no transformation,

original: gang gi phyir sa bon mi shes pa'i phyogs la rmo ba la sogs pa las mi byed cing skyed par byed par mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bon mi shes pa'i phyogs la rmo ba la sogs pa las mi byed cing skyed par byed par mi 'gyur ram /
translated: because if one does not know the seed, one will not do the plowing, etc., and it will not grow.

original: de bas na shes bzhin du zhes bya ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: de bas na shes bzhin du zhes bya ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: Therefore, it is the distinction of “knowing.”

original: 'dir mdo ni gang slar shes bzhin zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dir mdo ni gang slar shes bzhin zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: Here, the sutra is like “knowing again.”

original: 'di'i rnam par 'byed pa ni rang nyid kyis 'di la rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di'i rnam par 'byed pa ni rang nyid kyis 'di la rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: The analysis of this is to be understood by oneself.

original: gzhan rnams kyis go bar byas pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyis go bar byas pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called “causing others to understand.”

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: gzhan la gzhan gyis gos bsngos pa zhes bya ba shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur ba yin pa de la gang zhig thob pa gang yin pa de la spang pa'i ltung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan la gzhan gyis gos bsngos pa zhes bya ba shes bzhin du bdag nyid la bsgyur ba yin pa de la gang zhig thob pa gang yin pa de la spang pa'i ltung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: when one who has been given a robe by another, knowing that it is a robe given by another, makes it his own, then there is an offense called “abandoning and then taking up again.”

original: gal te thob pa la dngos gzhi yin na bsgyur ba la kha na ma tho ba cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thob pa la dngos gzhi yin na bsgyur ba la kha na ma tho ba cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the offense is in taking possession of it, what is the offense in making it one’s own?

original: de'i phyir bsgyur ba la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgyur ba la ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “There is an offense in making it one’s own.”

original: 'dir gos ni dpe yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gos ni dpe yin te /
translated: Here the robe is an example.

original: kha zas la sogs pa gzhan pa la rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: kha zas la sogs pa gzhan pa la rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Other things such as food are included.

original: de bas na gzhan du yang rnyed pa la spang ba 'di yod pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan du yang rnyed pa la spang ba 'di yod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, in other cases, this abandonment is to be understood.

original: 'di ni rnyed par gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba zas 'di la khas len par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnyed par gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba zas 'di la khas len par byed pa'o //
translated: “This is not a robe that has been given to me,” one says, accepting the food.

original: rnyed pa gzhan la ni rang nyid la bsgyur ba zhes bya ba 'di kha na ma tho ba ste /
analyzed: rnyed pa gzhan la ni rang nyid la bsgyur ba zhes bya ba 'di kha na ma tho ba ste /
translated: The offense is called “taking for oneself” in regard to other goods,

original: btung ba la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: btung ba la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but not in regard to drink.

original: de bas na 'dir nye du ma yin pa nyid ni skabs ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir nye du ma yin pa nyid ni skabs ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, here non-kinsman is not a condition.

original: 'di ltar zhu ba las ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis nye du ma lags pa las gos len na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhu ba las ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis nye du ma lags pa las gos len na spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs na /
translated: Thus, in the Questions of Upāli, the Blessed One said, “If one accepts robe-cloth from a non-kinsman, there is an offense of expiation.”

original: dag spong ma las gos len par byed na de la yang spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba mchis sam /🔽yod de des gal te dge 'dun gyi phyir nye bar gzhag pa yin la /
analyzed: dag spong ma las gos len par byed na de la yang spang ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ba mchis sam / yod de des gal te dge 'dun gyi phyir nye bar gzhag pa yin la /
translated: “If one accepts robe-cloth from a non-preceptor, is there also an offense of expiation?”

original: dge slong gis bdag nyid la sbyor bar byed na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽ji ltar 'dir nye du ma yin pa nyid yan lag ma yin pa bzhin du tshig @177a * //
analyzed: dge slong gis bdag nyid la sbyor bar byed na'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // ji ltar 'dir nye du ma yin pa nyid yan lag ma yin pa bzhin du tshig @177a * //
translated: “Yes, if he sets it aside for the Saṅgha and a monk dedicates it to himself.”🔽Just as non-kinsman is not a condition here,

original: nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: nyid kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: so also the words are not.

original: gal te 'bral bar bya ba dge slong yin na zhes bya ba mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'bral bar bya ba dge slong yin na zhes bya ba mthong ba yin no //
translated: If the one who is to be separated is a fully ordained monk, it is seen that way.

original: 'dir gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan la yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, it is also said to be for others.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni bsngos pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni bsngos pa la'o //
translated: For others means for those who have dedicated.

original: gang zag gzhan la 'di bsngos pa gzhan la sgyur bar byed na yang nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zag gzhan la 'di bsngos pa gzhan la sgyur bar byed na yang nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one makes a change for others, for those who have dedicated to others, it is said to be a fault.

original: de'i 'bras bu la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni thob pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni thob pa la zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is also said to be for the result, meaning for the attainment.

original: bdag nyid las gzhan pa la sgyur bar byed na dngos gzhi la yang nyes byas yin la /
analyzed: bdag nyid las gzhan pa la sgyur bar byed na dngos gzhi la yang nyes byas yin la /
translated: If one makes a change for others, for those other than oneself, it is a fault in the main part.

original: sbyor ba gcig pu la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sbyor ba gcig pu la ni ma yin zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is not said to be only in the preparation.

original: gzhan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni zas las gzhan pa'i rnyed pa sgyur bar byed na kha na ma tho ba bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan yang ngo zhes bya ba ni zas las gzhan pa'i rnyed pa sgyur bar byed na kha na ma tho ba bshad zin to //
translated: It is also said to be for others, meaning if one makes a change for a gain that is other than food, the fault has already been explained.

original: 'dir zas ni lhag mar byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir zas ni lhag mar byas pa ste /
translated: Here, food is made to be the remainder.

original: bsgyur ba dang bsgrub pa la 'di ni nyes byas su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bsgyur ba dang bsgrub pa la 'di ni nyes byas su brjod pa'o //
translated: This is said to be a fault in the change and the accomplishment.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here, this is the text:

original: mu to ba gcig la bsngos pa'i zas mu to ba gzhan la sgyur bar byed na nyes byas su brjod pa gang yin pa bza' bar bya ba la yang de'o zhes bya ba mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: mu to ba gcig la bsngos pa'i zas mu to ba gzhan la sgyur bar byed na nyes byas su brjod pa gang yin pa bza' bar bya ba la yang de'o zhes bya ba mthong ba yin no //
translated: It is also seen that this is so for food.🔽It is also said that it is for that which is not counted as a sentient being, both that which is separated and that which is connected.

original: dbral ba dang sbyar ba gnyis ka sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gnas khang la sogs pa sems can du bgrang ba nyid ma yin pa gnas khang la sogs pa gang la rnyed pa 'di bsngos pa 'di ni 'dir
analyzed: dbral ba dang sbyar ba gnyis ka sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gnas khang la sogs pa sems can du bgrang ba nyid ma yin pa gnas khang la sogs pa gang la rnyed pa 'di bsngos pa 'di ni 'dir
translated: In a house, etc., which is not counted as a sentient being, if one dedicates this gain to a house, etc.,

original: dbral bar bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: dbral bar bya bar brjod do //
translated: it is said to be that which is separated.

original: gang du sngo bar byed pa de ni sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gang du sngo bar byed pa de ni sbyor ba'o //
translated: That which is connected is that to which one dedicates.

original: 'dir yang bsngo ba dang grub pa la nyes byas zhes bya ba 'dir ngag gi don to //
analyzed: 'dir yang bsngo ba dang grub pa la nyes byas zhes bya ba 'dir ngag gi don to //
translated: Here also, it is said that there is a wrong action in the dedication and the accomplishment. This is the meaning of the words here.

original: phyogs gcig pa nyid la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni them skas kyi rim pa la sogs pa gcig la lus la sogs pa nyid kyis phyogs gcig pa nyid kyi phyir dbral bar bya ba dang / sbyar ba gnyis ka gzhan la bsngos pa 'di ni sbyar bar bya ba ma yin pa de bas na dngos gzhi'i nyes pa med par shes par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig pa nyid la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni them skas kyi rim pa la sogs pa gcig la lus la sogs pa nyid kyis phyogs gcig pa nyid kyi phyir dbral bar bya ba dang / sbyar ba gnyis ka gzhan la bsngos pa 'di ni sbyar bar bya ba ma yin pa de bas na dngos gzhi'i nyes pa med par shes par bya ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Also, in the case of a single direction, means that in the case of a single direction, such as a step on a ladder, etc., because of the single direction of the body, etc., the two, the one to be given and the one to be taken, are dedicated to another. This is not to be given and taken. Therefore, it should be understood that there is no fault of the actual basis.

original: 'dir yang bsngos pa dang / grub pa la nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir yang bsngos pa dang / grub pa la nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here also, the meaning is that there is an offense in the dedication and the accomplishment.

original: lhag ma za ba dud 'gro la sogs pa btsal te ma rnyed pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: lhag ma za ba dud 'gro la sogs pa btsal te ma rnyed pa la ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni /
translated: There is no offense if one searches for a leftover eater, such as an animal, and does not find one, means

original: lhag ma za ba dud 'gro la sogs pa gang la bsngos pa de gal te btsal te ma rnyed na /
analyzed: lhag ma za ba dud 'gro la sogs pa gang la bsngos pa de gal te btsal te ma rnyed na /
translated: that if one searches for the animal, etc., to whom the leftover food is dedicated, and does not find it,

original: de las gzhan pa la bsgyur ba na yang ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa la bsgyur ba na yang ltung ba med do //
translated: there is no offense in dedicating it to another.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i sku gzugs gzhan la ni g-yar por sbyin du rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i sku gzugs gzhan la ni g-yar por sbyin du rung ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is proper to lend to others an image of the Sugata.

original: rgyan la sogs pa gang zhig gzhan ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sku gzugs dang 'brel pa gal te de las gzhan pa'i @177b bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gzugs la g-yar po sbyin par gyur na de la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rgyan la sogs pa gang zhig gzhan ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sku gzugs dang 'brel pa gal te de las gzhan pa'i @177b bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gzugs la g-yar po sbyin par gyur na de la nyes pa med do //
translated: If one lends to another a necklace, etc. that is connected with an image of the Blessed One, there is no offense if one lends it to an image of the Blessed One other than the one to which it was given.

original: bsngos pa mi sbyin na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsngos pa mi sbyin na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one does not give what was designated, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: che ge mo zhig la sbyin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: che ge mo zhig la sbyin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This means that if one says, “I will give to so-and-so,”

original: gal te de la sbyin par mi byed na de'i phyir 'di la nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ste dge 'dun gyi byin gyis rlob par byed na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te de la sbyin par mi byed na de'i phyir 'di la nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to // mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ste dge 'dun gyi byin gyis rlob par byed na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: if one does not give to that person, then this is the meaning of “there is an offense for this.”🔽If one goes outside the boundary and consecrates the Saṅgha’s property,

original: dge 'dun gyi rnyed par bsngos pa mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi rnyed par bsngos pa mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ste /
translated: if one goes outside the boundary with the intention of giving the Saṅgha’s property,

original: byin gyis rlob par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob par byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: if one consecrates it, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ma tshogs pa dag gis 'god na'o zhes bya ba ni nyes byas so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma tshogs pa dag gis 'god na'o zhes bya ba ni nyes byas so zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If those who are not a group arrange it, it is a wrong action.

original: byin gyis ma brlabs na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byin gyis ma brlabs na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is not consecrated,

original: shi ba'i yo byad la sogs pa 'god na yang nyes byas so //
analyzed: shi ba'i yo byad la sogs pa 'god na yang nyes byas so //
translated: it is a wrong action if one arranges it in the articles of the dead, and so on.

original: kun dbang ba'i rnyed pa dge 'dun las gcig gam /
analyzed: kun dbang ba'i rnyed pa dge 'dun las gcig gam /
translated: If the Saṅgha has a gain that is under the control of one,

original: gnyis sam gsum gyis len na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gnyis sam gsum gyis len na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: two, or three, it is a wrong action if one takes it.

original: nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di la thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyes byas so zhes bya ba 'di la thams cad du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This is a wrong action in all cases.

original: kun dbang ba'i rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa dge 'dun las thob par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: kun dbang ba'i rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa dge 'dun las thob par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Gain that is under the control of one” is gain that has been obtained from the Saṅgha.

original: gcig gam gnyis sam gsum la mi ster ba la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gcig gam gnyis sam gsum la mi ster ba la nyes byas so //
translated: It is a wrong action if one does not give it to one, two, or three.

original: gal te de rnyed pa de rnams la yod par gyur na ci'i phyir nyes byas su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de rnyed pa de rnams la yod par gyur na ci'i phyir nyes byas su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one has that gain, why is it a wrong action?

original: de'i phyir de la gzhan dag gis shas nyid ma bral lo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de la gzhan dag gis shas nyid ma bral lo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “Others have not yet divided it up.”

original: gang dag gis rnyed pa blangs pa de las gzhan pa'i rnyed pa de la 'dir shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag gis rnyed pa blangs pa de las gzhan pa'i rnyed pa de la 'dir shes par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this refers to the acquisition of that which is not given by others.

original: 'dir ni rgyu bstan pa ste rku sems med pa la 'di rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir ni rgyu bstan pa ste rku sems med pa la 'di rnam par gzhag pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, the cause is taught, and this is established for one who lacks the intention to steal.

original: rku sems yod na ltung bcir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rku sems yod na ltung bcir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if one has the intention to steal, then there is a downfall.

original: de'i phyir rku sems kyis ni brkus pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rku sems kyis ni brkus pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “if one steals with the intention to steal.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bram ze'i bu mos zhus pa las /
translated: Here, the text of the Questions of the Daughter of the Brahmin is as follows:

original: byin gyis brlab pa gsungs pa'i 'og tu ji ste 'di ltar mi byed na dge slong de gcig pus gos de bdag tu byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa gsungs pa'i 'og tu ji ste 'di ltar mi byed na dge slong de gcig pus gos de bdag tu byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: After the consecration is taught, it says, “If one does not do it in this way, then that monk alone makes that robe his own, and there is an offense.

original: dge slong dag kyang skal pa mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag kyang skal pa mnyam pa ste /
translated: The monks are equal in fortune.

original: dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gcig gis mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ste bdag gir byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge 'dun la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa gcig gis mtshams kyi phyi rol du song ste bdag gir byed na nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: If one monk goes outside the boundary and makes his own that which is given to the Saṅgha, there is an offense.”

original: 'on te de rnams rku sems kyis brku zhing bdag gir byed na ni 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te de rnams rku sems kyis brku zhing bdag gir byed na ni 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if he steals them with the intention of stealing, and makes them his own, then he becomes guilty of a grave offense.🔽The same is true of two or more bhiksus.🔽The phrase “if he steals them with the intention of stealing” means that he knows that he is stealing.

original: gnyis dang rab tu mang po rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis dang rab tu mang po rnams kyang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “if he steals them with the intention of stealing” means that he knows that he is stealing.🔽The phrase “if he steals them with the intention of stealing” means that he knows that he is stealing.

analyzed: gang zhig 'dir rab tu mang po zhes bya ba'i tshig de la dge 'dun du gyur pa nyid la cho ga 'di dang ldan pa ste /🔽dge 'dun du ma gyur pa la ni ma yin no //
