original: der gang zag gi byed pa gyur pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa nyid mang po'i tshig las shes pa'o //
analyzed: der gang zag gi byed pa gyur pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa nyid mang po'i tshig las shes pa'o //
translated: Because there is no human agent there. This is the intention, as is understood from the many words.

original: gya tshom du gtsug lag khang dor bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni phran tshegs dag las 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji srid du dor ba las 'gyed pa zhes bya ba 'di las so //
analyzed: gya tshom du gtsug lag khang dor bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni phran tshegs dag las 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji srid du dor ba las 'gyed pa zhes bya ba 'di las so //
translated: One should not abandon the monastery out of confusion. This is from the Ksudraka-vastu, beginning with This... up to abandoning the dispute.

original: rjes su chags pa dang bcas pa der srung mar bzhag go zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang de la chags pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni srung ma'i phyir gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang bcas pa der srung mar bzhag go zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang de la chags pa dang bcas pa gang yin pa de ni srung ma'i phyir gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One who is attached to that should be appointed as a protector. One who is attached to that monastery should be appointed as a protector.

original: de la 'os pa rnams kyis gtsug lag khang gtad par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la 'os pa rnams kyis gtsug lag khang gtad par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the monastery should be entrusted to those who are suitable for that.

original: rjes su chags pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dkar po thob kyang 'di yongs su dor bar mi byed cas bya ba ni dgos pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dkar po thob kyang 'di yongs su dor bar mi byed cas bya ba ni dgos pa'o //
translated: Because of being attached, even if one obtains something white, one should not abandon it. This is the purpose.

original: ma lhag na lo bcu 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gtsug lhag khang bsrung ba la dge 'dun ma lhags shing gang gis bsrung ba der lo bcu 'da' bar bya'o //
analyzed: ma lhag na lo bcu 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gtsug lhag khang bsrung ba la dge 'dun ma lhags shing gang gis bsrung ba der lo bcu 'da' bar bya'o //
translated: If the saṃgha is not complete in this way for the protection of the monastery, one should wait ten years for the protection of the monastery.

original: ji ltar 'da' bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'da' bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should one wait?

original: de'i phyir lnga ni bsod snyoms kyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir lnga ni bsod snyoms kyis so //
translated: Therefore it is said: Five years by alms,🔽and five years by the monastery of the vicinity.

original: der dus su sbyin bdag ma byung na lo gzhan lnga ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dang lhan cig tu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: der dus su sbyin bdag ma byung na lo gzhan lnga ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dang lhan cig tu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If the donor does not appear at the proper time there, the other five years should be spent together with the monastery of the vicinity.

original: der dus su zhes bya ba ni lo lnga 'das pa rnams la sbyin bdag ma byung na lo gzhan lnga po rnams ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dang lhan cig 'da' bar bya'o //
analyzed: der dus su zhes bya ba ni lo lnga 'das pa rnams la sbyin bdag ma byung na lo gzhan lnga po rnams ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dang lhan cig 'da' bar bya'o //
translated: If the donor does not appear at the proper time there, the other five years should be spent together with the monastery of the vicinity.

original: 'dir gzhung ni kha cig las lnga ni bsod snyoms kyis so //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni kha cig las lnga ni bsod snyoms kyis so //
translated: In this regard, some texts say: Five years by alms,

original: lnga ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang la brten pa ste /
analyzed: lnga ni nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang la brten pa ste /
translated: five years by the monastery of the vicinity.

original: de ltar na lo bcur bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na lo bcur bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it should be done for ten years.

original: 'di nyid 'di ltar smras pa la bya ba dang bcas pa'i lo bcu'i tshig byas so zhes bya ba shes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'di ltar smras pa la bya ba dang bcas pa'i lo bcu'i tshig byas so zhes bya ba shes pa yin no //
translated: It is understood that this is to be done for ten years, as stated.

original: gso sbyong tha dad pa dang rnyed pa thun mong pa'i las bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gso sbyong tha dad pa dang rnyed pa thun mong pa'i las bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The confession ceremony and the acquisition of property are to be done separately.

original: tha dad par zhes bya ba ni so sor ro //
analyzed: tha dad par zhes bya ba ni so sor ro //
translated: Separately means individually.

original: nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dang lhan cig tu gtsug lag khang der gso sbyong tha dad par rnyed pa gcig pa'i las kyis bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang dang lhan cig tu gtsug lag khang der gso sbyong tha dad par rnyed pa gcig pa'i las kyis bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The confession ceremony is to be done separately in that monastery and the acquisition of property is to be done together.🔽When going, the articles are to be entrusted to the neighboring monasteries.

original: 'gro ba na dngos po rnams nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang rnams su gdams par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gtad @178b pa na gang gi tshe 'phongs pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis gtsug lag khang nas 'gro bar 'dod pa mal stan dang snod la
analyzed: 'gro ba na dngos po rnams nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang rnams su gdams par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gtad @178b pa na gang gi tshe 'phongs pa la sogs pa'i dbang gis gtsug lag khang nas 'gro bar 'dod pa mal stan dang snod la
translated: When entrusting the monastery, if one wishes to leave the monastery due to poverty and so on, the bedding and vessels are to be entrusted to the neighboring monasteries.

original: sogs pa'i dngos po rnams nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang rnams su gdams par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sogs pa'i dngos po rnams nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang rnams su gdams par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the rest of the things is that they should be distributed to the neighboring monasteries.🔽If they are permanent residents, they should be given.

original: gnyug mar gnas na sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gtams pa'i dngos po la gang du gtams pa der gnyug mar gnas pa'i dge slong rnams kyis sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyug mar gnas na sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gtams pa'i dngos po la gang du gtams pa der gnyug mar gnas pa'i dge slong rnams kyis sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The meaning is that the things that are distributed should be given to the monks who are permanent residents in the place where they are distributed.🔽The property of one monastery should not be given to another monastery.

original: gnas gzhan gyi rdzas gnas gzhan du mi sbyin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nges pa'i rnyed pa la rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i mdo'i phyogs kyi rjes su brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gnas gzhan gyi rdzas gnas gzhan du mi sbyin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nges pa'i rnyed pa la rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba'i mdo'i phyogs kyi rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: This is stated in accordance with the sutra that says, “The distribution of the property of a monk who passed away should be done according to the rules.”

original: 'di la sbyin par bya ba nyid ces bya ba'i cho ga 'di'i yul bstan pa'i don du brjod do //🔽sil bu rnams la de la sogs pa'i stobs kyis mi sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la sbyin par bya ba nyid ces bya ba'i cho ga 'di'i yul bstan pa'i don du brjod do // sil bu rnams la de la sogs pa'i stobs kyis mi sbyin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Here, the rule for giving is stated in order to show the object of this rule.🔽The distribution of the property of a monk who passed away should be done according to the rules.

original: 'di yang spang ba ni gnas mal gyi ltung byed las /
analyzed: 'di yang spang ba ni gnas mal gyi ltung byed las /
translated: This is also stated in the rule on bedding and seats:

original: mi ster na de dag gi sbyin par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi ster na de dag gi sbyin par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: If they are not given, they should be given to those who are permanent residents.🔽Here, the rule for giving is stated in order to show the object of this rule.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni gang rnams kyi rdzas de rnams gzhan la sbyin par de rnams la ster ba med par gyur pa la sbyin par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni gang rnams kyi rdzas de rnams gzhan la sbyin par de rnams la ster ba med par gyur pa la sbyin par bya ba nyid do //
translated: Those refers to those who give the substance to others, and it is not that they are givers to those who do not exist.

original: khyim bdag de nyid yin yang nges pa la gzhig pa med do zhes bya ba ni gal te de dang khyim bdag de nyid gnas gzhan du sbyin bdag du gyur na gang gi dngos po de gnas gzhan la dngos por gyur na de ltar na yang gang zhig
analyzed: khyim bdag de nyid yin yang nges pa la gzhig pa med do zhes bya ba ni gal te de dang khyim bdag de nyid gnas gzhan du sbyin bdag du gyur na gang gi dngos po de gnas gzhan la dngos por gyur na de ltar na yang gang zhig
translated: Even if it is the same householder, there is no destruction of determination. This means that if that householder becomes the donor in another place, and if the substance becomes the substance in another place, then also that which is determined for one is not for another.

original: gang la nges pa de ni de nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang la nges pa de ni de nyid do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: That is the same one means that is the meaning of that is the same one.

original: mi ster na mthus gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi snang na yod pa'am med pa'i rdzas byin pa la sbyin par bya ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi ster na mthus gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi snang na yod pa'am med pa'i rdzas byin pa la sbyin par bya ba nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: If it is not given, it should be taken by force. This means that if it does not appear, the substance that exists or does not exist is given.

original: chog gzhan pa la bsgrub pa gang yin pa de brjod pa'i don du mdo 'di bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chog gzhan pa la bsgrub pa gang yin pa de brjod pa'i don du mdo 'di bstan pa'o //
translated: This sutra was taught for the purpose of expressing that which is established for another.

original: 'dir mthus bzung ba la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba yang 'di bstan pa yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir mthus bzung ba la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba yang 'di bstan pa yang rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, it should be understood that there is no offense if one takes by power for the sake of the teaching.

original: g-yar po nyid du ni sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas gzhan gyi rdzas ni gnas gzhan du'o //🔽mchod rten gzhan la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa ma grub pa la ni nyes pa med do byang chub chen po dang / chos kyi 'khor lo dang / cho 'phrul chen po dang / lha las babs pa rnams kyis de dag las gzhan ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la /🔽ma grub pa la zhes bya ba ni de thob pa la'o //
analyzed: g-yar po nyid du ni sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas gzhan gyi rdzas ni gnas gzhan du'o // mchod rten gzhan la bsngos pa'i rnyed pa ma grub pa la ni nyes pa med do byang chub chen po dang / chos kyi 'khor lo dang / cho 'phrul chen po dang / lha las babs pa rnams kyis de dag las gzhan ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba la / ma grub pa la zhes bya ba ni de thob pa la'o //
translated: One should give to a debtor, but not to another person.🔽There is no offense if the acquisition is not established for the acquisition dedicated to another stupa.🔽The acquisition of a stupa is not to be given to another stupa.

original: rnyed pa de zhes bya ba ni mchod rten gyi rnyed pa la'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa de zhes bya ba ni mchod rten gyi rnyed pa la'o //
translated: The acquisition of a stupa is not to be given to another stupa.

original: 'dir mchod rten nyid kyi tshig ni sangs rgyas kyi bye brag tsam la yin te /🔽'dir gzugs sku la ni ma brjod pa ma yin par @179a * //
analyzed: 'dir mchod rten nyid kyi tshig ni sangs rgyas kyi bye brag tsam la yin te / 'dir gzugs sku la ni ma brjod pa ma yin par @179a * //
translated: Here, the word stupa is a mere substitute for Buddha.

original: shes par bya'o //
analyzed: shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, it should be understood that the form body is not excluded.

original: ha cang thal ba la dmigs kyis bsal bar brjod pa ni byang chub chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: ha cang thal ba la dmigs kyis bsal bar brjod pa ni byang chub chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The exception to the overextension is stated in the verse that begins “great enlightenment.”

original: gnas 'di'i mchod rten 'di rnams ni rnyed pa la mi 'grub pa med kyang bzhi po 'di rnams las gzhan pa'i mchod rten la sgyur bar byed pa ni skyon dang bral ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gnas 'di'i mchod rten 'di rnams ni rnyed pa la mi 'grub pa med kyang bzhi po 'di rnams las gzhan pa'i mchod rten la sgyur bar byed pa ni skyon dang bral ba ma yin no //
translated: These stupas at this site are not established for gain, but it is not without fault to convert a stupa to another use, except in these four cases.

original: 'di rnams las gzhan la ma grub par gyur kyang nyes pa dang bral ba nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams las gzhan la ma grub par gyur kyang nyes pa dang bral ba nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Even if they are not established for another purpose, they are still without fault.

original: rnyed pa gang zhig byang chub chen po dang bltam pa dang chos kyi 'khor lo 'am yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la nges par 'byung ba de dran par bya nus la /
analyzed: rnyed pa gang zhig byang chub chen po dang bltam pa dang chos kyi 'khor lo 'am yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa la nges par 'byung ba de dran par bya nus la /
translated: Any gain that is dedicated to great enlightenment, to birth, to the wheel of the Dharma, or to nirvana is remembered.

original: mchod rten bzhi po dag la phul ba ni 'di dag dge ba'o //
analyzed: mchod rten bzhi po dag la phul ba ni 'di dag dge ba'o //
translated: That which is offered to the four stupas is virtuous.

original: gal te mi nus na mchod rten gcig kho na la dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mi nus na mchod rten gcig kho na la dbul bar bya'o //
translated: If one is unable to do that, one should offer to just one stupa.

original: kha cig las gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ste /
analyzed: kha cig las gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes 'byung ste /
translated: Some say that it should not be offered to another.

original: gang zhig 'dir bltam pa dang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dag bzung ba yin gyi cho 'phrul chen po dang lha las babs pa dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'dir bltam pa dang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa dag bzung ba yin gyi cho 'phrul chen po dang lha las babs pa dag ni ma yin te /
translated: The birth and parinirvana of the Buddha are taken as the basis, not the great miracles or the descent from the gods.

original: de ni yi ge chad par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni yi ge chad par rig par bya ste /
translated: This is known as the omission of a letter.

original: nges pa rnams la cho ga 'di dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / bltam pa dang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas gzhan la ni ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa rnams la cho ga 'di dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / bltam pa dang yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i gnas gzhan la ni ma nges pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is because the definite ones have this rite, and the other places of birth and parinirvana are indefinite.

original: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba'o /
analyzed: bsngos pa las bsgyur ba'i spang ba'o /
translated: The prohibition against changing what has been dedicated.

original: // / zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa'i nyi ma 'das so cog dge slong la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni deng phyin chad du nyi ma dang po 'das te deng nyi ma gnyis pa lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: // / zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs pa'i nyi ma 'das so cog dge slong la brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni deng phyin chad du nyi ma dang po 'das te deng nyi ma gnyis pa lags so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Every day, the day of the consecration should be announced to the monks, saying The first day has passed, today is the second day, and so on.

original: gang du gsog 'jog gi spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang du gsog 'jog gi spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Where is there a prohibition against storing?

original: de'i phyir bza' ba'i phyir 'chad na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bza' ba'i phyir 'chad na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, If it is for the purpose of eating.

original: gsog 'jog nyid kyi rgyu mtshan la brtags pa'i phyir yongs su spyod pa la ltung byed 'di rnam par gzhag par byas pa'o //
analyzed: gsog 'jog nyid kyi rgyu mtshan la brtags pa'i phyir yongs su spyod pa la ltung byed 'di rnam par gzhag par byas pa'o //
translated: This downfall is posited as a downfall for using because it is a reason for storing.

original: gang gi phyir spang ba yongs su spyad pa la don med pa glags med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir spang ba yongs su spyad pa la don med pa glags med pa nyid do //
translated: It is meaningless and impossible to use what is to be discarded.

original: 'o na de'i 'og tu yongs su longs spyad par bya ba spang ba'i ltung byed ces bya ba 'dir mdo las gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i 'og tu yongs su longs spyad par bya ba spang ba'i ltung byed ces bya ba 'dir mdo las gsungs so zhe na /
translated: Then, why is the downfall called “using what is to be discarded” stated in the sūtras?

original: bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'di'i 'chang ba la nye bar mtshon pa don gyis rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'di'i 'chang ba la nye bar mtshon pa don gyis rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: That is true, but it is also implied that it is to be used for seven days.

original: de bzhin du ltung ba rgyas par bshad pa ni 'dir 'chang ba la ltung ba brjod pa'i phyir dge slong la tshes gcig la sman zhig byung la tshes gnyis pa la yang sman phyi ma zhig byung na dge slong des nyi ma bdun po de nyid kyi nang
analyzed: de bzhin du ltung ba rgyas par bshad pa ni 'dir 'chang ba la ltung ba brjod pa'i phyir dge slong la tshes gcig la sman zhig byung la tshes gnyis pa la yang sman phyi ma zhig byung na dge slong des nyi ma bdun po de nyid kyi nang
translated: Similarly, the extensive explanation of the downfall is stated here in order to explain the downfall of keeping. If a monk obtains medicine on the first day of the month and then obtains more medicine on the second day, that monk may use the medicine obtained on the first day for seven days.

original: du snga ma shos byin gyis brlab par bya zhing phyi ma @179b shos gtang bar bya ba'am gzhan la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: du snga ma shos byin gyis brlab par bya zhing phyi ma @179b shos gtang bar bya ba'am gzhan la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The first should be consecrated and the latter should be given to another or discarded.

original: yang na phyi ma shos byin gyis brlab par bya zhing snga ma shos gtang bar bya ba'am gzhan la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na phyi ma shos byin gyis brlab par bya zhing snga ma shos gtang bar bya ba'am gzhan la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: Or else, the latter should be consecrated and the former should be given to another or discarded.

original: byin gyis mi rlob par byad dam gtong bar mi byed dam gzhan la sbyin par mi byed na nyi ma brgyad pa'i skya rengs shar ba na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byin gyis mi rlob par byad dam gtong bar mi byed dam gzhan la sbyin par mi byed na nyi ma brgyad pa'i skya rengs shar ba na spang ba'i ltung byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If one does not consecrate, discard or give to another, then at sunrise on the eighth day, one commits a partial defeat.

original: ji srid 'chang zhe na /
analyzed: ji srid 'chang zhe na /
translated: For how long should one keep it?

original: de'i phyir de'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “that.”

original: zhag bdun par byin gyis brlab par byas pa de zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhag bdun par byin gyis brlab par byas pa de zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that which is consecrated for seven days.

original: byin gyis ma brlabs pa ni zhag bdun las 'das par 'chang bar bya ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: byin gyis ma brlabs pa ni zhag bdun las 'das par 'chang bar bya ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: That which is not consecrated should not be kept beyond seven days.

original: gang gi phyir rung ba la 'chang bar bkag pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rung ba la 'chang bar bkag pa ste /
translated: Because it is prohibited to keep what is suitable.

original: 'thad pa'i ngo bor ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'thad pa'i ngo bor ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not suitable in essence.

original: dbyig dang gser la yang don la brten nas rjes su gnang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyig dang gser la yang don la brten nas rjes su gnang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because it is permitted to use gold and silver for the sake of the goal.

original: nam gyi tshe spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: nam gyi tshe spang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: When does one become an ārya?

original: de'i phyir skya rengs brgyad pa shar na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir skya rengs brgyad pa shar na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “when the eighth dawn appears.”

original: 'dir tshad ni blangs pa nyid na 'byung ba zhes bya ba rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir tshad ni blangs pa nyid na 'byung ba zhes bya ba rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Here, the measure is that it arises when it is taken up.

original: nye bar longs spyad par bya ba ma yin pa la nye bar longs spyod pa'i don du 'chang ba zhes bya ba 'di ni kha na ma tho ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar longs spyad par bya ba ma yin pa la nye bar longs spyod pa'i don du 'chang ba zhes bya ba 'di ni kha na ma tho ba'o //
translated: It is a fault to keep something for the purpose of using it that should not be used.

original: byin len ma byas pa dang rung ba ma yin pa dang brtag pa gzhan dang rdzas gzhan dang 'dres pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan yang mi rung ba nyid du gyur pa la nye bar longs spyad par bya ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: byin len ma byas pa dang rung ba ma yin pa dang brtag pa gzhan dang rdzas gzhan dang 'dres pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan yang mi rung ba nyid du gyur pa la nye bar longs spyad par bya ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is also not proper to use something that has become improper through being kept overnight, through being unfit, through being another’s portion, through being mixed with another substance, and so on.

original: de bzhin du dus su rung ba dang thun tshod du rung ba dang 'tsho ba'i bar du 'chang ba rnams la skyon gyis rung ba ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du dus su rung ba dang thun tshod du rung ba dang 'tsho ba'i bar du 'chang ba rnams la skyon gyis rung ba ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Likewise, it would be improper to use what is proper for a certain time, what is proper for a certain period, and what is proper for life.

original: zhag bdun pa las 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa las 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Or, there would be nothing at all that is proper for seven days.

original: gang gi phyir 'dir de rnams longs spyad par bya ba ma yin pa rnams la longs spyad pa'i don du 'chad pas nyes pa 'di med par 'gyur ba 'am na smad pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dir de rnams longs spyad par bya ba ma yin pa rnams la longs spyad pa'i don du 'chad pas nyes pa 'di med par 'gyur ba 'am na smad pa med pa nyid do //
translated: But since it is explained that these are not to be used for the purpose of using them, this fault does not arise.

original: de lta bas na 'dir spos pa ni dpe tsam du zad par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di rnam par gzhag pa 'di rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir spos pa ni dpe tsam du zad par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di rnam par gzhag pa 'di rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this should be understood as the presentation that the example here is merely an example.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de'i phyir bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa nyin mtshan 'das pa ni 'dir zos pa dang 'dra bar rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bza' bar bya ba rung ba ma yin pa nyin mtshan 'das pa ni 'dir zos pa dang 'dra bar rnam par gzhag go zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that what is improper to eat that has passed the night is presented here as if it were eaten.

original: bza' bar bya ba zos pa ltar zhes bya ba 'dir rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: bza' bar bya ba zos pa ltar zhes bya ba 'dir rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: It is presented here as if what is proper to eat were eaten.

original: rung ba ma yin pa nyin mchan 'da' bar byed na ltung ba zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa nyin mchan 'da' bar byed na ltung ba zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If one uses what is not allowable, day after day, it is called a downfall.

original: skya rengs brgyad pa shar na'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir don to //
analyzed: skya rengs brgyad pa shar na'o zhes bya ba ni 'dir don to //
translated: The meaning is that when the eighth dawn has appeared.

original: 'dir nyin zhag la nyin mtshan zhes bya ba brjod pa yin no//
analyzed: 'dir nyin zhag la nyin mtshan zhes bya ba brjod pa yin no//
translated: Here, day and night is used to mean a day.🔽Using day and night means that it is proper to keep what is heard about allowable food, such as what is kept overnight or cooked overnight, etc.

original: @180a * // nyin mtshan 'da' bar byed pa ni nang du zhag lon pa dang nang du btsos pa la sogs pa rung ba'i bza' ba ji lta bu thos pa la kha na ma tho ba de lta bu 'dir 'chang ba la rigs pa yin gyi lhag pa ni ma yin
analyzed: @180a * // nyin mtshan 'da' bar byed pa ni nang du zhag lon pa dang nang du btsos pa la sogs pa rung ba'i bza' ba ji lta bu thos pa la kha na ma tho ba de lta bu 'dir 'chang ba la rigs pa yin gyi lhag pa ni ma yin
translated: But it is not proper to keep leftovers.

original: no // gang gi phyir mi rigs par gyur pa za bar byed pa la nang du zhag lon pa dang nang du btsos pa la sogs pa rnams la nyes byas te 'chang ba la ni spang ba'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: no // gang gi phyir mi rigs par gyur pa za bar byed pa la nang du zhag lon pa dang nang du btsos pa la sogs pa rnams la nyes byas te 'chang ba la ni spang ba'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Because it is said that if one eats what is not proper, then there is an offense for keeping what is kept overnight or cooked overnight, etc.

original: de bas na 'dir zos pa ltar zhes bya ba bsten pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir zos pa ltar zhes bya ba bsten pa'o //
translated: Therefore, here, as if one has eaten, means to keep.

original: de don gang gi phyir brtags pa de'i phyir ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni bza' ba'i don las gzhan gang zhig la zhag bdun pa brtag pa don de'i phyir 'chang ba la ltung ba med do //
analyzed: de don gang gi phyir brtags pa de'i phyir ni ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni bza' ba'i don las gzhan gang zhig la zhag bdun pa brtag pa don de'i phyir 'chang ba la ltung ba med do //
translated: The meaning of that is: for the purpose of something other than eating, if one examines the seven-day medicine, there is no offense in keeping it.

original: don ma bcad par 'chang ba bza' ba'i don nyid la khong su gtogs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don ma bcad par 'chang ba bza' ba'i don nyid la khong su gtogs pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But if the meaning is not determined, then it is not included in the meaning of eating.

original: de bas na der nyes pa med pa 'am na smad pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na der nyes pa med pa 'am na smad pa med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, there is no fault in that, or it is not reprehensible.

original: bag med pa dang dran pa brjed pas 'chang ba ni 'chang ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa dang dran pa brjed pas 'chang ba ni 'chang ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Keeping it out of carelessness or forgetfulness is not keeping it.

original: de bas na 'dir yang yid kyis ma bsdus pa nyid la rung ba ma yin pa'i don las 'di'i sgo nas 'da' bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir yang yid kyis ma bsdus pa nyid la rung ba ma yin pa'i don las 'di'i sgo nas 'da' bar byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, here also, if it is not included in the mind, it is not transgressing through this means from the meaning of unsuitability.

original: rung ba ma yin pa'i don las bsdus te /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin pa'i don las bsdus te /
translated: It is included in the meaning of unsuitability.

original: dngos po la ma brten par rung ba ma yin pa'i don la 'di tsam nyid du don med par nyes byas su rnam par gnas pa yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po la ma brten par rung ba ma yin pa'i don la 'di tsam nyid du don med par nyes byas su rnam par gnas pa yin no zhes bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the meaning is that it is not proper to be independent of things, and that this is a fault that is meaningless in just this much.

original: snar blugs pa dang bsku ma nye byas pa dag ni gsog 'jog byas kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun pa'i dbang du byed pa na mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir 'di rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: snar blugs pa dang bsku ma nye byas pa dag ni gsog 'jog byas kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun pa'i dbang du byed pa na mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir 'di rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is proper to store the nose-drops and the ointment that is applied to the eyes, because this is understood to be the same as in the case of the seven-day rule.

original: zhag bdun pa'i spang ba'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa'i spang ba'o //
translated: The prohibition on the seven-day rule is finished.

original: spang ba rnams rdzogs so /
analyzed: spang ba rnams rdzogs so /
translated: The prohibitions are finished.

original: // / dge 'dun 'dus pa la shes bzhin du chos ma yin pa chos su dang / chos chos ma yin par bstan pa ni nyes pa sbom po'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: // / dge 'dun 'dus pa la shes bzhin du chos ma yin pa chos su dang / chos chos ma yin par bstan pa ni nyes pa sbom po'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the Saṃghabhedavastu, it says: “To knowingly teach what is not Dharma as Dharma and what is Dharma as not Dharma to an assembled Saṅgha is a serious offense.”

original: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: shes bzhin du zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: “Knowingly” means knowing what is Dharma and what is not Dharma.

original: dge 'dun 'dus pa la zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun dbye ba'i phyir 'gro ba la de'i sbom po'i ltung ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun 'dus pa la zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun dbye ba'i phyir 'gro ba la de'i sbom po'i ltung ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: “To an assembled Saṅgha” means to those who have gone for the sake of dividing the Saṅgha, generating a serious downfall for them.

original: de bas na gzhan du ni 'di med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na gzhan du ni 'di med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it does not exist elsewhere.

original: gso sbyong la ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gsum gyi bar du dris pa las ma dag par shes bzhin du cang mi smra bas 'da' bar byed na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni 'dir tshig la ni yan lag nyid kyi phyir na
analyzed: gso sbyong la ci 'di la khyed yongs su dag gam zhes lan gsum gyi bar du dris pa las ma dag par shes bzhin du cang mi smra bas 'da' bar byed na nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni 'dir tshig la ni yan lag nyid kyi phyir na
translated: If, in the poṣadha ceremony, one does not speak about the purity of the precepts, even though one knows that they are impure, and one passes over it in silence, it is an offense of wrong conduct.🔽Here, the offense is due to the words themselves.

original: 'dir ni na smad pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir ni na smad pa nyid do //
translated: Here, it is the silence that is condemned.

original: cang mi smra bas 'da' bar byed pa 'di ni dpe yin te /
analyzed: cang mi smra bas 'da' bar byed pa 'di ni dpe yin te /
translated: This silence is an example.

original: tshig las @180b gzhan pa thams cad la 'dis go bar byed pa la 'phangs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig las @180b gzhan pa thams cad la 'dis go bar byed pa la 'phangs par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is applied to all cases other than the words.

original: gang du brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed ce na /
analyzed: gang du brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed ce na /
translated: Where is there an offense for lying?

original: de'i phyir de gnyis dang pham par 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag mar gyur pa gnyis las gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de gnyis dang pham par 'gyur ba dang dge 'dun lhag mar gyur pa gnyis las gzhan pa'i brdzun du smra ba'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is lying other than those two and the two that are grounds for defeat and the two that are serious infractions.

original: 'du shes rnam par bzhag nas zhes bya ba ni 'dir pham par rgyas par bshad pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes rnam par bzhag nas zhes bya ba ni 'dir pham par rgyas par bshad pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Having established the perception, one should understand this in accordance with the extensive explanation of the defeat.

original: de gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun du smra ba gnyis so //
analyzed: de gnyis dang zhes bya ba ni bstan ma thag pa'i nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba dang / nyes byas su 'gyur ba'i brdzun du smra ba gnyis so //
translated: The two of those means the two lies that are the immediately preceding condition for the two downfalls, the serious violation and the offense of wrong conduct.

original: brdzun du smra ba rnam pa bzhi po de dag las gzhan pa'i ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba rnam pa bzhi po de dag las gzhan pa'i ltung ba 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From among those four kinds of lies, the other downfalls occur here.🔽If one obtains the perception of the mere desire to speak, then there is no lying, because one has obtained the perception of the mere occurrence of speech.

original: smra bar 'dod pa nyid la 'du shes rnyed pa la brdzun du smra ba zhes bya ba 'di the tshom med par smra bar gyur pa nyid la 'du shes thob pa la brdzun du smra ba yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gang zhig la dogs par
analyzed: smra bar 'dod pa nyid la 'du shes rnyed pa la brdzun du smra ba zhes bya ba 'di the tshom med par smra bar gyur pa nyid la 'du shes thob pa la brdzun du smra ba yod par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gang zhig la dogs par
translated: If one wonders about this,

original: gyur na / de bzlog pa'i don du brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gyur na / de bzlog pa'i don du brjod par bya ste /
translated: it should be stated in order to dispel that doubt.

original: smra ba'i tshe nying na yang 'du shes byung na de kun nas slong pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: smra ba'i tshe nying na yang 'du shes byung na de kun nas slong pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: When speaking, if the notion arises, then it is the motivating force.

original: 'du shes byung na zhes bya ba ni gzhan du smra bar gyur pa la zhes bya ba'i don gyis shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes byung na zhes bya ba ni gzhan du smra bar gyur pa la zhes bya ba'i don gyis shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase “if the notion arises” should be understood to mean “if one speaks with a different notion.”

original: de zhes bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni brdzun du smra ba'o //
translated: The phrase “that” refers to lying.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni smra bar 'dod pa nyid la yang ngo //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni smra bar 'dod pa nyid la yang ngo //
translated: The word “also” means that the desire to speak is also a motivating force.

original: 'dir gzhung ni brdzun du smra ba rnam pa gnyis po gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni brdzun du smra ba rnam pa gnyis po gang zhe na /
translated: Here is the treatise: What are the two types of lying?

original: shes bzhin du brdzun gyi tshig smra ba ni 'di snyam du brdzun gyi tshig smra'o snyam pa dang / smras pa'i 'og tu 'di snyam du bdag gis brdzun gyi tshig smras so snyam pa ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin du brdzun gyi tshig smra ba ni 'di snyam du brdzun gyi tshig smra'o snyam pa dang / smras pa'i 'og tu 'di snyam du bdag gis brdzun gyi tshig smras so snyam pa ste /
translated: Speaking a false statement knowingly is thinking “I am speaking a false statement” and after speaking thinking “I have spoken a false statement.”

original: de bas na 'dir brdzun du smra ba gcig pu nyid la rnam pa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir brdzun du smra ba gcig pu nyid la rnam pa gnyis yin te /
translated: Therefore, here lying itself has two types.

original: rnam pa gnyis 'di la yod pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa nyid kyis brjod pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis 'di la yod pa'i phyir rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa nyid kyis brjod pa'o //
translated: It is said to have two types because it has two aspects.

original: gcig pu gcig gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig pu gcig gis ni ma yin no //
translated: not by one alone.

original: de bas na rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i brdzun du smra ba nyid bstan te /
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i brdzun du smra ba nyid bstan te /
translated: Therefore, the author of the treatise teaches that lying is twofold.

original: de ltar yang rnam pa gcig pa 'ba' zhig gis brdzun du smra ba ni yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar yang rnam pa gcig pa 'ba' zhig gis brdzun du smra ba ni yod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: Thus, it is said, “Lying is not accomplished by one aspect alone.”

original: nges par smra bar gyur pa nyid kyi 'du shes can gyi smra ba nyid la yang 'di bsgrub pa zhes bya ba 'di'i tshig ste /
analyzed: nges par smra bar gyur pa nyid kyi 'du shes can gyi smra ba nyid la yang 'di bsgrub pa zhes bya ba 'di'i tshig ste /
translated: The word “only” in the expression “only when one has the perception of speaking” refers to the accomplishment of the act of lying.

original: smra ba nyid kyi 'du shes la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: smra ba nyid kyi 'du shes la ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not refer to the perception of speaking.

original: 'du shes la smra bar gyur pa nyid la yang ma grub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes la smra bar gyur pa nyid la yang ma grub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The word “only” in the expression “only when one has the perception of lying” refers to the accomplishment of the act of lying.

original: 'du shes snga ma la ni phyi ma gnas pa'i ngo bo ste /
analyzed: 'du shes snga ma la ni phyi ma gnas pa'i ngo bo ste /
translated: The former perception is the basis for the latter,

original: phyi ma la ni snga mas ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la ni snga mas ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but not vice versa.

original: mna' dor bar mi bya'o zhes @181a * //
analyzed: mna' dor bar mi bya'o zhes @181a * //
translated: One should not take an oath.

original: bya ba ni phren tshegs rnams las btus pa yin te /
analyzed: bya ba ni phren tshegs rnams las btus pa yin te /
translated: This is an additional point.

original: thams cad bdag la bden pa la 'jug pa ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di la 'di bstan pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad bdag la bden pa la 'jug pa ma yin te zhes bya ba 'di la 'di bstan pa ste /
translated: This is taught here:

original: gang zhig mna' med pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig mna' med pa'o //
translated: He who has no oath.

original: de bas na brdzun du smra ba'i phyogs nyid kyi phyir 'di la 'dir spong ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na brdzun du smra ba'i phyogs nyid kyi phyir 'di la 'dir spong ba'o //
translated: Therefore, because of the side of lying, this is abandoned here.

original: de ltar yang dge slong rnams ni bden par smra bar 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang dge slong rnams ni bden par smra bar 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Thus, monks desire to speak the truth.

original: rab tu byung ba nyid la zhes bya bar brjod nas de bas na dge slong gis mna' dor bar mi bya ba'i tshig 'di'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba nyid la zhes bya bar brjod nas de bas na dge slong gis mna' dor bar mi bya ba'i tshig 'di'o //
translated: Having expressed the very renunciation, this is the statement that a monk should not take an oath.

original: brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall of lying.

original: // / rung ba ma yin par bsam pas gang yang rung ba'i skyon nas smra bar 'dod nas skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed ces bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // / rung ba ma yin par bsam pas gang yang rung ba'i skyon nas smra bar 'dod nas skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed ces bya ba 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If, with the intention of unsuitability, one wishes to speak of a fault of any kind, the downfall called “speaking of faults” will be explained.

original: de la ci zhig bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la yang rung ba ma yin par bsam pa brjod pa yang 'di yin nam zhen /
analyzed: de la ci zhig bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la yang rung ba ma yin par bsam pa brjod pa yang 'di yin nam zhen /
translated: What is the expression of the intention of unsuitability even in one who is not fully ordained?

original: de'i phyir dge slong gi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong gi'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “of a monk.”

original: 'dir dge slong ni yul du rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir dge slong ni yul du rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Here, the monk is to be understood as the object.

original: dge slong gi yul brjod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge slong gi yul brjod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: “the monk is the object of the expression.”

original: 'og ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni phra ma byed pa'i ltung byed la yul dge slong nyid du rtogs par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'og ma la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni phra ma byed pa'i ltung byed la yul dge slong nyid du rtogs par bya zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The same applies to the following, meaning that the monk is to be understood as the object of the offense of divisive speech.

original: smras na zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis ka yang dge slong gi yul kho na la rig par bya ste /
analyzed: smras na zhes bya ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis ka yang dge slong gi yul kho na la rig par bya ste /
translated: If one speaks means that both bases of training are to be understood in relation to the object of a monk alone.

original: dge slong la brjod pa la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong la brjod pa la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning is: “if one speaks to a monk.”

original: gzhan la ni 'di dag brjod pa 'am smras pa gcig pu la gtogs pa'i phyogs nyid kyi phyir nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni 'di dag brjod pa 'am smras pa gcig pu la gtogs pa'i phyogs nyid kyi phyir nyes byas su rig par bya'o //
translated: In relation to others, they are to be understood as misdeeds, because they are included in the category of mere expression or speech.

original: dag pa'i sems kyis kyang rung ba ma yin par bsam pa brjod pa byung ba yin no //
analyzed: dag pa'i sems kyis kyang rung ba ma yin par bsam pa brjod pa byung ba yin no //
translated: Even with a pure mind, it is not permissible to express a thought that is not true.

original: de'i khyad par du byas pa ste /
analyzed: de'i khyad par du byas pa ste /
translated: It is qualified by that,

original: skyon nyid brjod par 'dod pas so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyon nyid brjod par 'dod pas so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: because one wishes to express a fault.

original: tshig ji lta bus she na /
analyzed: tshig ji lta bus she na /
translated: What kind of words?

original: de'i phyir 'jam pas kyang rung rtsub bas kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jam pas kyang rung rtsub bas kyang rung ngo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is suitable to be gentle or harsh.

original: skyon las smra ba dang bcas pa'i tshig rtsub mo smras na dngos gzhir 'gyur gyi gzhan la ni nyes byas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyon las smra ba dang bcas pa'i tshig rtsub mo smras na dngos gzhir 'gyur gyi gzhan la ni nyes byas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one speaks harsh words with faults, it becomes the actual basis. If one speaks harsh words without faults, it is a minor offense.

original: de ltar na tshig rtsub po smras pa yang bslab pa'i gzhi 'di dag nyid la khongs su bsdu ba nyid ces bya ba 'dis yang dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na tshig rtsub po smras pa yang bslab pa'i gzhi 'di dag nyid la khongs su bsdu ba nyid ces bya ba 'dis yang dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that even speaking harsh words is included in these precepts.

original: rung ba ma yin par bsam pa gang yang rung ba smra na'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin par bsam pa gang yang rung ba smra na'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If one speaks any inappropriate thought,

original: khyod ni mdze can no zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgra la yang khro ba po nyid ces bya ba nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa smad par bsam pa gang yang rung ba brjod pa la skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya🔽ba'i don to //
analyzed: khyod ni mdze can no zhes bya ba la sogs pas sgra la yang khro ba po nyid ces bya ba nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa smad par bsam pa gang yang rung ba brjod pa la skyon nas smra ba'i ltung byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning is that if one speaks any inappropriate thought, such as You are a leper and so on, or You are angry and so on, which is a secondary affliction and so on, it becomes a downfall of speaking faults.

original: mi dga' ba nyid du ma @181b gyur na yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi dga' ba nyid du ma @181b gyur na yang ngo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even if one does not become displeased,

original: mi dga' ba nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi dga' ba nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: Displeasure is🔽.

original: khros pa dang 'khrugs pa dang yi chad pa dang skengs pa dang yul yul bor gyur pa zhes bya ba rnams dang don gcig go //
analyzed: khros pa dang 'khrugs pa dang yi chad pa dang skengs pa dang yul yul bor gyur pa zhes bya ba rnams dang don gcig go //
translated: “Displeasure” is the same as “anger,” “irritation,” “disappointment,” “arrogance,” and “abandoning the object.”

original: de ltar 'dir gzhung ni dge slong spa bkong ba nyid du gyur kyang rung zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar 'dir gzhung ni dge slong spa bkong ba nyid du gyur kyang rung zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the text here says, “even if the monk is humiliated.”

original: gzhan rgyal rigs nyid dang bram ze nyid la sogs pa ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba la gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan rgyal rigs nyid dang bram ze nyid la sogs pa ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba la gzhan zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Other,” such as being a kṣatriya or a brahmin, is a minor offense.

original: rung ba ma yin par bsam pa las gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: rung ba ma yin par bsam pa las gzhan pa ste /
translated: “Other” means other than the improper thought.

original: rgyal rigs nyid dang bram ze nyid la sogs pa la rung ba ma yin pa'i bsam pas smra na nyes byas so //
analyzed: rgyal rigs nyid dang bram ze nyid la sogs pa la rung ba ma yin pa'i bsam pas smra na nyes byas so //
translated: If one speaks with an improper thought of being a kṣatriya or a brahmin, it is a minor offense.

original: skyon nas smra ba'o /
analyzed: skyon nas smra ba'o /
translated: It is speaking about faults.

original: // / gang du phra ma byed pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: // / gang du phra ma byed pa'i ltung byed du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Where is there a downfall for divisive speech?

original: de'i phyir phra ma byed 'dod pas che ge mo zhig zer ro zhes smra na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phra ma byed 'dod pas che ge mo zhig zer ro zhes smra na'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, “If one who wishes to engage in divisive speech says, ‘So-and-so says this.’”

original: 'dir skyon nyid kyang yan lag ma yin la rung ba ma yin pa bsams pa nyid kyang bram ze la sogs pas so //
analyzed: 'dir skyon nyid kyang yan lag ma yin la rung ba ma yin pa bsams pa nyid kyang bram ze la sogs pas so //
translated: Here, even the fault is not a limb, and the intended meaning is also not proper, even by Brahmins and so forth.

original: bye brag tu smra ba'i sgra la tha dad par byas pa nyid kyi phyir de bas na mi brten pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba'i sgra la tha dad par byas pa nyid kyi phyir de bas na mi brten pa'o //
translated: Because the Vaibhāṣika makes a distinction in the word, therefore it is not reliable.

original: spyir yang che ge mo zhig zer ro zhes bya ba brjod pa 'di la ltung ba cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: spyir yang che ge mo zhig zer ro zhes bya ba brjod pa 'di la ltung ba cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Also, in general, if one says, So-and-so says this, what is the downfall in this expression?

original: de'i phyir gal te ming nas so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te ming nas so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, If by name.

original: che ge mo zhig zer ro zhes bya ba gal te de'i ming gis smos par byed na gal te ming gis che ge mo de la brjod par byed na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: che ge mo zhig zer ro zhes bya ba gal te de'i ming gis smos par byed na gal te ming gis che ge mo de la brjod par byed na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one says, So-and-so says this, if one expresses it by that person's name, if one says, So-and-so says this, that is the meaning.

original: de yang dge slong nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi ming des gal te brjod na zhes bya ba smos par byad na gal te de la dge slong nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de yang dge slong nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba ni gang gi ming des gal te brjod na zhes bya ba smos par byad na gal te de la dge slong nyid yin na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And that is also a monk, if it is by that name, if one expresses it by that name, if that is a monk, that is the meaning.

original: dge slong nyid ma yin pa la gcig gam gnyis po dag la nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong nyid ma yin pa la gcig gam gnyis po dag la nyes byas so zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas rtogs par bya'o //
translated: If it is not a fully ordained monk, there is an offense of wrong conduct for each of the two, following this, it should be understood.

original: gzhan du ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni go bar byed pa ma yin pas rnam gcod la rigs la sogs pa dang ldan pas brjod pa la nyes byas so //
analyzed: gzhan du ni nyes byas so zhes bya ba ni go bar byed pa ma yin pas rnam gcod la rigs la sogs pa dang ldan pas brjod pa la nyes byas so //
translated: Otherwise, there is an offense of wrong conduct is not understood, so it is an offense for one who is not a fully ordained monk to speak of the exclusion, etc.

original: phra ma byed pa'i ltung byed do /
analyzed: phra ma byed pa'i ltung byed do /
translated: The downfall of divisive speech.

original: // / shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni 'du shes la byed pa po nyid gtso cher zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: // / shes gtso bo zhes bya ba ni 'du shes la byed pa po nyid gtso cher zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word chief refers to the agent of perception.

original: 'du shes gang las she na /
analyzed: 'du shes gang las she na /
translated: From what perception?🔽 Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir dge slong gnyis kyi rtsod pa nyid dge 'dun gyis legs par zhi bar byas pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smos te /🔽rtsod pa la dge 'dun gyi yang dag par dge 'dun gyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong gnyis kyi rtsod pa nyid dge 'dun gyis legs par zhi bar byas pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba smos te / rtsod pa la dge 'dun gyi yang dag par dge 'dun gyis so //
translated: In the case of a dispute between two fully ordained monks, which is properly resolved by the Saṅgha,🔽 In a dispute, the Saṅgha is the agent of the Saṅgha.

original: dge 'dun la yang rtsod pa nyid la 'du shes la byed pa po nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dge 'dun la yang rtsod pa nyid la 'du shes la byed pa po nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the Saṅgha, the dispute itself is the agent of perception, meaning the agent of the perception.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhi la rtsod pa'i gzhir 'du shes pa zhes bya ba @182a * //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi la rtsod pa'i gzhir 'du shes pa zhes bya ba @182a * //

analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhi la 'du shes gang zhig rnyed pa de 'dis bsdus pa yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du dge slong dang dge tshul dang dge slob ma dang dge tshul ma la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, it is said, “a fully ordained monk, a novice monk, a female trainee, a novice nun, etc.”

analyzed: skyo sngogs so zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ma yin par byas pa nyid du 'byung ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Dissembling” means that it is not as it appears.

analyzed: yang las su byas pa yang bya ba nyid kyis shes pa 'dir gang zhig smos pa de 'dir nges pa can gyi chos la rjes su brjod pa'o //
translated: Here, that which is mentioned is the definite dharma.

original: yang dag par bya ba 'byung ba la skyo sngogs byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par bya ba 'byung ba la skyo sngogs byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is dissembling in the arising of the real action.

original: de bas na 'dir bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'dir bsdu ba'o //
translated: Therefore, it is included here.

original: gang zag ji lta bu dang kha na ma tho ba ji lta bu la 'dir 'du shes kyi byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag ji lta bu dang kha na ma tho ba ji lta bu la 'dir 'du shes kyi byed pa po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of person and what kind of offense are the agent of the conception here?

original: de'i phyir gnyug mar gnas pa dang las byed pa dang 'dun pa 'bul ba rnams kho na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba smos to //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyug mar gnas pa dang las byed pa dang 'dun pa 'bul ba rnams kho na dngos gzhi'o zhes bya ba smos to //
translated: Therefore, it is said, “only the natural, the acting, and the offering of the intention are the basis.”

original: des 'di rnams la yang dag par bzhag pa nyid la nges pa zhes bya ba 'di las mdun du gang zhig 'du shes par gyur pa nyid kyi skyo sngogs byed pa de 'di rnams la dngos gzhi'o //
analyzed: des 'di rnams la yang dag par bzhag pa nyid la nges pa zhes bya ba 'di las mdun du gang zhig 'du shes par gyur pa nyid kyi skyo sngogs byed pa de 'di rnams la dngos gzhi'o //
translated: For them, the very establishment of these is called “certainty.”  What is imagined to be in front of them is just a pretext.  That is the main point for them.

original: dngos gzhi'i gnas la yang gzhan la nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos gzhi'i gnas la yang gzhan la nyes byas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: And in the main point, it is said that there is a fault in relation to others.

original: shes gtso bo zhes bya ba 'di la spros pa 'di rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes gtso bo zhes bya ba 'di la spros pa 'di rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the main point.  This elaboration should be understood here.

original: lta ba smra ba dang glo bur du 'ongs pa dag la ni nyes byas kho na'o zhes bya ba ni glo bur du 'ongs pa nyid yin pas rgyus mi shes pa'i phyir rtsod pa'i gzhi dang bcas pa la 'di thog ma dang bar dang tha mar mngon par
analyzed: lta ba smra ba dang glo bur du 'ongs pa dag la ni nyes byas kho na'o zhes bya ba ni glo bur du 'ongs pa nyid yin pas rgyus mi shes pa'i phyir rtsod pa'i gzhi dang bcas pa la 'di thog ma dang bar dang tha mar mngon par
translated: For those who speak of views and for those who have newly arrived, there is only a fault.  Because they are newly arrived, they do not know the reason, so they have a basis for dispute.  This is the beginning, middle, and end.

original: mi shes pa'i lta ba smas pa nyid ni skyo sngogs byed pa 'di dag gi lta ba smra bar byed pa dag ni 'di mi 'dod ces bya ba nges pa 'di dag la yang dag par bzhag pa nyid la nges pa med ces bya ba de'i phyir gang
analyzed: mi shes pa'i lta ba smas pa nyid ni skyo sngogs byed pa 'di dag gi lta ba smra bar byed pa dag ni 'di mi 'dod ces bya ba nges pa 'di dag la yang dag par bzhag pa nyid la nges pa med ces bya ba de'i phyir gang
translated: The view of the ignorant is just a useless exercise. Those who propound the view of useless exercise say, “We do not accept this.” They are not certain about the correct establishment of these. Therefore,

original: zhig rgyus mi shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhig rgyus mi shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: what is the cause of their ignorance?

original: skyo sngogs byed pa de bas na 'di ni nyes byas so //
analyzed: skyo sngogs byed pa de bas na 'di ni nyes byas so //
translated: The useless exercise is a fault.

original: rtsod pa gzhan nyid la rtsod pa gzhan du shes pa ni de dang 'dra ba nyid @182b yin no zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa gzhan nyid kyis 'du shes pa la rtsod pa de dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtsod pa gzhan nyid la rtsod pa gzhan du shes pa ni de dang 'dra ba nyid @182b yin no zhes bya ba ni rtsod pa gzhan nyid kyis 'du shes pa la rtsod pa de dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: The recognition of one dispute as another dispute is just like that. The recognition of one dispute as another dispute is just the possession of that dispute.

original: rtsod pa gzhan nyid ni ngag gis 'di'i 'du shes pa ni der gyur pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rtsod pa gzhan nyid ni ngag gis 'di'i 'du shes pa ni der gyur pa nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The recognition of one dispute as another dispute is the recognition of that by speech. The meaning is that it becomes that.

original: na smad pa'i ngo bo la 'di bstan pa'o //
analyzed: na smad pa'i ngo bo la 'di bstan pa'o //
translated: The nature of the reproach is taught here.

original: 'dir rtsod pa nyid tshad mar yin gyi de'i bye brag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dir rnam par gzhag pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rtsod pa nyid tshad mar yin gyi de'i bye brag ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'dir rnam par gzhag pa 'di yin no //
translated: Here, the very dispute is valid, not its particular. This is the presentation.

original: ltung ba'i phyir rtsod pa nyid du 'du shes pa la ni na smad pa med do //
analyzed: ltung ba'i phyir rtsod pa nyid du 'du shes pa la ni na smad pa med do //
translated: There is no fault for one who perceives the dispute itself as a downfall.

original: de bzhin du gzhan las ta de'i phyir 'di byed pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan las ta de'i phyir 'di byed pa'o //
translated: Similarly, from another, it is the same. Therefore, this is done.

original: las kyi 'bras bu la gnas pa la de ma yin pa nyid kyis kun du spyod pa la ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni las kyi 'bras bu la gnas pa la ni shes pa la sogs pa'i las kyi 'bras bu thob pa la las kyi 'bras
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu la gnas pa la de ma yin pa nyid kyis kun du spyod pa la ni phyed nyid do zhes bya ba ni las kyi 'bras bu la gnas pa la ni shes pa la sogs pa'i las kyi 'bras bu thob pa la las kyi 'bras
translated: For one abiding in the result of karma, half for engaging in what is not that. For one abiding in the result of karma, half for engaging in what is not that means for one abiding in the result of karma, who has obtained the result of karma such as knowledge, engaging in what is not that,

original: bu la gnas pa der gnas pa nyid kyi kun du spyod pa la ni phyed nyid do //
analyzed: bu la gnas pa der gnas pa nyid kyi kun du spyod pa la ni phyed nyid do //
translated: for one abiding in that result of karma, half for engaging in what is not that.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa'i kun du spyod pa nyid la ni nyes byas su 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i kun du spyod pa nyid la ni nyes byas su 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: For one who engages in the complete, there is an offense. This is the meaning.

original: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong gis bslab pa byin pa la 'di skad ces khyod bslab pa po ma yin no zhes bgyis na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa dge slong gis bslab pa byin pa la 'di skad ces khyod bslab pa po ma yin no zhes bgyis na ltung ba cir 'gyur nyes byas su 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says, “If one says to a monk who has given the training, ‘You are not a teacher of the training,’ what is the offense?” The answer is, “It is an offense of wrong conduct.”🔽🔽

original: skyo sngogs byed pa'o /🔽// /'di la byed pa po nyid ni bud med do //
analyzed: skyo sngogs byed pa'o / // /'di la byed pa po nyid ni bud med do //
translated: Here, the text is: “If one says to a monk who is giving the precepts, ‘You are not a teacher of the precepts,’ what is the offense?” The answer is: “It is an offense of wrong conduct.”🔽Here, the agent is a woman.

original: khyim pa mo la ston pa la'o //
analyzed: khyim pa mo la ston pa la'o //
translated: The teacher is a layperson.

original: skyes pa med par ro //
analyzed: skyes pa med par ro //
translated: Without a man.

original: reg pa'o zhes bya ba sngar bstan pa de la nye bar mi gnas pa nyid la reg pa'i skyes pa la bstan pa'i ltung byed gang la byed pa po nyid bud med yin zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa'o zhes bya ba sngar bstan pa de la nye bar mi gnas pa nyid la reg pa'i skyes pa la bstan pa'i ltung byed gang la byed pa po nyid bud med yin zhe na /
translated: Touching is as previously explained. In that, what is the offense for teaching a man who is not present, where the agent is a woman?

original: de'i phyir ston pa la'o zhes bya ba ni smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir ston pa la'o zhes bya ba ni smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said “to a teacher.”

original: ci zhig ston pa la zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig ston pa la zhe na /
translated: What is taught to a teacher?

original: de'i phyir chos so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said “the Dharma.”

original: grong 'di'i lam 'di ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa las yang dag pa'i bsam pas chos kyi rjes su 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: grong 'di'i lam 'di ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa las yang dag pa'i bsam pas chos kyi rjes su 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: “This is not the path to the village,” and so on, one should follow the Dharma with right intention.

original: 'dir brdzun pa'i dngos po la ni sgo yin te gang zhig bud med la rang dbang med par 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir brdzun pa'i dngos po la ni sgo yin te gang zhig bud med la rang dbang med par 'tshe ba'o //
translated: Here, the door is a false thing, for it is that by which one is harmed without one's own consent.

original: 'di'i phyir rang dgar smra ba'i rnam pas dpe yin te zhes bya ba 'di la 'dir bslab pa'i gzhi dang 'brel pa'i cho ga drug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su bzung ba'o //🔽mkhas pas gong nas gong du zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang 'dri ba ste ji tsam las she na /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir rang dgar smra ba'i rnam pas dpe yin te zhes bya ba 'di la 'dir bslab pa'i gzhi dang 'brel pa'i cho ga drug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yongs su bzung ba'o // mkhas pas gong nas gong du zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang 'dri ba ste ji tsam las she na /
translated: For this reason, the example is stated in the form of speaking freely, and here the six rules of training are included, beginning with one should not drink alcohol.

original: de'i phyir tshig drug pa las lhag par ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig drug pa las lhag par ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The wise one should ask, How much? and so on, and the answer is more than six words.

original: gang zag ji lta bus she na /
analyzed: gang zag ji lta bus she na /
translated: If one asks, By what kind of person?
